En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ropa y verduras y para ello Enma viaja constante por las riberas del rio Ucayali a los diferentes caseríos ofreciendo sus productos, los cuales tienen mucha demanda.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual será pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropa como polos, pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas, zapatos y diversos tipos de verduras.

Enma nos dice que es un alivio trabajar con Mamuela Ramos porque gracias a los préstamos, tanto nuestros negocios como nuestras ganancias crecen.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Kayembe's Ujira Mwema Group

texts.en:
Kayembe is 35 years old and married with one 10-yr.-old child. She and her husband also take care of another person, age 58. Kayembe owns a small food store, which she opened in 2005. She works every day from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Kayembe would like a loan of $275 to increase the inventory of her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member July , who also has a food vending business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her grocery store

loans.name: Fajar

texts.id:
Translated from bahasa Indonesia by Carlos Patriawan , Kiva Volunteer.

F. activity every day is travelling everyday looking for the second-hand items by driving his motorcycle from Kuta to Gianyar. Usually the second hand item is taken directly from his customer who already prepared the items that already is not used and usually has been paid before.

After that F. afterwards brough the second hand items to his house where his wife Nanik is ready to sort the second-hand in accordance with its quality before ready to be sold.

F. expected the loan as capital to buy second-hand items and hope the profit that after getting the loan at this time is to be bigger thus he should be able to fulfil the requirement for his family.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is an experienced and ambitious entrepreneur who operates a flourishing grocery store in San Cristobal. This businesswoman is also the mother of three school-going children.

She explains that she had been operating a similar store in her hometown. Two years ago, she moved to a rural community in San Cristobal, and opened a new business. This entrepreneur says that, in her business sector, there hadn’t been a grocery store as well stocked as hers, so she seized the opportunity and established her business, which is flourishing at the present time.

With her loan, this entrepreneur will buy an assortment of goods to add to her inventory so she can meet the needs of her customers. Leonarda intends to save the extra business profits in order to start the construction of her own house.

loans.use: To a larger variety of goods in bulk to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en:
Vegetable sales are a flourishing business in Tajikistan for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables. A. Nuriddin has been selling fruits and vegetables in Dushanbe for the past 2 years. He began his own stall with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur.

Nuriddin began selling in “Ganj” market with very little stock to offer his clients. Slowly he began to increase the goods offered until he managed to get a permanent market stall. Currently his stall is his pride and joy, with a zinc roof and ceramic tiles on the floor.

Nuriddin is the father of three young children who are in school. Like any father, he is doing his best in order to offer his children the best future and to make them well-educated. Now he needs a loan of 2400 Somoni ($700) in order to increase the stock of his goods. He promises to repay the loan within 3 months and expresses his gratitude to everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Increase the range of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan, 32 years old and single, lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He is the owner of a small laundry.  He needs a loan  of US$1,200 to purchase a new laundry machine with more functions than the one he currently owns. Hassan also wants to restructure his shop in order to expand his business. This is the first time Hassan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase a new laundry machine

loans.name: Giovanny Marizela

texts.es:
Opening a spare auto parts store is the goal of Giovanny, 38 years old, who has the help of her husband who is also a merchant. She has been selling sacs as a traveling saleswoman in Huaraz for almost 11 years.

With four children and a house being built, she struggles with the evictions that the municipality enforces, so she carries her sacs on the shoulder and walking she delivers her sacs on the market days in Huaraz.

She belongs to the “Señor del Cautivo II” community bank. With this loan of 800 Soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will invest in her business buying 200 sacs and also merchandise for her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Abrir una tienda de tornos y repuestos de Autos es la meta de Giovanny de 38 años, quien tiene la ayuda de su esposo que también es comerciante, ella vende por casi 11 años costales de manera ambulatoria en las calles de Huaraz.

Con cuatro hijos y una casa en construcción, día a día, ella lucha con los desalojos que les hacen los municipales, así que carga sus costales al hombro y caminando va repartiendo sus costales en los días de feria en Huaraz.

Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor del Cautivo II”. Con este préstamo de S/. 800 soles, el cual pagará en 6 cuotas, implementará su negocio, comprará dos cientos de costales y también mercadería para su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase of sacs at wholesale prices

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La Sra. Esperanza habita en el barrio Hialeah, tiene 43 años de edad, con tres hijos de 12,14 y 19 años de edad, los cuales están cursando la secundaria. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada en servicios de vigilancias y siempre está pendiente de la familia. Doña Esperanza alquila cuartos así como también alquila teléfono, tiene tres años de tener este negocio y comenzó con la intención de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar pues el sueldo es un poco bajo, inició alquilando un cuarto, pero ha tenido mas clientela y ahora alquila más cuartos. La solicitud del crédito es para construir una pila grande para almacenar agua, ya que el agua se va a menudo y necesita asegurar el líquido a sus inquilinos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esperenza lives in the Hialeah neighborhood and is 43 years old with three children, who are 12, 14, and 19 years old who are in school. Her husband works in a private factory in security and is always firm with the family. Esperanza rents rooms as well as rents a telephone. She has three years in this business, and she started with the intention of helping her husband with the household expense since his wage is a little low. She started renting one room, but she has had more customers and now she rents more rooms. The loan she is asking for is to construct a large battery to store water, now that the water works less often and she needs to secure liquid for her tenants.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a water tank

loans.name: Elmir

texts.en: Elmir A., 20 years old, is the only bread-winner in his family. Since 2005, Elmir has been running his own office supply and slipper sales business, based in a rented place next to his house. He competes effectively with the big stores in the vicinity by offering prices that are more attractive. As a result, Elmir's business so far has been very successful. At present, he needs a loan of US$1,200 for a term of 15 months to be able to expand the business by purchasing additional office supplies for sale.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Yoen

texts.en:
Mr. Yoen P. and his wife Mrs. Chen Chea, who live in Kandal Leu Village in Kandal Province, are farmers cultivating rice to earn a living. Due to field infertility and low working capital, Yoen is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and petroleum for the farm pump.

Yoen P. is 64 years old and the father of seven children, three employed in a garment factory while others two are farmers and another two children are at home. His wife is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy seeds of rice, fertilizers, and petroleum.

loans.name: Agip Cell A-Kudra Group

texts.en:
Kudra  N. is a jovial and hard working, single mother of 4,. She operates a restaurant next to the Agip petrol station in Mbarara. She rents the semi permanent structure for 20,000UGX per month. This business came into existence as a result of her small savings. As there is a  lack of the necessary equipment and utensils, the business earns a low income of 5,000UGX per week. She expects that by using the loan to purchase flasks, saucepans, charcoal stoves and other utensils, the business will increase rapidly. With four years experience in the business, her strength in attracting customers has been the remarkable standards of hygiene that she maintains at her premises. For her business to blossom, she wants to install modern chairs, counters and other furniture.

With sufficient funds, Kudra’s desire is to become a matooke (plantain) vendor in the capital where the food is in high demand. Her ambition is to see her children through school and on to university.

loans.use: Purchase flasks, saucepans, charcoal stoves and other equipment

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom H. is a farmer who lives in Svay Ta Thom village in Kampong Cham province. Her husband, Mr. Sot Seng, helps her in the plantation. They have seven children. One is a laborer; one is a horse cart driver; four are attending the local school; and the youngest, who is only one year old, is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Mom H.'s second son, the horse cart driver, has problems with his horse, so Mrs. Mom H. decided to ask for a loan to buy him another horse to re-start his business.

Mrs. Mom H. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a horse to pull a cart

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame F. is divorced and has 5 dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Maame sells clothing at Mpoben in Elmina, which she has done since 1996. Maame uses her income for paying rent, utility bills and other financial expenses.

Maame will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of clothing and fabric to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her large family.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to increase sales

loans.name: Mrs. Pheakk Kdey Hoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine people and is located in Por village in the Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Pheakk Kdey H. is a village bank president. She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. On her second plantation, she grows beans but unfortunately she faces an obstacle because her field has been damaged by insects. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Pheakk Kdey H. has decided to request a loan to buy pesticides to kill all kinds of insects. She is a 23-year-old widow with a child who is too young to work or study.

All members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for her plantation.

loans.name: Tat's Group
loans.use: To buy hundreds of kilograms of pork for her business

loans.name: Opeta

texts.en: Opeta A., 39, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the villagers and the public 4 days per week. She has received 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Opeta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchasing equipment needed for improving her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria Palenapais twenty-two years old and single with no children.  She has two years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the villagers/general public two days a week. She has one previous loan with SPBD, a Kiva field partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $120.  SPBD loans are Victoria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, needles and a secondhand sewing machine.

loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en:
Isaac Kiloe has been in business repairing fridges since 1992. He works from 8 am to 5 pm daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $111. He is 41 and married with two children, ages 13 and 7 years.

This will be Isaac’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy gas, copper stick and bronze and has paid back the loans successfully. He hopes to get this third loan to increase his capital so that he can improve his business.

Isaac will share this loan with Subgroup D of the Msasani group. This subgroup has six members, who run a salon, sell charcoal and clothes. These members hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. 

In the picture, Isaac is the only man.

loans.use: To increase capital for fridge repair business

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Sixto tiene 56 años, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia con su pareja, con quien tuvo 6 hijos, y por quienes trabaja duro para darles educación, por lo que todos ellos migraron a diversas ciudades a estudiar. La agricultura y la albañilería son las actividades que realiza diariamente de forma alternada, las veces que le solicitan sus servicios de albañil trabaja de 7 a 10 días corridos en la obra, y el resto de días a sus cultivos de hortalizas, donde mayormente siembra zanahorias y espinacas. Para ello se levanta muy temprano para trabajar en sus tierras, y a eso de las 8.00am regresa a su casa a desayunar, en seguida regresa en compañía de su esposa a seguir trabajando en sus sembríos, puesto que gracias a la agricultura puede brindarles educación y comodidades a sus hijos. Los años le han permitido tener la experiencia para ser un buen agricultor, puesto que esos conocimientos los emplea a diario en sus labores para velar por el buen desarrollo de cada una de sus plantas. Sixto espera incrementar sus sembrios en chacras alquiladas, donde, con la ayuda de su bicicleta, transporta fácilmente todos sus cultivos.  Sixto es un cliente muy responsable y el primero en pagar las cuotas mensuales, asimismo apoya en comunicar a los demás integrantes de haber una reunión extraordinaria de su banco comunal, este es su 9no crédito con MFP, y es muy respetado por los demás integrantes por la responsabilidad mostrada. Con los 1500 soles solicitados comprará fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus chacras de hortalizas.
texts.en:
Sixto is 56 years old and he is a very responsible and hardworking man. He lives in his own house with his common-law wife, with whom he had 6 children. He has worked hard to give them all an education and they have all gone to different cities to study. He works in agriculture and masonry. When his masonry services are solicited, he works 7 to 10 days straight in the job, and the rest of the time he grows vegetables, mostly carrots and spinach. He gets up very early to work his land and returns to the house at 8:00am to eat breakfast. He then returns to the fields, in the company of his wife, to continue working with his crops. It is thanks to agriculture that he is able to provide for the education and needs of his children. The years have granted him the experience that he needs to be a good farmer. He uses this knowledge everyday to work toward the healthy growth of each one of his plants. Sixto hopes to increase his crops in rented plots, from which, with the help of his bicycle, he easily transports all of his crops. Sixto is a very responsible client and the first to make his monthly payments. He also helps out by informing the other members if there is an unscheduled meeting of their communal bank. This is his 9th loan with MFP and he is very respected by the other members because of the responsibility he has demonstrated. With the requested 1500 PEN, he will buy chemical fertilizers for his vegetable plots.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Nuevo Atardecer Group

texts.es: El grupo “Nuevo Atardecer” esta representado por la señora Miguelina, Jenny y Dalia que son su presidenta, tesorera y secretaria. La mayoría  se dedican al comercio de venta de productos como refrescos, comida, cosméticos por catalogo y otros se dedican a la elaboración de chompas de lana y al servicio de enfermería. El M. tiene un alto nivel competitivo pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y a su fuerza de voluntada como lo demuestra la señora Silvia que a pesar de estar impedida para caminar realiza trabajos de tejidos que comercializa para sacar adelante a su familia. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición de  mercadería, materia prima e instrumentos de trabajo que ayuden a genera mayores ingresos y a mejorar la calida de vida de sus familias. A pesar de que el grupo es relativamente nuevo han demostrado entusiasmo, unidad y responsabilidad por lo que la fundación Agrocapital les brinda el apoyo económico que necesitan.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Atardecer group is represented by Miguelina, Jenny and Dalia; they are the president, treasurer and secretary. The majority of them sell products like soft drinks, meals, and cosmetics by catalog. Others make wool sweaters; some are nurses. The market has a high level of competition, but the group members know how to get ahead thanks to their experience and personal strength. Silvia demonstrates this. In spite of not being able to walk, she knits and sells her knitting products to get her family ahead. The loan is to acquire merchandise, raw materials, and work instruments to help generate greater income and improve the quality of life of their families. In spite of the fact that the group is relatively new, they have demonstrated enthusiasm, unity, and responsibility for the Agrocapital foundation. Agrocapital offers them the economic support that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ebenezer #2 Group

texts.en:
Viola is a widow who is raising her 3 children as well as 4 others who lost their parents.  All of the children she cares for are in school, but she has to send them to government schools, which are not that good in her area. 

Viola’s business is selling drinks like soda, energy drinks, and even beers.  She says that her business seems to be going very well and it really encourages her to see it growing.  She says that her business attracts customers because she has all of her products clearly on display.  

Viola requested this loan from LEAP because she wants to restock her drinks supply. With this loan she will be able to buy cartons of most of the products that she sells.

loans.use: To buy crates of Red Bull, soda, and beer

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus T. is from the town of Benoni, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 42 years old. Venus is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Venus owns and operates a variety (sari-sari) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Venus is just starting this business.

In 2009, Venus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venus is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Venus from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mrs. Sor E. is a married mother, 44 years old, who is blessed with six children. Three of her children are employed: two daughters work as seamstresses in the garment factory and one is a plantation worker.

Sor E. and her husband have their current business of fishing. On the other hand, this couple has always cultivated rice on their own farmland during the crop season. Recently, Sor E.’s rice crop, lacking fertilizer, is not growing after planting. She is therefore applying for a loan to buy more fertilizer to fatten her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to fatten her crop yield

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita L. is from the village of Timogsay, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 41 years old. Marcelita is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelita owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marcelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Marcelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marcelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is thankful because of the blessings that she had received in her life. She is 52 years old and happily married to Wilfredo L.. The couple is blessed with four children. The eldest is Joel who is now 30 years old and a college graduate; next is Julius - 29 years old who is a college graduate also, third is Jeffrey - 21 years old, a college graduate also and the youngest is Jennifer - 5 years old and in grade school. Josephine is a dressmaker and at the same time she is also a dealer of cosmetics products in their village. She needed additional capital in order to strengthen her tailoring business and also to improve her cosmetics direct selling activity. That’s why Josephine is requesting a loan from KIVA amounting to PHP10, 000 for her business improvement. She said that through this amount that she is requesting, she will be able to provide the educational needs of her youngest daughter.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela es casada con el señor santiago Eduardo Garcia y son padres de una hermosa niña de edad escolar.
Ella labora para una clínica como jefa de enfermeras desde hace 2 años, su esposo trabaja para una clínica de primeros auxilios como radioperador, desde hace un año.
Ellos están solicitando este crédito para las instalaciones eléctricas de su vivienda ya que se quemaron y están batallando por concepto de la luz.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gabriela is married to Mr. Santiago Eduardo Garcia and both are parents of a beautiful girl of school age.

Gabriela has been working as head nurse for a clinic for two years. Since a year ago, her husband works for a first aid clinic as a radio operator.

They need a loan to install electricity in their home as it burnt out and they are in dire need of light.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install electricity in her home.

loans.name: San Cayetano (Comitte De Mujeres) Group

texts.en:
This committee formed in the Neighborhood Toro Blanco of the city of Caaguazú. Sebastiana A. knew the Program through her sister-in-law, who is the president of another comittee, and she was very interested to participate in a Comittee of Women program, where 20 women could work that wanted to secure a profession. With much enthusiasm they formed a group where women could responsibily work together. They are independent with their jobs, where they sell clothes, shoes, food, groceries, and they receive credit. Some received 800,000 gs, other took loans for 600,000 gs, 5000,000 gs, and 300,000 gs, and they invested in buying sugar, beef, wheat, eggs, cheese, shirts, and they want to progress with their loans with Fundación Paraguaya. 
Sebastiana A. wants to use her loan for a small grocery store. 
Grismilda B. S. wants to use her loan for a small grocery store. 
María I. S. wants to use her loan to sell new clothes. 
María R. A. wants to use her loan to sell fruits and vegetables. 
Lucia E. wants to use her loan to sell chickens. 
Elvira B. A. wants to use her loan to sell new clothes. 
Balbina A. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Gregoria M. M. wants to use his loan to sell fruit. 
A. M. wants to use her loan to sell animal kidneys and liver. 
I. L. wants to use her loan to sell new clothes. 
Aquilina V. wants to use her loan to sell new clothes and undergarments. 
Mabel A. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Eulalia G. wants to use her loan to sell fruits and vegetables. 
Ildenfonza V. wants to use her loan for a small grocery store. 
Lucia R. M. wants to use her loan to sell food. 
Felicia P. wants to use her loan to sell fruits and vegetables. 
Ceferina C. wants to use her loan to be a dressmaker. 
Delia C. E. wants to use her loan for a small grocery store. 
Delos S. A. A. wants to use her loan for her bartending business. 
Claudia E. wants to use her loan for a small grocery store.

loans.use: Produce, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer dinámica y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 20 años, es madre de una niña, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, actividad que realiza con su esposo. Mercedes forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Claritas 2” desde hace un año, su primer crédito fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en venta de gaseosas, leche fresca y yogurt.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será invertido en la compra de listones y tablas para su negocio de venta de materiales de construcción. La meta de Mercedes es tener una tienda de confecciones.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a dynamic and persistent woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, region of Ucayali, Peru. She is a 20-year-old mother of a young daughter and makes a living buying and selling wood, an activity she carries out with her husband. Mercedes has been a part of the "Las Claritas 2" Community Bank for the past year, and her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to invest in the purchase of soft drinks, fresh milk and yogurt to sell. Currently she is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles (approximately $350), which she plans to use to invest in the purchase of wooden beams and planks for her business selling construction materials. Mercedes' goal is to have a sewing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wooden beams and planks

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda M. is from the village of Panduma Sr., Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Minda owns and operates a specialized "saging" (banana or plantain) retail store, buying and selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Minda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional bananas to sell. Minda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: O. Justine

texts.fr: A. O. Justine est née le 09 Mars 1981 à Adja-Ouèrè au Bénin. Justine est mariée à HOUNKPATIN Evrard, un patissier. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui vivent avec leurs parents. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Justine a fréquenté jusqu'au cours secondaire. Il y a trois ans de cela que Justine vend des divers (sardine, pâtes alimentaire, sacs de riz, savons, papiers hygiéniques, eau en sachet "Pur Water", etc.)de même que des boissons dans sa boutique sise à Avotrou, à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Justine s'approvisionne. Justine a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé et l'a bien remboursé. C'est pour renforcer son stock de produits et mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, que Justine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. O. Justine was born on March 9, 1981 in Adja-Ouèrè in Benin. She is married to HOUNKPATIN Evrard, a pastry chef. The couple has two children who are both in school and living with their parents. The couple provides for the family jointly. Justine has attended secondary school. For three years, she has been selling a variety of goods (sardines, pasta, sacks of rice, soaps, toilet paper, "Pur Water" pouches of water, etc.), as well as drinks in her shop located in Avotrou, Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She once had an ALIDé loan, and she repaid it. To bolster her stock of merchandise and to cope better with the demand of her customers, she’s requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Various goods (sardines, pasta, sacks of rice, soaps, etc.)

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Gracia”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 32 años y es madre de 02 hijos que aun depende de ella.

Carmen Rosa, lleva 05 años dedicándose al trabajo de manualidades, nos cuenta que desde su adolescencia, siempre le aficiono los tejidos y las manualidades. Para iniciarse mas a fondo en este negocio, decidió sacar un prestamo la cual Manuela Ramos la apoyo con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00, implementando su pequeño negocio, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose conocida.

En la Actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y ahora ya tiene una clientela fija que mes a mes realizan sus pedidos, ya que ella trabaja así y como también va ofreciendo a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, le va muy bien y mensualmente genera sus propios ingresos y con el carisma que tiene sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará materiales para realizar sus manualidades como: hilos de bordar, tren y perlas, felpa, cintas de ceda en diferentes  colores, polipima y blondas en diferentes modelos. 

Carmen Rosa, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, feliz por que en su negocio le va muy bien. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Rosa is a member of the communal bank “María Gracia,” which is located in the Moyobamba district, of the Moyobamba province, of the Department, San Martín. She lives with her partner, is 32 years old, and is the mother of two dependent children. Carmen Rosa has worked with crafts for five years. She tells us that she has liked crafts and fabrics since she was a teenager. To develop this as a business, Carmen Rosa took out a loan with Manuela Ramos for 300.00.soles and bit-by-bit gained a reputation. She still has the same business today, now with regular customers who place monthly orders. Now that she is making it, she also sells to her friends, acquaintances, and neighbors. It’s going very well and she earns her own income each month and with the star quality her product has, people come to her by word of mouth. With this loan of 3,000.00 soles, she will buy materials to make her crafts like: thread, pearls and trains, felt, silk ribbons of varying colors, polipima and different styles of doilies. Carmen Rosa is happy with what she has achieved and happy that her business is successful. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business, and for helping lots of other women who want to be grow their businesses. .

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make crafts.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is a forty–five year-old married mother of five children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Comfort works hard to support her husband in providing for the family. She trades in maize and plantains, which she buys in bags from nearby towns. Comfort has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure more bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk so that she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con sus dos hijos. 
El señor Juan Carlos trabaja como empleado de la administración publica, en el puesto de empleado de mensajería, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de los pisos de su vivienda que en la actualidad son de tierra.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos C. lives with his two children in his own house. They live in the Pasankeri area on the west side of the city of La Paz. Juan Carlos is employed by the public administration as a messenger. This income supports his family. The loan he is requesting is to fix the dirt floors in his house. This is the third time that he has asked for a loan. The completed socioeconomic analysis qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix the floors in his house

loans.name: Rea Richel

texts.en: Rea, 23 years old, is a pig farmer. She has one child. Her piggery is their only livelihood. The income she makes from raising pigs helps her family buy adequate food, clothing and other basic needs. She would like a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
La señora Eulalia es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 58 años, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos independientes de 28 y 35 años, se dedica a la venta diaria de abarrotes desde hace 20 años, Eulalia nos cuenta que los préstamos le han sido de mucha ayuda, ya que ha desde hace 5 meses ha implementado otro negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, sus ingresos cubren los gastos de pago de servicios, alimentos, alquiler de local, con el esfuerzo de labor diaria ha logrado mejorar sus ventas y  su segundo negocio. El gran sueño de Eulalia es tener un negocio mucho más grande y con variedad de prendas de vestir.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para la compra de mercadería escolar (blusas, camisas, uniformes). Eulalia agradece toda la ayuda que le han dado porque gracias a eso ha salido adelante, ha crecido y sigue creciendo junto con su familia y también  como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Eulalia, 58, is an enterprising woman. She lives with her life partner and has two, adult children, 28 and 35 years old. She has sold groceries for 20 years. Eulalia tells us that the loans have been very useful because five months ago she set up a clothing and shoe sales business. Her earnings cover utility, food, and rental costs. Her daily efforts have improved her sales and her second business. Eulalia's great wish is to have an even larger business with a wider selection of clothing articles. The recent loan granted will be used to buy school merchandise (blouses, shirts, uniforms). Eulalia is grateful for the help she has been given because, thanks to it, she has managed to get ahead, she's grown and continues to grow together with her ffamily and as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school merchandise (blouses, shirts, uniforms)

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es una amable mujer de 39 años, su esposo trabaja en otra ciudad y es por ello que sólo vive con sus 3 hijos de 21, 18 y 15 años, en su casa propia.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia.

Al estar lejos de su esposo vio por conveniente generar sus propios ingresos, ya que siempre ha trabajado y está acostumbrada a estar en permanente actividad. Es así que incursionó en variedad de oficios dedicándose anteriormente a la venta de bisutería, actividad que le resultó muy rentable en ciertas épocas del año; pero Luz necesitaba un negocio más estable es por ello que incursionó en la venta de comida, labor que le está trayendo grandes gratificaciones, pues tiene una sazón muy buena y cada día se hace de más clientes. Ella suele trabajar durante las mañanas entregando los almuerzos a domicilio a las personas que se lo solicitan, ya que no tiene un local donde ofrecer sus platillos, además esta forma de trabajo le da la ventaja de que no le sobre comida porque cocina sólo la cantidad de platillos que le solicitan. 

Este es el sexto préstamo de Luz con MFP, el trabajo con su grupo es muy bueno porque todas sus compañeras son muy responsables, siendo un grupo ejemplar en la institución. Con este préstamo comprará ingredientes para preparar sus platillos, además de algunos utensilios de cocina para facilitarse el trabajo.
texts.en:
Luz is a nice 39 year-old woman. Her husband works in another city, so she lives alone in her house with her three children who are 12, 18, and 15 years old. Being away from her husband, Luz thought it advisable to generate her own income. She has always worked and is used to being in a state of permanent activity. She has made forays into a variety of different fields. Previously, she sold costume jewelry, which was very profitable during certain times of the year, but Luz needed a more stable job so she started selling food. Selling food has brought Luz a lot of gratification, because she has really good seasoning and every day she has more clients. Luz usually works during the mornings to deliver lunches to the people who order them since she does not have a restaurant where she can serve them. Delivering food gives her the advantage of not having leftover food because she only cooks the number of plates people order. This is Luz's sixth loan with MFP. Her group is very good because all of the members are very responsible, making them one of the institution's exemplary groups. With this loan, Luz will buy the ingredients needed to prepare her food as well as some kitchen utensils to help with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for food

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is married with six children and she is 40 years old. Her husband is a teacher and he also supports their home.

Margret is an honest and happy woman. To make a living in Ughelli she sells cooking oil at retail prices to her customers. Cooking oil is used by Nigerians to prepare mouth-watering cooked foods. She sells her cooking oil in the market. She is hardworking and sells for long hours to enable her to support her family.

The demands for Margret’s cooking oil are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
A. is from the city Borewala, famous for its shrines in Pakistan.  Her husband is an auto-rickshaw driver by profession (three-wheeled motor vehicle).  He earns an income of Pak Rs.300 per day.  He has been in business for over 5 years. 

A. stays at home to look after their children and to tend to household chores.  She is requesting a loan of Pak Rs. 20,000 to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.use: Repair an auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Jenneth

texts.en:
Jenneth S., from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, is a 28-year-old married mother of an infant. To make a living, Jenneth owns and operates a business venture providing transportation services "habal-habal" to the local community members. Jenneth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jenneth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, she is requesting a new loan, her third, of 5000 PHP as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen es una joven audaz de 21 años, está separada de su pareja, con quien tiene un pequeña hija de 2 años, vive en la casa de sus padres.

En busca de su progreso, se esmera por hacer bien las actividades que desarrolla y trata de aprovechar al máximo su tiempo, pues desde hace 3 años se dedica a alquilar y vender videos (películas), mercería y joyería.
Paralelamente, por las mañanas, es locutora radial y posteriormente se desempeña como secretaria de una tienda de comestibles. A su vez, los fines de semana estudia periodismo en una institución de su localidad. Sus actividades son muy rentables, pues le permiten vivir cómodamente y ahorrar para más adelante comprar un terreno en la ciudad y construir su casa propia. En tanto Karen, continua enseñándole a su hija que la esperanza es lo último que se pierde.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y confía en que no defraudará a su banco comunal porque le agrada laborar con ellos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de videos (DVD´s), además de joyas que comercializará entre sus amistades.
texts.en:
Karen is a bold young woman who is 21 years of age. She is separated from her spouse with whom she has a two year old daughter. Karen lives in the house of her parents.

In hopes of making progress, Karen strives do well in all of her activities and make the most of her time. For the past three years, she has been offering movie videos for rent and for sale, sewing supplies, and jewelry. In addition, she works as a radio announcer in the mornings and then goes to her other job as a secretary for a grocery business. On the weekends, she studies journalism at a local institution. Her various activities generate sufficient income for her to live comfortably. In the future, she wants to buy a plot of land in the city so that she can build her own home. Karen continues to teach her daughter that hope is the last thing one can lose.

This is her third loan with MFP. Karen tries not to disappoint her Communal Bank because she enjoys working with them. The money she requested will be used to buy a large quantity of videos (DVDs) and jewelry to sell to her friends.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase videos & jewelry to sell

loans.name: Jehly

texts.en:
41-year-old Jehly B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is is married and has two children, her eldest being only twelve years old.

Jehly owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale and has been engaged in her business for over nine years already.

Jehly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and young crops to raise. This loan will be her eighth from CEVI.

Jehly plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide for the needs of her household and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure and young crops to raise

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: Leandro S. A., tiene la edad de 25 años, está soltero, y no tiene hijos, vive con su madre. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Leandro  tiene varios años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Leandro S. A. is 25 years old and single. He does not have children. He lives with his mother. He wants the loan to buy some calves and for their feed. He wants to take care of the livestock adequately in order to get the greatest income possible when he sells them. He also wants to increase the number of animals he has. He wants to be able to keep them under better conditions. He has an ideal place to raise the cattle. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms of the loan he got. Leandro has been working with livestock for several years. In the future he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Yusufali

texts.ru: Акачонов Юсуфали проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 44 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. У него магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Этот бизнес приносит доход. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Yusufali A. lives in the Khuroson district. He is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a secondary education and has been involved in retail sales for over 5 years. Yusufali has a store, where he sells food products. This business earns him an income. He is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Ma. Ninfa

texts.en:
Ma. Ninfa O. has been a member of ASHI since 2009. Hoping to change the kind of lifestyle her family is having right now, and without any further training to manage a business, she had the courage to request a loan to invest in putting up a sari-sari (variety) store. This way she would be able to have her own income and augment her husband’s small income as a hired laborer.

Paying for all the expenses her family requires every day from the income generated by her sari-sari store and from her husband’s income, most often Ma. Ninfa feels insecure about sustaining her business and the education of her children. However, with the opportunity to request a loan from ASHI, her hopes are rekindled.

Now, Ma. Ninfa is requesting a much larger loan to increase the inventory of her sari-sari store. A sari-sari store is just a small store, either a cottage separated from the owner’s house or attached to the owner’s house. The inventories are composed of a few grocery items, foodstuffs, and beverages.

Ma. Ninfa, is looking forward to seeing her sari-sari store turning into a mini-grocery store that sells a large volume of grocery items, foodstuffs, and beverages. Unlike a sari-sari store, which can only sell retail, a mini-grocery store has the capacity to sell wholesale. Along with this she hopes that it will become sustainable and profitable, making her family financially stable. This will enable her to support the education of her two children until they graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items, foodstuffs and beverages for her store

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita B. is from the village of Mangcuram. She is 48 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Angelita owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Angelita joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Angelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Lehnerr

texts.es: Lehnerr, de 28 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijo alguno. Vive en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana,  donde tiene su propia casa. Apenas tiene secundaria completa, pero eso no lo impidió a que siguiera con sus sueños que tanto había anhelado, desde luego que concretó su objetivo de tener su propia carpintería en donde realiza todo tipo de muebles, según a los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes, en consecuencia sus ganancias van en aumento. Normalmente trabaja con sus operarios, para que de esa manera puedan minimizar tiempo y costo en la elaboración de los muebles. Usualmente su negocio de ebanistería se encuentra ubicado en su propio inmueble de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche, de lo cual se siente contento con lo que viene realizando, ya que con la ventas que realiza piensa ampliar su carpintería, con el propósito de introducir en maquinas para facilitar su trabajo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está conforme con su banco comunal, debido a que son responsables con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de madera, de todo tipo de calidad, con la finalidad de otorgarle productos en un tiempo record y cumpla con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lehnerr is 28 years old. He is single and has no children. He lives in the community of Santa Rosa, located in the beautiful jungle of Ayacucho. He owns his own home. He barely finished high school, but this did not stop him from following his dreams. He attained his goal of having his own carpentry shop where he makes all types of furniture, according to the tastes and preferences of his customers. As a result, his incomes is climbing. Normally he works with employees; in this way he minimizes the time and cost of making the furniture. His woodshop is located in his own house and is open Monday through Saturday from 7:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night. He is happy with what he is doing, and with his sales he is planning on expanding his carpenter shop so he can bring in machinery to facilitate the work. This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is committed to making the payments on time. He is also happy with his community bank, because they are responisble with their payments. He plans on investing the loan that he is asking for in purchasing wood of all different qualities so that he can finish his products in record time and meet the demands of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood to be able to make more furniture.

loans.name: Saro's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Saro P., age 48, is the village bank president, having been selected by its twenT.-four members located in Ampov Prey Pir village, Kandal province. The members of this village loan will use the money to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Saro P. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. In order to support this farm, she will use the loan that she has requested from AMK to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for laborers to plow her farm to cultivate rice. Mrs. Saro Phanm is a widow with three children: One is a knitter and the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for laborers to plow her farm to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Jorge Miguel

texts.es:
Don Jorge tiene 22 años de edad, reside en la colonia Satélite de San Miguel,  el es casado y vive con su esposa posee un negocio de venta de celulares, accesorios, reparación y venta de saldo, ubicado en San Francisco Gotera, El negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia en vista de ser un mercado potencial.
El actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de equipo para la reparación de celulares.
Este crédito ayudara a que don Jorge mejore su negocio ya que al adquirir el equipo que necesita él estará brindando un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así aumentaran sus ventas.
Su sueño es manejar un negocio estable a largo plazo, que le ayude a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 22 years old and resides in the Satellite neighborhood of San Miguel. He is married and lives with his wife. Jorge possesses a business, located in San Francisco Gotera, selling cellular phones and accessories, doing repairs and offering remnant sales. He began the business from his own initiative because he saw the business potential. Now, Jorge is soliciting a loan to buy equipment for repairing cellular phones. The loan will help Jorge improve his business by acquiring the equipment he needs to offer better service to his customers and, thus, increase sales. His dream is to manage a stable business in the long run, which will help him improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO OFFER CELLULAR PHONES, ACCESSORIES, REPAIRS, AND REMNANT SALES

loans.name: Mnatsakan

texts.en:
Mnatsakan K. is from the village of Isahakyan, which is located in the Shirak region of Armenia. He is happily married with three children: two daughters, thirty-three years old and twenty-seven years old, and a thirty-five-year-old son. 

Mnatsakan has a high school education and has been working as a farmer for the past twenty years growing vegetables, fruit and grains. He considers himself a hard worker and enjoys the life on a farm.

Mnatsakan is looking for a loan to expand his farm and to purchase wheat and barley seeds. With this investment he is expecting his family income to increase by 15% and is planning to use some of the proceeds to purchase new machinery to support the family business. He also will support his daughter’s family who live in the capital city, Yerevan.

Mnatsakan was born in Isahakyan and takes pleasure in the rural life, surrounded by his relatives and close friends.

loans.use: To buy wheat and barley seeds

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El Señor Juan hace 20 años que se vino a buscar mejor vida a Santa Cruz el es de Cochabamba y por falta de trabajo fue a Santa Cruz,   casado con  la Sra. Mercedes  no tienen hijos pero ellos se dedican a la agricultura juntamente con su esposa ellos trabajan en Nuevo Surutu distante a 40 km. Del torno hacia el oeste ellos salen unas ves por mes al mercado del Torno para comercializar sus productos, son muy trabajadores desean pronto agrandar su familia con hijos, con el dinero del crédito  compraran semillas y también lo utilizaran en el preparado de la tierra, esta muy agradecido de la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Juan came to Santa Cruz from Cochabamba 20 years ago to find a better life.  He’s married to Mercedes, but they don’t have any children yet.  They are farmers and work in Nuevo Surutu, 40 kilometers west of Torno.  Once a month they go to the Torno marketplace to sell their products.  They are hard workers and are looking forward to building their family and have children.  They will use the money from this loan to buy seed and to prepare the land.  He is very thankful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: Seeds

loans.name: Georgina Adjoa Kyerebia

texts.en:
Georgina Adjoa Kyerebia A. is divorced and has two children. She has received junior high education. Georgina sells 'wakye' (beans and rice cooked together) at Abura. She will use the loan to purchase more rice and beans to cook for sale. She plans to build a shop for her business from the additional income.

The picture shows Georgina selling her cooked 'waakye'.

loans.use: purchase more rice and beans to cook for sale

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
Maximo R. is from the city of Tinago Ozamiz City. He is 34 years old. Maximo is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maximo owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maximo has been engaged in his business for over 1 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maximo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maximo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Maximo is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Maximo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Señor De Cachuy Group

texts.es:
Cecilia Paola P. S., Tesorera de la ALCOM: "Señor de Cachuy" (en la foto es la cuarta persona empezando por la derecha y esta vestida de chompa color negro).
Cecilia con tan solo 19 años se enamorò de quien seria el padre de su hijo, el efectivo policial, Teniente Rojas; ellos habian hecho planes para el futuro y los preparativos para su boda, pero lamentablemente un mes antes de su boda, el efectivo policial fuè asesinado en el servicio de su deber. Ella para ese entonces ya estaba gestando de su ùnico hijo Patric.
Cecilia quedò desamparada en todo sentido, ya que al no casarse no pudo reclamar pensiòn del padre de su hijo; pues por ley no le correspondìa.
Cecilia tuvo que hacer cuanto trabajo pudo desempeñar para que no le faltara nada a su pequeño. Actualmente es una vendedora de comida ambulante y adicionalmente viaja a la cuidad de Cañete para ayudar a su hermano que tiene una panaderia.
El prèstamo solicitado es para adicionar a su negocio de comida, la venta de bebidas gaseosas.
texts.en:
Cecilia Paola P. S. is the treasurer of the 'Señor de Cachuy' community bank (in the photo she is the fourth person from the right and is wearing a black sweater).

At only 19 years old, Cecilia fell in love with the man who would become the father of her child, the policeman Lieutenant Rojas.  They had made plans for their future and for their wedding but sadly one month before the wedding he was killed in the line of duty.  At that time, she was pregnant with her only child Patric.

Cecilia was abandoned in all senses as, because she wasn't married, the law stated that she couldn't claim her fiancé's pension.

Cecilia had to work as hard as she could so that her little one didn't want for anything.  Currently she sells food as a street trader and she also travels to the city of Cañete to help her brother who owns a bakery.

She will use her loan to add to her food business by starting to sell sodas.

loans.use: To stock her business with sodas

loans.name: Muhame Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: Godfrey S. is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  For the past six years, Godfrey's main source of income has been from selling bananas in Nakifuma-Mukono.  It is a profitable business with both middle and low income earners in his neighborhood.  He started his business with encouragement from his mother. Prior to that, he was selling sand. Godfrey comes across as a cooperative, hard-working, and dedicated businessman.  His weekly profits total up to 50,000 shillings.  With this loan, Godfrey will buy more bananas to sell. He belongs to the Muhame Development Group-Mukono.

loans.use: To purchase bananas for resell

loans.name: Blanca Nieves

texts.es:
La señora Blanca es socia del banco comunal Las Margaritas, del Distrito de Calleria. Tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera y ha tenido que trabajar bastante para poder educar a su único hijo que ahora ya es adulto e independiente, lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos desde hace 10 años.
Todo estos años la señora Blanca se ha dedicado a la venta de productos de catalogo, perfumería, hasta ahora todo le va muy bien, cuenta con un stock de productos el cual los vende a crédito.

Blanca vive sola y con lo que trabaja le alcanza para poder mantenerse y también para pagar sus cuotas mensuales.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 soles comprará una vitrina para exhibir sus productos, también comprará 3 perfumes, 5 champús, 10 desodorantes, 5 talcos, 5  lápiz labiales, 3 polvos para cara, 2 cremas para rostro, 2 rubores, 5 cremas para mano, 2 cremas para cuerpo.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos la señora Blanca ha logrado hacer un pequeño capital, que le permite trabajar a crédito.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the communal bank "Las Margaritas" in the Calleria district.  She is 55 years old and is a single mother who has had to work a lot to educate her only son, who is now an adult and is independent.  She has been taking loans from Manuela Ramos for 10 years.

All these years Blanca has been selling cosmetics from a catalog.  Up to this point it has gone very well.  She has an inventory of products that she sells on credit.  Blanca lives alone and with what she earns she is able to support herself and also make her monthly loan payments.  With this loan  of 1,000 Peruvian soles she will buy a display case to exhibit her products.  In addition, she will buy 3 perfumes, 5 shampoos, 10 deodorants, 5 powders, 5 lipsticks, 3 foundations, 2 face creams, 2 units of blush, 5 hand creams, and 2 body creams.  

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Blanca has managed to accumulate a small amount of capital that will allow her to give credit to her customers.

loans.use: she will buy a display case to exhibit her products, and in addition she will buy: 3 perfumes, 5 shampoos, 10 deodorants, 5 powders, 5 lipsticks, 3 foundations, 2 face creams, 2 units of blush, 5 hand creams, and 2 body creams.

loans.name: Belle Dame Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Belle Dame, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 30 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’habillements, de fruits et légumes et de la restauration.                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe Belle Dame sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des habillements, des fruits et légumes et des condiments alimentaires et de la restauration.                                                                         CHITAN C. s’approvisionne en condiments alimentaires au marché de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The women of the group Belle Dame are all married and average 30 years of age and five children living in traditional extended families in Fana City, in Dioïla prefecture, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members know one another through ties of kinship. They do commerce in clothing and fruit and vegetables, and they work in food service. The group members are now on their second solidarity loan, which will be used for buying some clothing, fruit and vegetables, and condiments, and for food catering.

Ms. Chitan C. gets her supplies of condiments at the Fana market. Accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed essentially of women, she makes her sales each day locally at her house.

Chitan envisions making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used for making the loan payments and for assisting with societal ceremonies. The rest will be reinvested in her condiments business.

loans.use: Buying condiments

loans.name: Gertrudis Marilin

texts.es: Gertrudis Marilin H. C. de 25 años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque, en el departamento de Cabañas, y vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos de 9, 6 y 4 años de edad. El esposo de Gertrudis es publicista, por lo que cuenta con un negocio de elaboración de elaboración de anuncios, trabajo en el cual Gertrudis es su mano derecha, ya que ella se encarga de elaborar gran parte del arte de algunos anuncios y así mismo se encarga de entregarlos. Es como de esta manera Gertrudis junto a su compañero de vida, han salido adelante y han podido brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos. Gertrudis solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materiales como: pinturas, moldes y otros más para elaborar mayor cantidad de anuncios publicitarios.
texts.en: Gertrudis Marilin H. C. is 25 years old and she lives in Sensuntepeque, in the department of Cabanas. She lives together with her husband and their three children aged, 9, 6, and 4.  Gertrudis' husband works in advertising and he has a business where they make advertisements.   Gertrudis is his right hand woman in the business. She largely takes care of the art work associated with the creation of advertisements and she also is in charge of their delivery. This is how Gertrudis and her life partner have come out ahead and they have been able to provide their children with all that they need. Gertrudis requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) in order to purchase larger quantities of materials such as: paints, patterns, and other materials needed to create advertisements.

loans.use: To purchase paints and patterns to make advertisements.

loans.name: Nqubeko Group

texts.en:
Sibongile G. is 30 years old and single with three children between the ages of 9 months and 11 years. 

She runs a clothing business in Mtubatuba in the KwaZulu-Natal province of South Africa. She has been in this business for two years. She also earns income from the government child support grant. 

Sibongile says that the main challenges to her business are customers who do not pay on time. 

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy new clothes to sell. She adds that the extra income from this loan will help her buy furniture for her family and renovate the house. In the future she would like to own a shop where she can sell her clothes.

Sibongile would like to thank WDB and Kiva for this opportunity.

In the photo she is on the right raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for resale

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El sr. Miguel A. de 27 años, está casado con la Sra. Liliana Urunaga de 27 años de edad, ellos aun no tienen la dicha de tener hijos, pues se casaron poco tiempo.
Don Miguel se dedica a este rubro aproximadamente desde el año 2.007; el estudió y se especializó en la fabricación de panificados y comenzó con el capital que juntó trabajando como empleado de otra persona, en la actualidad tiene su propio local comercial que esta estratégicamente ubicado, es por eso que acuden muchos clientes a su local.
El utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías (harina, dulces, uvas, colorantes, aceite, etc).
texts.en: Miguel A. is 27 years old.  He is married to Liliana Urunaga, who is also 27 years old.  They do not have children yet, since they recently got married.  Miguel has dedicated himself to the bakery business since 2007.   He studied and specialized in making baked goods.  He opened his own bakery with the capital he accumulated working as an employee for another person.  His bakery is strategically located, so many clients come to his shop.  Miguel will use this loan to buy supplies for his bakery (flour, sweeteners, grapes, food coloring, oil, etc.).

loans.use: To buy flour, sweeteners, grapes, food coloring, oil, etc.

loans.name: Chom

texts.en:
Mrs. Chom was born in 1950 and she cuts palm tree fronds to sell to make roofs while her husband, Mr. Chhan, is a village vice-chief and a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where he grows rice. He sells some of the rice harvest and keeps the rest to support his family. 

Mrs. Chom's husband’s workplace is far away from their home. So  Mrs. Chom is applying fO. a loan to buy a new motorcycle as transportation. She is the mother of three children who are seamstresses in garment factories.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Jermelyn

texts.en:
Jermelyn is a married woman who lives in Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store and a livestock business. Her husband Jesus, who is 55 years old, works as a prison guard to earn his living.  They have three children who are between 18 and 25 years old. 

Jermelyn  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jermelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to pay for more goods to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and expansion of her business. Jermelyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 40 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. Her oldest child is 16 years old and the youngest is only 1 year old. Rosalie's husband works as a farmer.

Rosalie has been in the business of raising hogs for 20 years. She plans to use her loan to purchase pigs and feeds. Rosalie also helps her husband grow rice at their farm.

In the future, Rosalie hopes to see her children finish school and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feeds

loans.name: Grace Wangui

texts.en:
Grace has been practising farming in Njabini town for the last four years.  She does poultry and dairy farming on her small farm.  She is 43 years old, married to Francis Thuo, and they have six children.

Grace was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend.  This will be his sixth loan.  She had repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use this new loan amount to buy 15 chicks to raise and sell later for profit.

In the future, Grace hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy 15 chicks

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also sells Lesos (sarongs), which contributes to her other source of income. Sofia faces a major challenge of competition from other charcoal sellers in the market. She dreams of expanding her business and having a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal and bundles of Lesos (Kikois) to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and bundles of sarongs called Lesos (Kikois)

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en:
Abida is a very supportive lady. Along with her household work, she manages her business sewing clothes very well. She is very skillful in her work and receives a good number of orders every month. The income she earns helps her pay for the utility bills and the school fees of her children. She has given birth to four children: two of them are studying while the others stay at home. 

Abida's husband is a fruit vendor by profession. His shop is located in the market where he offers his clients fresh seasonal fruits at good prices. 

Abida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s fruit selling business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling in his shop. He has been operating his business for the past three years and Abida hopes that after the loan investment his business will grow further. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Abida.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits for a fruit selling business.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is married. Her husband is involved in a grocery store business. Through his store, he sells daily use items like sugar, spices, cooking oil, rice and lentils, etc. to his customers. He offers his customers competitive prices and deals with them with good behavior.  

Rani is a caring person by nature. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. Besides her household work, she also visits her husband’s store to help him in serving his customers. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. Through the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put to his store for sale. Rani hopes that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband’s business and improve his profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rani.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang, 54, is married and has been supporting his family by making and selling dumplings. He lives with his three children and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife also helps him to run their business.

Hoang has been in the dumpling business since 2003. He plans to use this loan for investment capital to increase production.  

In the future, he would like to stablzse his living conditions and get a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make dumplings to sell

loans.name: Adjo
