texts.fr: Agée de 34ans, Adjo est revendeuse  ambulante de bazins (pagnes teintés très appréciés en Afrique). Elle a démarré en 2005 en s’approvisionnant chez des grossistes. Elle veut ce prêt pour renforcer son activité et surtout avoir une boutique pour mieux s’installer. Son mari est mécanicien chauffeur, ils ont 01 enfant.
texts.en:
At 34 years of age, Adjo is a street vendor of brocade (died fabric very popular in Africa). She started in 2005, by getting her products from wholesalers.
She wants this loan to strengthen her business, in particular to get a shop for a better set up.
Her husband is a driver and car mechanic. They have one child.

loans.use: to purchase brocade (fabric).

loans.name: Risalat's Group

texts.en:
Risalat is the leader of this group.  She is 47 years old and married to a farmer.  Together with her husband she has raised three daughters and two sons. Two older daughters are married and they live separately with their families and the other children are students.

In 2009, Risalat, with an initial investment of 30,000 soms, started to sell clothing at the market.  At the moment her business is doing well and she earns about 15,000 soms per month.  Risalat applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing more clothing.  She wants to increase the inventory turnover of her business.  In the future with the profits gained from selling the clothes, Risalat hopes to build a house for her sons.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for trade

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina tiene 61 años, es una mujer carismática y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Benjamín de 66 años y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila. Cristina con su arduo trabajo sacó adelante a sus queridos hijos, quienes hoy la agradecen por su apoyo brindado. Ella desde muy joven se independizó de sus padres y empezó a trabajar por cuenta propia vendiendo variedad de frutas de la costa, sierra y selva, su puesto esta situado en el mercado principal de la ciudad de San Francisco, ella es una vendedora muy carismática y persuasiva, motivo por el cual tiene muchos clientes, quienes no dudan de  la calidad de sus frutas y optan en comprarle la mayor parte de su mercadería. Menciona que la agrada dialogar con sus compañeras de venta, ya que así siente que sus días de trabajo sean amenos, lleva 25 años en este negocio y considera que lo complicado es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día en espera de clientes. Cristina agradece a todos ustedes por depositar su confianza en ella, ya que gracias al apoyo de ellos trata de mejorar su condición de vida. Con el monto solicitado comprará mas frutas para implementar su quiosco de ventas. Para el bien de su futuro espera contar con la misma fuerza y agradece a dios por mantenerla sana y salva. Este es su 13avo crédito con MFP y espera de un pequeño préstamo por parte de ustedes para poder cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en sus anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de sus compañeras. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más fruta para efectuar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Cristina, 61, is a charismatic, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Benjamín, 66, and what she most wants is to live a peaceful old age.  Through hard work Cristina was able to raise her beloved children who today appreciate the support she gave them.  From a very early age she became independent from her parents and started working on her own selling a variety of fruit from the coast, highlands and jungle.  

Her stand is located in the city of San Francisco’s main market.  She is a charismatic and persuasive vendor which has led to a large clientele who do not question the quality of her fruit and opt to buy most of her merchandise.  She mentions that she enjoys chatting with her fellow vendors because that makes her work days more pleasant.  She’s been in business 25 years and considers the most complicated part having to remain standing throughout the day awaiting customers.  

Cristina thanks all of you for the trust placed in her because, thanks to support from them, she attempts to improve her living conditions.  For her future wellbeing she hopes to have the same strength and thanks God for keeping her safe and sound.

This is her 13th loan with MFP and she hopes for a small loan from you to be able to reach her goals.  On the other hand, she commits to pay her installments like she’s done in her previous loans.  She is a member of her communal bank who is very committed to her fellow members’ development.  She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy more fruit to better stock her sales stand.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to stock her fruit stand.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
Rohat is a hard-working woman. She is married and the mother of three children. Rohat has been in the bakery business for 15 years with her sister. She cooks tasty breads and then sells them in the local market of “Farovon”. She would like to get a loan of 1900 USD for purchasing flour and coal in order to expand her business and increase her working capital. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Rohat reach all of her aspirations.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy flour and coal reserves.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a businesswoman who earns a living by running a beauty salon. She has been in the business for nine years and employs two people.  Previously, Lilian sold vegetables. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money and manage her business and therefore has been able to maintain her business for nine years. 

Lilian is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to buy a hair dryer for her salon. In the future, she hopes to open other salon outlets.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: La Sra. Catalina es una mujer trabajadora, con ganas de salir adelante y día a día se esfuerza mas y mas para lograr crecer económicamente; ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, de los cuales ya 2 están casados; la Sra. Catalina se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno en el distrito de Socso, Provincia Camaná; lleva 10 años en esta crianza, el crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la construcción de un corral para su ganado ya que no cuenta con uno. Su principal desafío es la distancia que la separa de su familia ya que ella vive en Socso cuidando el ganado y su familia en Camana, sus sueños de la Sra. Catalina es crecer día a día en su negocio y tener más reses y dar una mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia. Ella está muy agradecida con el crédito otorgado ya que con ello mejorara su crianza de ganado.
texts.en:
Señora Catalina is a hard-working woman with the desire to move ahead in life.  Every day she strives more and more to achieve financial growth.  She is married and has three grown children, two of whom are already married.

Señora Catalina works raising cattle in the district of Socso in Camaná province.  She has been working with livestock for 10 years.

She will invest the loan being offered in the construction of a corral for her cattle, as she doesn't have one.  

Her main challenge is the distance that separates her from her family, as she lives in Socso looking after the cattle, and her family live in Camana.

Señora Catalina's dreams are to grow her business on a daily basis, and to have more cattle and to give her whole family a better quality of life.

She is very grateful for the loan that's been offered, as with it she can improve her cattle raising.

loans.use: to construct a corral for her cattle.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La señora Beatriz, se dedica a la venta de fruta  con su padre en forma ambulante por distintas zonas de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción ya que realizara diversas mejoras en su vivienda. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona  14 de septiembre de la Ciudad de El Alto. Beatriz ha solicitado que este crédito sea canalizado a través de Kiva, ya que es la segunda vez que usa dichos servicios, y es la quinta vez que requiere un préstamo de IMPRO. Su historial de pagos es excelente.
texts.en:
Beatriz sells fruit in an itinerant manner with her father.  She sells in different areas in the city of El Alto.

She needs the loan in order to buy construction materials; she will make different improvements on her home.  She lives in her own house, which is in the 14 de septiembre zone in the city of El Alto.

Beatriz has requested that this loan be channeled through Kiva.  This is the second time that she has used said services, and it is the fifth time that she has needed a loan from IMPRO.  Her payment history is excellent.

loans.use: to buy construction material for home improvement.

loans.name: Niveen

texts.en: Niveen is a 26-year-old young woman. She is married and has one son and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Niveen has a project of raising laying hens and benefits from selling its products. Niveen wants to purchase more laying hens and expand her project to increase the family income. She has an amount of money that is not enough to pay for the hens, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Niveen gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will purchase more laying hens and increase her income by selling more of their products; this will provide Niveen and her family with better life conditions. Niveen is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase more laying hens.

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en:
Haykush was born in 1962 in Ijevan City. She is married and has 3 children: two daughters and a son. Her elder daughter is married and lives separately from her parents. Haykush’s younger daughter helps her parents in business and Haykush’s son is a pupil. 

For about 9 years Haykush worked as an economist in one of Ijevan’s organizations. Then she and her husband decided to run their own business. They opened a food store in Ijevan city market. Haykush’s husband delivers merchandise from Yerevan to Ijevan city, her daughter sorts out the merchandise and puts them in storehouse, and Haykush sells them at their shop. Thanks to their family business they are able to keep their family. 

This is Haykush’s 5th loan from Nor Horizon and now she is asking for a 1.000.000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of candy, confectionery, and various tinned goods, etc., for her business.  
 
Haykush has never delayed her repayments.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of candy, confectionery, and various tinned goods, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Esterlinda

texts.en:
Esterlinda is 57 years old and lives in Pines, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children. 
Esterlinda has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month. She has requested a loan of 3,000 for additional capital for her snack vending business. 
Esterlinda has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Esterlinda hopes to have a food stall in the market.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman with 7 children. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the family's basic needs.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Luvuno has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 5 years; her potential clients are local residents. She faces a major challenge of transportation her goods. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan Luvuno wants to purchases more sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to acquire loans.

loans.use: to purchases more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface has operated his tailoring shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last three years. He is 35 years old, and he and his wife Elizabeth have two children attending school.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of their existing clients, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more material for use in his  tailoring shop.

In the future, Boniface hopes to expand his business, open many branches, and even offer tailoring training courses to other youths in the Ndunyu Njeru area, thereby increasing his income and improving his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more material for tailoring.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a 39-year-old housewife who is married and has four children. At home she has always had an old sewing machine. She used to use some fabric to make items of clothing for her family until almost two years ago when she turned this activity into a small home business, sewing and making clothes and curtains. 
Now Ahlam has applied for a loan to buy a new sewing machine and more fabric.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and more fabric.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 29 years old. He is a married man from the town of Cauayan City in the province of Isabela. He and his wife are both farmers. They primarily grow crops of corn to sell. George does his best to improve their business and take care of their children.

At this time, George is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. George hopes to have a bigger farm in the future. He also hopes to help improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nolberto Donato

texts.es:
el sr. Norberto Donato esta casado, no tiene dependientes porque sus hijos todos son mayores de edad  y su actividad principal es la produccion y venta de pan, cuenta con una panadería, tiene mas de 16 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, pero es hasta hace un par de años que tiene su propia instalacion y maquinaria, siempre trabajo para otras panaderias en donde adquirio buena experiencia y eso hizo que tomara la decision de iniciar su propia panaderia. a través del financiamiento que le han proporcionado otras instituciones financieras logro construir las instalaciones y comprar maquinaria, dichos créditos los ha pagado con las ganancias que le genera su panadería.
El Sr. Norberto utilizara el credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de los panes y asi tener una mayor produccion, quiere aprovechar esta temporada de mayor ventas en la zona.
texts.en:
Sr. Norberto Donato is married and has no dependents because all of his children are grown. His main business activity is producing and selling bread. He has a bakery and has been in this line of work for more than 16 years. Only in the last two years did he have his own facilities and equipment. Norberto had always worked for other bakeries, which allowed him to acquire good experience before making the decision to start his own bakery. With the financing he received from other institutions, he was able to build his facilities and buy machinery. These loans were repaid using the income generated by his bakery.

Sr. Norberto will use this loan to buy supplies for making bread so that he can increase production. He wants to take advantage of this season when more sales are generated in the area.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, eggs, yeast, margarine, sugar, butter, oil, and baking powder.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
Adrian is married and has a four-year-old son. He describes himself as an honest man with integrity. 

He has been selling home products such as water, soda, and loaves of bread and clothes like blankets and bed sheets. He has been in this business for the last three years and his primary customers are retailers. His business challenge is inadequate funds for expanding the business. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to add to his stock of home products. In the future, Adrian's hope and dream is to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase more home products.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been farming in her home area of Kitale, Western Kenya, growing mainly cereals, and more specifically, maize and beans.

Grace has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry in order to venture into the poultry farming business. She claims there is a ready market for poultry products, especially birds. She says she will use the income to educate her children and venture into dairy farming as well. Grace hopes to have started dairy farming and have four dairy cows in five years' time.

Grace laments poor infrastructure as being the main challenge to farmers in the area as it delays delivery of produce to the market and is expensive as well.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Rosaline's Group

texts.fr: TITOMAGBA est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Rosaline (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 36 ans. Rosaline n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Rosaline est mariée à un coiffeur nommé Marcellin. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Rosaline et son mari. Pour cette raison, Rosaline vend des tissus depuis cinq de façon ambulante, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Rosaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Rosaline sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe TITOMAGBA, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is 45 years old and a married mother of seven children, and is often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Beatrice has been a farmer for more than 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Beatrice wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Beatrice hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 9 solar lights, as some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package, even though Beatrice decided not to.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin aged 36 years. He is married with 4 children aged between 7 and 14 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay workers.

loans.name: Olympia

texts.en:
Olympia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Olympia is 60 years old now.

Olympia has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Olympia requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

Olympia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Olympia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Enso Nyame Ye Ventures is a very vibrant enterprise which is doing well. Madam Comfort B. lives at Nite Market in Effiakuma. She buys maize from Techiman and Kumasi for resale in Takoradi. She needs working capital of $800.00 from Kiva to expand her business. She is hopeful that business will do even better than it is now when given the financial backing.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She resides with the family in a community where majority of the residents are in the upper-middle income bracket. She therefore runs a general provisions store to meet the needs of the inhabitants.

Her desire is to expand the stock of the store. She benefited from the 'TEACH' learning sessions facilitated by KRABAN in October last year. She therefore looks forward in putting the KIVA loan to maximum use for an improvement in her family's life.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Elida is married and has six children of the ages of 4, 5, 9, 11, 13 and 16. Her husband works as a trailer driver but receives a low income. Elida began to sell cosmetics and shoes by her sister’s invitation, but she saw that she was obtaining good profits and clients, so she decided to sell on her own. This is how Elida is able to help her husband with the household expenses and their children’s school tuition.

In order to meet her clients’ demands, Elida needs a $275 dollar loan which she will use in the purchase of merchandise. She is committed to return this amount in 4 to 8 months. You can be an important part in the growth of this business and the wellbeing of Elida and her family. Thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Elida es casada y tiene seis hijos, de 4, 5, 9, 11, 13 y 16 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como chofer de un trailer, pero recibe un salario muy bajo. Elida empezó a vender cosméticos y zapatos por la invitación de una de sus hermanas, pero al ver que obtenía buenas ganancias y que ya tenia algunos clientes, decidió vender por su cuenta, de esta manera es como Elida ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y de la escuela de sus hijos.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Elida necesita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 4 a 8 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y en el bienestar de Elida y su familia, gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use:
Purchase of Merchandise
Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Mr. Sou S., 48 years old, and his wife (pictured here) live and work together in Phnom Penh Cambodia. They produce and sell brooms, and can earn $8/day in this business. They have five children, two of whom work at a garment factory, and three of whom are students. This loan will be used for the couple to purchase more materials so they can continue in their broom business. They earn good income from selling brooms, and they hope to continue accessing credit to expand their business in the future.

loans.use: Sou would like to buy more brooms to sell.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en: I am a mother of three, one son and two daughters. I have been living in Vehari since my childhood. One of my daughters is a teacher and the other is married. My son works with his father supplying stamp papers (a kind of official document used for making agreements or other important documentation) to a local bank. A few days ago, my husband broke his arm while working and my son must now work alone. There are quite a few vendors around doing the same business and if we could invest more we might be able to get some good returns. For this, I need a loan of $175 so that he can buy more stamp papers to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase stamp papers

loans.name: Takhir

texts.ru:
Takhir lives in Saatli Town, Azerbaijan.  He is 50 years old, is married and has 5 children.  Takhir has 3 dairy cows.  Because he is the only provider in the family, he together with his son (see photo) milk the cows and sell milk at the local market.  It is very difficult to provide for a family of 5 children and Takhir plans to increase the number of cows in order to increase his milk supply.  

Takhir is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase dairy calves.  At the local market one calf costs $100, by purchasing 5 calves, Takhir will be able to triple his milk production, which will provide him with an extra $500 in profits every month.

 Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer. 



Мр. Тахир живет в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенном в Закавказье. Ему 50 лет, он женат, имеет 5-х детей. Тахир имеет три собственные доильные коровы. Будучи единственным кормильцем в семье, он вместе со своим сыном (см. фото) занимается доением и продажей молока на местном рынке. Обеспечивать семью с пятью детьми очень трудно и Тахир планирует увеличить надои и продажу молока путём увеличения количества коров. Поэтому он обратился в микрокредитную организацию "Нормикро"-партнёру КИВА- с просьбой предоставить ему кредит в 500 долларов для покупки телят молочной породы. На местном рынке цена одного телёнка приравнивается 100 долларам, так что Тахир, купив 5 телят, сможет увеличить надои молока в три раза. А это даст Тахир 500 долларов чистой прибыли в месяц.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her retail shop

loans.name: Elburus

texts.ru:
Elburus H. was born in 1977. He is single and currently lives in Agsu. He has been raising cattle for the past 3 years. Elburus started his business with just three cows. Now, with god's help, he has more. Elburus wants to buy more cows, but he does not have enough money. This is why he wrote a letter asking for help with a loan to the local microcredit agency Normicro.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Гусейнов Эльбрус 1977 года рождения. Холост,данный момент проживает в Ахсуниском районе. Уже три года занимается скотоводством . Когда начинал этот бизнес у него было всего три голов скота . Теперь слава богу по больще стало. Эльбрус хочеть купить еще коров. Но ему не хватает средство. По этому он написал заявление в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал.

loans.use: To purchase more cows

loans.name: Maria Ades

texts.es:
Mrs. María Ades belongs to the communal bank "San Fernando 2" located in Callería, Ucayali in Peru. She is 33 years old, and the mother of six young children. She is married and her husband is a public employee. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 soles, she decided to invest in buying and selling Omnilife products.

She currently continues to sell Omnilife products, and she also relies on two motorcars. She gets up very early to spend her mornings taking care of the household, and in the afternoons, she dedicates herself to selling her products in-house.

With this loan for $350, which she will repay in 5 months, she will invest in buying clothing such as polos, pants, dresses, skirts, shoes, and Omnilife products.

María tells us that Manuela Ramos is a support for many business. Being here, she is happy to share her moments of happiness with her other companions at the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marìa Ades pertenece al Banco Comunal San Fernando 2, ubicado en Jr. Sinchi Roca 171, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años, es madre de 6 hijos menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es empleado publico. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la compra y venta de productos omnilife.

En la actualidad continúa con la venta de productos omnilife , ademàs cuenta con dos motokar. Se levanta muy temprano para dedicarse por las mañanas a las labores del hogar y por las tardes de dedica a la venta de sus productos a domicilio.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropa como polos, pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas, zapatos y en los productos omnilife.

Maria nos dice que Mamuela Ramos es un apoyo para los negocios ya que el estar ahí la hace sentir feliz al compartir momentos de alegría con sus demás compañeras del banco comunal.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and Omnilife products for resale

loans.name: Abdurahimov

texts.ru:
A. Abdurahimov has finished high school and is now a businessman. He is not married yet. Besides his main business of selling small miscellaneous merchandise and groceries he is also in the animal husbandry business. He is the oldest son in his family and that's why he is responsible for his family's living expenses. His mother is a housewife. A. consults his father when buying and selecting cattle. His father is a good veterinarian and has knowledge about cattle.

A. thinks that it's better to get a loan to buy new cattle for his business rather than spend his profits. Currently, he owns two cows and eight sheep.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдурахимов Абдубурхон парень закончивший среднюю школу и занимающийся бизнесом. Пока не женат помимо своего бизнеса по продаже мелочного товара , продуктов питания он занимается откормом скота и его продажей. В семье он старший сын и на его шее все расходы на жизнь.Мать домохозяйка, а Абдубурхон советуется по выбору скота сосвоим отцом.Его отец хороший ветеринар и хорошо разбирается в скоте.

Абдубурхон считает что чем уменьшить активы своего бизнеса для приобретения мелкорогатого скота, ему лучше взять в Микроинвесте кредит.На сегодня он имеет 2 коровы и 8 баранов.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Chang

texts.en:
Chang R., 30 years old, lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and their three children. She makes and sells various souvenir products to capitalize on Siem Reap’s thriving tourist industry based around the Angkor temples. She makes about $3 U.S. per day. Her husband, Phat Oun, is 27 years old and shares her business, adding an additional $3 per day to the family income. Their oldest child is 8 years old and currently enrolled in primary school while the other two are still too young to attend school.

Since both quantity and quality of product are the keys to being successful when so many other locals make their living in the same business, Chang is requesting a loan of $400 to buy better and more complex tools with which to make the handicrafts she sells to tourists.

loans.use: To buy equipment and tools used in making handicrafts as souvenirs.

loans.name: Saiful

texts.id:
Saiful is already in the Recycling business for years. Daily he went around Kuta area to search and buy used items, then brought them to his storage place in his home at Patih Jelantik street, Denpasar. After sorting these items according to type, he sells these items. Obtained income is sent to his family who lives in Java island. His wife is still not living with him, but with her parents in Java. Every 2 or 3 months he went home to Java to see his wife and family.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Profesi sebagai pemulung sudah dijalani oleh Saiful selama bertahun-tahun. Sehari-harinya dia berkeliling sepanjang kawasan Kuta untuk mencari dan membeli barang-barang bekas lalu kemudian dibawa ketempat penampungan dirumahnya di Jl.. Setelah dipilah sesuai jenis barangnya, kemudian barang-barang dijual. Penghasilan yang didapat sebagian dikirimkan untuk keluarganya yang tinggal di Jawa. Istrinya saat ini tidak bersamanya, tetapi tinggal bersama orangtuanya di Jawa. Setiap 2 atau 3 bulan sekali dia pulang ke Jawa untuk menjenguk istri dan keluarganya.

loans.use: To add business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Berdikobul

texts.ru:
Berdikobul B. lives in the Vakhsh region. He lives with his family. He has 5 children and they all live together. Despite his age Berdikobul works and raises livestock. He raises young calves, fattens them and sells them to be slaughtered.

Right now there is a small crisis with feed due to weather conditions and as a result Berdikobul decided to take out a loan and to stock up on hay. This will help him to improve his situation a bit and will keep him from needing to sell his animals. Berdikobul plans to pay back the loan over a 9 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Бойназаров Бердикобул житель района Вахш. Живет со своей семьей. У него пятеро детей и живут они все вместе. Не смотря на свой возраст Бердикобул работает и занимается он животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где выращивает молодых бычков . откармливает их и продает на мясо. Сейчас произошел небольшой кризис с кормами в связи с погодными условиями , поэтому он решил получить кредит и запастись сеном. Это поможет ему немного исправить ситуацию и не придется продавать животных. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 9 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase Feed

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomena is 47 years old and a married mother with six children. All her children are currently in school. She treks to Kintampo, in the northern part of Ghana, to purchase her products and retail them in her town market. She says prices for her commodities is on the rise and therefore she wants to use the loan to buy more yams and millet to avoid price hikes and frequent trips to the north. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband and pay the children's school fees. She is a member of the group called Partners. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy tubers of fresh yams and bags of millet.

loans.name: Emma María

texts.es:
Doña Emma is 51 years old. Currently, she lives with two of her three children and her husband.

She has had her pharmacy for three years. This business was a gift from her oldest daughter. Emma brings her knowledge of health sciences to advise her customers on medicines as she is a nurse by profession. Attending to her pharmacy is her greatest satisfaction because she gets to practice her profession and offers only safe medicines brought directly from authorized pharmaceutical laboratories. Sometimes, she has to help her clients who come to her at any hour of the day or night, but, for Emma, this is very flattering.

Emma focuses on the service in her pharmacy because, in the future, she wants to be able to establish many branches and leave them to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Emma tiene 51 años, actualmente vive con 2 de sus 3 hijos y su esposo.

Ella tiene su botica desde hace 3 años, este negocio fue un obsequio de su hija mayor. Emma vuelca todos sus conocimientos de las ciencias de la salud para orientar a sus clientes sobre medicamentos ya que ella es enfermera de profesión. Atender su botica es su mejor satisfacción porque ejerce su profesión, y solo ofrece medicamentos seguros que trae directamente de los laboratorios farmacéuticos autorizados. A veces debe atender a sus clientes que acuden a ella a cualquier hora del día y la noche, pero para Emma es muy halagador.

Emma se esfuerza en la atención de su botica porque desea a futuro poder establecer varias sucursales y dejarles en herencia a sus hijos.

loans.use: Invest in her pharmacy and add to her shop some bazaar-type items

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos tiene 54 años de edad, su esposa le tiene cinco hijos dos varones de 13 y 18 años de edad, y tres mujeres de 16, 20 y 24 años de edad, con domicilio en Villa Reconciliación. Su esposa trabaja como supervisora en un supermercado. Don Carlos vende ropa, zapatos, productos de limpieza y hogar, lleva dieciséis años de estar en las ventas, e inició con dinero propio, desde joven ha sido un hombre trabajador. Con la solicitud del dinero es para comprar mercadería y tener en almacén para ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad y estilo de productos. A largo plazo es  seguir incrementando el inventario para obtener mejores utilidades así como ayudar a sus hijos que se preparen con los estudios universitarios para que gocen de una vida digna
texts.en:
Carlos is 54 years old, he and his wife have 5 children – 2 sons ages 13 and 18 and 3 daughters ages 16, 20 and 24. Their home is in Villa Reconciliación. His wife works as a supervisor in a supermarket. Carlos sells clothing, shoes, products for cleaning and the home. He has be in sales for 16 years, and he began with his own money. Ever since he was young he has been a hard working man. With this loan he is asking to buy merchandise and have a store to offer his customers a variety and range of products. His long term goal is to continue increasing his inventory to obtain greater resources such as being able to help his children prepare for university studies and that they have a dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for cleaning and the home

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ret L., 29, is a vegetable seller. She grows vegetables and sells them to the market, earning approximately US$2.16 per day. She is married with four children, all of whom are students. Ret faces difficulty with insects that ravage her vegetable crop. With this problem, Ret asks for a loan of US$250 to buy insecticide to protect her vegetable crop and to buy more seeds to use for cyclic growing. The loan will allow her to increase her family's income. Ret is the leader of the small group of three members, joined below:

1. Mrs. Leab M., 51, widowed, grows and sells vegetable. Leab requests a loan of US$200 to purchase insecticide to use for her vegetable crop.

2. Mr. Sary V., 28, makes and sells charcoal from his house. Sary requests a loan of US$200 to pay for farmland plowing of growing rice.

3. Mrs. Sophal Say, 38, widowed, is a vegetable grower. Sophal requests a loan of US$250 to purchase insecticide to use for her vegetable crop.

The group members live in Paksneng Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy insecticide to protect vegetable crops and to buy more seeds to use for cyclic growing

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin O. is 42 years old and married with 6 children. Toyin sells drinks wholesale and retail. She has a store where she sells these drinks to her customers. She is a hardworking woman. She needs the loan amount of N61,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday O. repairs bicycles and motorcycles. He is 39 years old and married with 2 children. His wife is a trader. He needs a loan of N30,000 to purchase more motorcycle materials to sell. He says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Parveen M.sharif Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is 50 years old and lives in the village of Kot Radha Kishan, which is about 24 km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She is uneducated because her parents couldn’t afford to send her to school. Her husband is M., and makes a living driving a tractor. They have four children, three sons and one daughter. Her oldest son works in a factory. The others go to a school near their home. Parveen baji runs a cloth-selling business, buying items from the famous city of Multan and selling them in her own town. She does this work to earn a good income and to improve her living standards. She is applying for a loan to increase her income by buying more clothes to sell. 

Parveen baji also leads a small loan group that includes Shaheen baji, who wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop and Hafizan baji, who wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Kreiver

texts.es: Kreiver tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos. La casa donde viven es propia. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 10 años con su motocarro, gracias a su buena administración del dinero ahora es propietario de dos motocarros, los cuales favorecen a fortalecer la economía de su hogar. Con el ingreso que tiene de ambos motocarros apoya a su cónyuge, quién se dedica al a la venta de granos en un puesto del mercado. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer muchos lugares y muchas personas. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita reparará uno de sus motocarros ya que se encuentra en mal estado, para ello requiere comprar repuestos y algunas piezas necesarias para en buen funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Kreiver is 47 and lives with his wife and 3 children. They live in their own home. He has transported passengers for 10 years in his motorcycle rickshaw. Thanks to his good money management, he now owns two motorcycle rickshaws, which helps his family's financial situation. With the income from these, he supports his wife, who sells grains at a stand in the market. What he likes about his job is that he gets to meet a lot of people and see a lot of places. This is his sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he is requesting, he will repair one of his motorcycles since it is in bad shape. For this he needs to buy parts and some necessary pieces so his work tool will work well.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle rickshaw

loans.name: Jhomar

texts.en:
Meet Jhomar T.. He grows rice. Everyday he goes out on his farm, touches the loam, wet soil, feels the heat of the sun, and plows the field with his carabou to ensure quality harvest to support his family. He is 19 years old and single. Most of his earnings go to his parents' and siblings' needs.

He is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI (Kiva's Field Partner). He will use the loan to buy more fertilizers for his farm. The fertilizers will help a lot to increase his yield. He is hoping that he will have more food to give his family in the coming harvest. His loan will enable him to purchase the needed fertilizers for his crops to increase his harvest.

CEVI is helping people like Jhomar T. grow their businesses. Because CEVI provides their clients credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage, they have created an impact and uplifted people's lives.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farm

loans.name: Kuchkor

texts.en:
Kuchkor R. is 50 years old. He is a livestock dealer. He buys and sells cattle at various markets and has been in the business for the last 16 years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. Kuchkor is married and the father of three children. With the loan from Kiva, he plans to increase his herd of cattle for trade and, if possible, open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. He plans to see his children receive higher education and be able to get good jobs, unlike himself.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchasing additional cattle

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita D. manages a small mango farm in Norala, South Cotabato, a town of 40,744 people in 8,263 households. She is 51 years old, married and has 5 children. Before, she had a small eatery business, but due to downsizing of her customers, she decided to quit her food business and manage her farm instead. Her husband, Rodolfo D., is a farmer. Aside from mangoes, they grow other crops like cassava, taru, and "camote," which is the Philippine local name for sweet potato.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 with CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her mango farm. These will help her improve her crop yield. This way, she could achieve a better harvest from her farm to support her family.

CEVI is helping her grow more mangoes. She receives credit assistance, training and insurance coverage services that CEVI gives to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for mango plantation

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 20-year-old Jesca N. from Mwanza. She is married. Jesca has been running a tailoring business making clothes and selling them to customers since 2008. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Jesca currently earns about $150 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy a sewing machine, vitenge (African traditional clothes) and thread. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Jesca thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, vitenge (African traditional clothes) and thread

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Victoria es casada, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo, Victoria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general, carne, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y teléfono publico.
Los sueños de Victoria son ampliar su negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria is a partner of "Banco Comunal Arco Iris".

She is married, 37 years old, and has 1 son. Victoria has a store at her house where she sells vegetables, groceries, meat, and beverages every day.

Victoria needs a loan of 2000 soles to be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and a pay phone. It is her dream to expand her business and build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, and a pay phone.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria Huamán R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras de Catac”, vive en la Av. 31 de Mayo Nº 316, Distrito de Catac, Provincia de Recuay, Departamento de Ancash. Está separada de su esposo, tiene 06 hijos y solo vive con 01 de ellos.  Los demás son independientes.

Con el primer préstamo de S/.  300.00 compró abarrotes para su tienda instalada  en su propia casa.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, donde vende sus productos a los pobladores de la ciudad de Catac.  Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 comprará fideos, azúcar, aceite, leche, arroz, jabón, detergente, etc.
Siempre fue una mujer independiente y con el negocio que conduce logró darles una profesión a todos sus hijos por ello se siente muy orgullosa.
Manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por seguir confiando en ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gregoria Huamán R. belongs to the Community Bank 'The Winners of Catac' and lives at 316 May 31st Avenue in the District of Catac, Recuay Province, Ancash Department. She is separated from her husband, has six children, and lives with just one of them. The others are independent. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 she bought groceries for her store located in her own house. Presently, she continues with the same business where she sells her products to the residents of Catac city. With this loan of S/. 800.00 she will buy noodles, sugar, oil, milk, rice, soap, detergent, etc. She has always been an independent woman and with the business she runs she managed to provide with all her children an occupation which makes her very proud. She expresses her appreciation to Manuela Ramos for continuing to have confidence in her.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy noodles, sugar, milk, rice, etc.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy sensata y precavida. Está casada, vive en su casa propia con el padre de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales, el mayor migró a otra ciudad y los menores están junto con ella apoyándola en sus trabajos agrícolas. Eugenia le tiene un sentimiento muy grato a cada una de sus plantas cafetaleras, porque gracias a la buena atención y a los cuidados que les brinda logró realizar buenas cosechas que le permiten cubrir la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. Se le levanta muy temprano por la mañana para preparar el desayuno y el almuerzo de sus hijos, quienes al regresar del colegio acuden a cuidar de los cultivos de sus padres, mientras tanto Eugenia y su esposo trabajan en las chacras de sus vecinos desde 8.00am hasta las 6.00pm por un pago diario de 12 soles a ella y 15 soles a él. A pesar de cumplir con su trabajo para sus vecinos, no descuida sus propios cultivos, pues se organiza y delega funciones a cada uno de sus hijos, ya que quiere que aprendan el trabajo y valoren el dinero que se obtiene con esfuerzo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo (3 años) se ha ganado el aprecio, cariño y respeto de todos los integrantes de su banco comunal, debido a su responsabilidad y a sus acertadas opiniones durante las reuniones del grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para agilizar la maduración uniforme del café, de ese modo podrá cotizarlo a un mejor precio en las próximas campañas de cosecha.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a sensible and cautious woman of 40 years old. She is married and lives in a house that she owns with the father of her 6 children. Her oldest child has migrated to another city while the younger children help her with her agricultural work. Eugenia is glad for her coffee plants, because thanks to her attention and care, they have given her good harvests, which have paid for the education and feeding of her children. She rises early in the morning to prepare breakfast and lunch for her children. When they return from school, they help to take care of the plans. Meanwhile, Eugenia and her husband work in their neighbours’ small farms from 8am until 6pm for a daily wage of 12 soles (about 4 US dollars) for her and 15 soles (about 5 US dollars) for him. Although Eugenia and her husband work for their neighbours, they don’t neglect their own plants. They delegate specific tasks to each of their children, so they can learn not only how to farm but also the value of money that is obtained through hard work. This is her fifth loan with MFP. Over the last 3 years, she has gained the esteem, affection and respect of all the members of her communal bank, due to her responsibility and her wise opinions during group meetings. She is now asking for money to buy chemical fertilizers to speed up the even ripening of the coffee beans, so she can get a better price for her future harvests.

Translated from Spanish by Zev Lowe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer (Compra de fertilizantes)

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha P. trades in bush meat. She buys the game meat from hunters in her locality. She sells on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies food vendors and restaurant operators in her community. Agatha has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk.

Agatha is 43 years old, divorced and has two daughters, who are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She wants to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bush meat

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica P. is from the town of Benoni, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 39 years old. Jessica is separated from her spouse and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessica owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In April 2009, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional capital. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jessica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk T., 43 years old, is a single mother of four children, three of whom are employed as domestic construction workers and provide their income to support their family’s living expenses. Ouk, a rice farmer, is requesting a loan to buy seed and fertilizer in order to grow a rice crop during this farming season. She thanks lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer in order to grow a rice crop

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela M. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 56 years old. Fidela is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Fidela owns & operates a business venture in the service sector and does repairs. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing battery charging, repairs and other services for the local community members. Fidela has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Fidela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fidela is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for her repair service business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fidela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for her repair service business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 48-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of 12 and 26. Four of her children go to school. She owns a three-room house, where she is staying with her children. Ruth takes care of additional family members.  There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala.  

Ruth rents a stall where she sells raw food (matooke, or green bananas). She sells to an average of 15 people a day.  Ruth uses public transport to and from work. Her major monthly expenses are health care and school fees. Ruth has been with MCDT for five years and is servicing her 10th loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more stock.
.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. lives in the village of Brgy, San Juan Gingoog City. She is 45 years old, married and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells a wide range of products to people in her community. She has been engaged in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP from her work.

Earlier this year, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and expand her small business. She is applying for a loan, her first from HSPFI, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es: Don Cesar Antonio R. de 45 años de edad, vive en Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, de oficio albañil con experiencia de 23 años trabajando con la dificultad que el trabajo no es fijo, ya que cuando termina el contrato de la construcción, tiene que esperar otro. Su esposa es ama de casa cuida a sus niños los cuales cursan la primaria, con este crédito comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y ladrillo que quiere poner en la sala para mejor higiene y presentación de su casa, pues poco ha construido todo de concreto para mayor seguridad de su familia, ya que los materiales están caros, con los financiamiento se logra el mejoramiento continuo de las viviendas.

loans.use: Comprar ladrillo,cemento,arena para poner en la sala

loans.name: Mereñita

texts.es:
Mereñita  es una socia dinámica y emprendedora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 48 años, madre D. cuatro hijos todos mayores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes al por menor, también alquila motocarro, ella se encuentra muchos años separada, pero siempre se dedico a trabajar arduamente para salir adelante. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “ Ricardo Palma” desD. hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles, que invirtió en gaseosas para vender.
Con este crédito D. 1000 soles, le permitirá invertir en productos para su tienda (arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc.). La meta D. Mereñita es tener su negocio bien implementado y crecer en sus finanzas.
texts.en:
Mereñita is one of our dynamic and enterprising members. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in Ucayali region. Mereñita is 48 years old and the mother of four adult children. She has a retail store where she sells groceries as well as a motor taxi that she offers for rental. Mereñita has been separated for many years, but she always worked hard in order to get ahead.

She joined the Ricardo Palma Communal Bank four years ago. Mereñita used her first loan of 300 soles to buy sodas to sell. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to acquire products for her store (rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.). Her goal is to manage her business well and grow financially.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a hairstylist and she also sells hair extensions and hair cream at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a focused, hard-worker who is determined to excel in her business and family life.

Patience is married with five children and she is 42 years old. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell.

This is the high season for her business and services and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and hair cream to sell

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N. est âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Avec son prêt elle fabrique et vend des jus naturels et de glace, elle vend également des cacahouètes. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille à partir des bénéfices qu'elle réalise.
texts.en:
Awa N. is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. With her loan, she is making and selling natural juices and ice cream. She also sells peanuts. From the profits she earns, she takes part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
La señora Lastenia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, Distrito de Rioja, Provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 53 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Lastenia, lleva varios años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan y siempre regalando una sonrisa y con amabilidad sus clientes se sienten muy contentos y satisfechos. En la actualidad, se siente muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Lastenia is a member of the Communal Bank “La Mujer Riojana”, which is in the District of Rioja, Rioja Province, Department of San Martín. She is 53 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 4 children who are all independent.

Lastenia has been producing garments for several years. Since she possessed the appropriate knowledge, she did not hesitate in establishing her own dressmaking shop. Her business is located in her house, which is well-equipped for accommodating her regular customers who know her and come by every day in need of her services. Lastenia’s work is based on the orders she receives in advance. She always greets her customers with a smile, which makes them feel happy and satisfied. At the moment, Lastenia is very pleased and proud of her achievements.

With this loan of 3000 soles, she will buy meters of fabric in different styles and colors, as well as tools such as scissors, large spools of thread in various colors, hand sewing needles, sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons. Today Lastenia feels like an accomplished woman who has more desire to achieve and fulfill her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting many other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials & supplies

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata S. is 35 years old and is married to a police officer attached to a local area unit where they are living. She has three children all of whom are attending school. Aminata herself has never been to school as preference was given to boys in the area where she was born.

Aminata sells baby clothes along one of the main roads in the town.  She has been in this business for nineteen years. She started hawking (going door-to-door) but she now has a stall.

Aminata is determined to send all her children to school and to help her husband to construct a small house for the family. The loan she is requesting will help to raise the much needed funds to support her ambition.

Aminata has been a client with ARD for the last two years with a very good credit history. She is honest and very serious about her business.

loans.use: To buy more baby clothes

loans.name: Angelana

texts.en: Angelana A. is a farmer. She plants vegetables on her farmland and sells them at wholesale and retail prices to farmers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to clear her farm and plant more vegetables to sell. Angelana is 45 years old, married and has five children. She is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.) Angelana says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant

loans.name: Rahima Akbar Group

texts.en:
Robaba is the leader of Rahima Akbar Group. She is married and has 5 children. She assembled a group of four members, each of whom has a different business. Robaba will use this loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy a new sewing machine for her business. 

The second member of Rahima Akbar group is Kamila who wants a loan for her son, who sells dried fruit from a car. With this loan, he wants to complete his inventory. 

The third member, Taiba, wants a loan for her husband. He sells fresh fruit from a cart. With this loan, he wants to buy more fresh fruit for his cart. 

The last member of Rahima Akbar group is Rahima, who is a carpet weaver. With this loan, she wants to buy more equipment for her business. 

They requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani and to further their work and be good clients of Kiva and AFS. Robaba ensures that they can repay the loan on time and says that she can control the whole group. She would like to thank everybody who helps with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa Elena Z. Díaz tiene 33 años de edad y nació en la ciudad de Teustepe Boaco, tras las pocas posibilidades de trabajo en su ciudad natal decidió buscar nuevos horizontes en la capital, ella es casada y tienen dos niñas de las edades de 11 y 2 años de edad, el mayorcito estudia la primaria. Ellos trabajan en una zona franca como operadores de maquinas y de esta manera comparten los gastos del hogar.

Dentro de los gastos está el terminar la construcción de su hogar, de esta manera es que solicita este préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, esto beneficiaria de gran manera a la familia en la vivencia de criar a sus hijos en un lugar cómodo y seguro que ayude al buen desenvolvimiento de los niños hacia un futuro mejor, pero para realizar este fin primero desea invertir capital en la compra de mercadería para vender a su clientela, esto le traerá mejores oportunidades económicas que le aportaran a futuros planes que tenga programado.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena Z. Díaz is 33. She was born in the city of Teustepe Boaco. Because there are few work opportunities in her native city, she decided to look for new horizons in the capital. She is married, and they have two daughters, 11 and 2 years old. The oldest is in primary school. They work in a tax-free zone as machine operators. This way they share the household expenses. Among the expenses is finishing the construction on their house. She is asking for this loan to buy construction materials. This will greatly benefit the family in the house as they raise their children in a comfortable place. It surely helps the children develop well towards a better future. In order to do that she wants to use the loan to buy merchandise to sell to her customers. This will bring better economic opportunities that will contribute to her future plans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila A. is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store, a piggery and fishing.

Mila and her husband, William, have two children who are 15 and 17 years old. The children are currently going to school and help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Mila joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store, a piggery and fishing. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000 from her business activities.

Mila is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 8,000 for her 11th loan, which she intends to use as additional capital for her general store, piggery and fishing businesses. Mila is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy corn

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 27 years old, married and the mother of four children: Titus, Lydia, Kelvin and Dan, ages 10,8, 6 and 4 year.

Gladys operates a salon that she started three years ago, in Kasoiyo. She generates a profit of Kshs, 5,000 per month and has no other source of income. 

Gladys has not borrowed from any other source other than KADET.  She was introduced to KADET by existing clients. She wants to borrow Kshs 20,000 from KADET to purchase stock for her salon, like cosmetics.  If this loan boosts her business Gladys will use the extra profit to educate her children in school.

She has hopes of constructing a big house for her family and also buying a car. Gladys describes herself as active and humble.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics for her salon business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia S. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Delia is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Delia raises crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice to sell. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Delia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Delia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Delia from GDMPC. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain de 29 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Gissell Jaime con quien tiene una niña de nombre Yunieska de 6 añitos estudiando el 1er grado de primaria. Su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Efrain trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 3 años como policia municipal.  

Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y poniendole perlines para que dure mas, y si el dinero lo permita poner el piso a su casa para que su niña tenga mejor comodidad en su casa.  

El mayor deseo que tiene es poder tener una casa bonita, con las condiciones basicas, para que su familia se sienta comoda y que su hija crezca en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Efrain, 29, is married to Gissell Jaime; they have a 6-year-old daughter, Yunieska, who is in first grade. His wife is a domestic employee and she helps him meet household expenses. Efrain has been a police officer for the city of Juigalpa for three years. He is asking for his 3rd loan to make some home improvements; he needs to replace the roof which is in poor condition adding metal edging so that it will last longer.
