If funds are sufficient, he will also install flooring in his house so that his daughter will have more comfort at home His greatest wish is to have a pretty home with basic condition so that his family will feel comfortable and his daughter will grow up in pleasant surroundings

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the roof and install flooring.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 33-year-old businessman who makes a living running a food kiosk in Nairobi. He has been in this business for three years and has one employee. Before he began this business, he was an employee at an independent company. He has applied for a loan for Kes. 50,000 to buy 10 bales of unga wa mahindi (or maize flour), 10 bales of unga ngano (wheat flour) and five cartons of soap. Samuel has four children, and hopes to expand his small company into a wholesale operation and then a supermarket. He says that Faulu Kenya Ltd is helping make this possible and has raised his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy new supplies of flour and soap to sell to his customers

loans.name: Banco Del Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; Nuestros socios viven en el distrito de Huanchac provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Eva; ella tiene 39 años, la socia es casada, y tiene 2 hijos adolecentes, La socia solicita el préstamo para ampliar su pequeño negocio Nuestra socia tiene un pequeño bar en la calle meloc y la socia acondicionará un espacio mayor al que ya tiene y lo decorará y comprará nuevos vasos y algunas bebidas. Nuestros otros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades del hogar con el negocio como, prestar servicio de transporte, protesista dental, ingeniero electrónico, secretaria, empleados en negocios de restaurantes.
  
Los socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members are part of the communal bank, “'Banco del Desarrollo,” or, Development Bank. Our members live in the Huanchac province in the department of Cusco [region around the city of Cusco]. One of our members is Eva; she is 39-years-old, married, and has two adolescent children. She is requesting this loan to expand her small business. She has a small bar on Meloc Street which she will convert to a larger space than she now has, decorate, and buy glasses and some drinks. Our other members alternate their different household activities with businesses and jobs such as: transportation provider, dental technician, electronic engineer, secretary, and as employees in the restaurant business. The partners are thankful for and value greatly the support provided by this means and promise to meet the payments on their debts in the specified time.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Loan to expand small bar.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
K. Mahmud is 48 years old and lives with his wife and four children. His plans for his family are to improve their quality of life and give a better education to all his children. 

Mahmud began working in the fields two years ago. It was his father who taught him how to work with the earth. Mahmud works in farming and also raises cattle, which he sells to bring in extra income. With this loan he will buy farming supplies so his harvest will be good and he can sell it for a good price in the market. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. 

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion V. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Presentacion is married and has nine adult children. To make a living, Presentacion owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Presentacion has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Presentacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Presentacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Presentacion is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Presentacion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en: Adoracion B. is from the village of Mangcuram. She is 47 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Adoracion owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Adoracion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Adoracion is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.es: Vitaliana, de 44 años de edad, es viuda y padre de cuatro hijos. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tiene su techo propio. A Vitaliana nunca le ha gustado depender de nadie, ya que ella misma se la consigue por su propia cuenta, desde luego que su gran fortaleza son sus hijos, debido a que lo motiva a trabajar constantemente en su chacra, en donde cultiva y comercializa su producto de cacao, por el cual  recibe buenas ganancias, incluso cuenta con clientes que siempre compra su producción. Espera con el tiempo ampliar su producción de cacao a gran escala, adquiriendo nuevos terrenos de cultivo y de esa forma mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Pero por el momento continuara trabajando duro y parejo, de esa manera con lo ahorros ganados pueda cumplir su objetivo trazado. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita la ayuda de sus peones para que lo puedan facilitar la extracción de cacao y luego venderlos en los centros de acopio de su propia localidad. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además augura buenos éxitos a su grupo comunal, por la solidaridad y responsabilidad que existe. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos, para que de esa forma le dé un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Vitaliana, age 44, is a widow. She has four children, and they live in the beautiful tropical Peruvian jungle. She has her own home in the Santa Rosa area. Vitaliana has never liked depending on anyone else; she can do things for herself. Her children are her great strength. They are her motivation for constantly working on her farm. She grows and sells cacao. She gets good earnings from this, and she has customers who always buy her product. In time she hopes to increase her cacao production on a large scale. She wants to get new land to cultivate. This will improve her family’s quality of life. For the moment she will continue working hard and consistently. That way, with her savings, she will be able to reach her planned objective. Sometimes her children help her, but during the harvest season she needs workers to help her collect the cacao. The cacao is later sold at local collection centers. This is her second loan with MFP. She pledges to faithfully make her payments. Also, she predicts good success for her communal bank because of the existing solidarity and sense of responsibility. She will use the requested loan to buy supplies and fertilizers. That way she will give her cacao crops adequate maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provide adequate maintenance on her cacao crops

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani has applied for a loan for the expansion of her son’s milk-selling business. With the help of the loan, her son will buy another buffalo which will help him increase his sales and income.

Rani is a 55-year-old lady who has been living with her husband and family in a three-room brick house in Kasur, Pakistan, for the last thirty years. She is the mother of three children; unfortunately none of them could get an education. Her eldest son has taken over his father’s business of selling milk due to his growing old. Her second son drives a horse and cart and her daughter stays at home and manages the household chores with Rani.

Rani hopes that by using the loan to purchase a new buffalo, her son will be able to increase his profits. Milk selling is Rani’s family business and she is confident that it will be improved with this investment and she will be able to save money from the profits for the marriage of her only daughter who is now 17 years of age.

Rani is a regular loan user and is on her 3rd loan. In her previous loans she paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To enable her son to purchase another buffalo for the family dairy business

loans.name: Martina Janett

texts.es: Martina Janet tiene 36 años, ella se dedica a un bar y comedor. Hace más de 2  años que tiene este negocio, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Su comedor está ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad y por medio de los financiamientos ha logrado salir adelante pues no es la primera vez que ha realizado financiamientos. Ella ofrece diferentes platillos variados en donde sus clientes escogen el que más les gusta muchos asisten a su local por es un lugar familiar. Este crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, gaseosas,  pollo, carnes entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Martina Janet is 36 years old and she runs a restaurant bar. She has had this business for more than 2 years. She is a single mother and she has her son in her care. Her restaurant is located in the outskirts of the city and it is thanks to past loans that she has been able to advance. This is not the first time she has received a loan. She has various foods in her menu to offer clients. Many people help out in her restaurant as it is a family setting. This loan will be used to purchase basic grains, soft drinks, chicken, meats and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane Y. is currently in the business of selling dried fish. She is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and more dried fish to sell.  

Jane is 32 years old and is married to a peasant. She has five children and four of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats to rear at home.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Madame Bintou Traoré est une femme mariée de 48 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui vit avec ses enfants chez son époux dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Ayant vite abandonnée l’école, elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus telles la fabrication et vente des jus de fruits devant une école de la place, la vente de pagnes et de savons. Finalement Bintou opta pour la vente de savons  depuis maintenant  plus de 10 ans. Elle est très sollicité et appréciée à Bougouni. 
Ainsi après 8 prêts solidaires, elle décide de venir  au prêt  individuel où elle est à son premier prêt. Tous les autres prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
C’est dans le souci de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle en nette croissance, qu’elle décide de continuer à collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des cartons des savons de différentes sortes. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. La vente se fait dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni, d’une façon ambulante et à domicile, en détail et au comptant.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA. 
Elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise pour devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Ms. Bintou Traoré is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of six children.  She lives with her children at her husband's place in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni.  Having quickly dropped out of school, she decided to operate revenue-generating businesses, such as making and selling fruit juices in front of a local school, selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and selling soaps.  Bintou has been in business for over ten years now.  She is in high demand and much appreciated in Bougouni.  

And so, after eight solidarity loans, Bintou decided to go with individual loans and is now on her first loan.  All the other loans have been correctly repaid. Concerned about further satisfying her customer base, which is clearly growing, she decided to continue to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to buy boxes of soaps of different kinds.  She gets her supplies in Bamako (capital of Mali).  

Her customer base is composed essentially of women. Cash or credit sales are made at home and by going door-to-door in the different districts of Bougouni.  Bintou expects to make a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA.  Her ambition is to expand her enterprise to become a wholesale merchant.

loans.use: Buying soaps

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el sector Bodegones, una zona rural y agrícola del distrito de Lambayeque, se encuentra situada a media hora de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a trabajar en labores agrícolas, el cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar menestras y forraje para animales. Cuando ya es temporada de cosecha las suele vender en su mismo terreno a los comerciantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad el trata de sacar adelante a su familia.

Es esta oportunidad Juan ha sembrado frijol y su cultivo ya se encuentra listo para la cosecha. El no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para realizar esta acción, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Juan es una persona bastante trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien honrado y de confianza.
texts.en:
Juan is a 32 year-old father who lives with his wife and their children in the Bodegones neighborhood, a rural farming area in the Lambayeque district, located a half hour from the city of Chiclayo.  

Juan has been working in agriculture for 10 years; he has some land where he often cultivates beans and forage for animals.  When it is time to harvest, he often sells to the traders who come to visit his area.  With the income this provides, he supports his family.

Now Juan is cultivating beans and his crops are ready to harvest.  He lacks sufficient resources to carry out the harvest, and so he is requesting for the first time a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 500 Peruvian soles.

Juan is a hardworking person who has a strong desire to get ahead.  The people who know him consider him to be an honest and trustworthy person.

loans.use: to cover expenses related to the harvesting of his bean crops

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 22-year-old single man.  He runs a grocery store and also sells charcoal.  Its three years now since he started the business.  He also runs a retail shop so as to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to run his business professionally.  He hopes to have a family and to stabilize his business in the future.  He sees himself growing his business into a wholesale business in the future.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy onions, beans, maize, bananas and lettuce.

loans.use: To buy onions, beans, maize, bananas and lettuce.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana lives in Lahore, famous for its history and culture. She lives there with her family in a 2-room brick house. Farzana is a very caring and supportive lady. She supports her family financially by doing embroidery work. To earn an income, she receives orders from her neighborhood clients and completes the orders on time. 

Her husband is a private entrepreneur and makes beautiful colored jewelry boxes. He makes the boxes from wood and glass, which give an attractive look to his work. His clientele are jewelry sellers. He is very skillful in his art and receives regular orders every month. Timely delivery of products is the key to a successful business and her husband follows this.

Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy glass and wood in larger quantities, which will help him to make more jewelry boxes to fulfill the orders of his customers. 

Farzana is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to improve his business with the help of a loan investment.

loans.use: To buy wood and glass for jewelry box business

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron K. is 43 years old and a resident of Saos Trading Centre in Koibatek town. He is married with eight children. His spouse is Jane, an horticultural farmer. They both support their family. Haron buys and resells livestock as a source of income, and from this business he gets an average profit of Kshs 5,000 a month.
 
Haron has borrowed a third  loan of Kshs 30,000 from Kadet after successfully paying off the second loan. He intends to use Kshs. 10,000 to purchase 10 goats and Kshs. 20,000 to buy young steers for resale later when they are grown.
 
Haron plans to use the anticipated profits to buy more cattle. His hopes and dreams are to become a cattle supplier to  Kenya Meat Commission and also be able to give his children the best education possible.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase beef

loans.name: Yegana

texts.ru:
Yegana M. 37 let. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom , ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjar regiona i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione so svoyey semyoy. Ona ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. 

Yegana uje 8 let kak rabotayet uchitelnicey. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit knigi i testi dlya svoix uchenikov.
texts.en:
Yegana M. is 37 years old. She is an Internally Displaced Person from the Kalbadjar Region, now living in the Absheron Region with her relatives. She is single, without children. 

Yegana has been working as a school teacher for eight years. At present she needs 2,000 AZN in order to buy books and tests for her students.

loans.use: Purchasing books and tests for her students

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn S., 45, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. raises pigs, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 41 on food and USD 25 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a plot of farmland to generate more income from their farming business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan O. is 57-year-old woman and mother who lives in the province of Kompong Tom. Chan O. has no a life partner because her husband died of senility many years ago. She has four children, and all of them are married. Three of her children are employed in different careers, and they always share their benefits with Chan O.. 

Chan O. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. Chan O. has been cultivating rice since 1990, and she always gets good success with her planting following dry season and rainy season. 

Chan O. will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. The loan will provide her with an additional new asset. 

Note: Chan O. and her grandson are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth, tiene 29 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y viven en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Yaneth está trabajando en la provincia de Puacartambo en la comunidad de Patria como docente pero ahora está de vacaciones en la ciudad del Cusco, ella nos cuenta que tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la ciudad del Cusco y está a cargo de unos de sus hermanas. Ya son varios que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. El sueño de Yaneth es abrir un jardín de niños. 

Yaneth pertenece al banco comunal “Kantus” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 29 and lives with her two children in Cusco, Perú. Yaneth works in Puacartambo Province, in the town of Patria as a teacher, but is currently on leave in Cusco.  She has a small general goods store in Cusco, which her siblings help her manage. Business has been very good and so Yaneth seeks a loan to buy more products such as rice, sugar, pasta and other products to increase the store's selection. Yaneth dreams of own day opening a child care center. 

Yaneth belongs to the “Kantus” communal lending bank of the Asociación Arariwa and is grateful for the credit access the group allows her.  She is committed to the timely repayment of her loan.

loans.use: To buy inventory such as sugar, pasta, rice and other products

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay A. is from the village of Muñoz West. He is 34 years old. Jay is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jay owns & operates motorcycle services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to community members. He also keeps busy buying and selling scrap and waste materials in their community. Jay has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jay joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase used bottles and newspapers to sell. Jay is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair the motorcycle used in the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jay from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair the motorcycle used in recycling and transport

loans.name: Gnien

texts.en: Gnien S. is a 51-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to plants rice crops. Her husband is a carpenter who is good at building wooden houses. He earns a profit of approximately $1.50 a day to share responsibility with Gnien S. for the entire family’s expenses. Gnien S. is looking for a loan to buy fertilizers and purchase an ox because her old ox can't support her farm work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and purchase an ox because her old ox can't support her farm work.

loans.name: Kibondo Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis B., who is in her mid-forties, is married with three grown-up children. She has been running a food vendor business for two years.  She works from 6:00am to 9:00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mwanahamis's tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to go to Kilosa, which is about 320 kilometres from Dar es Salam, to take ladies' clothes, pants, and petticoats and sell them to the villagers. She also sold charcoal at her place, Kimara. She paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to go to Kariakoo, which is about three kilometres from the city centre, to buy Arab-style traditional dresses (very long and large, say free-size) and sell them door-to-door.

Mwanahamis will share this loan with her loan group "Kibondo" which has a total of 18 members.  The members of the group will hold each accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Mwanahamis is in the back, fourth from right, just next to a lady in pink.

loans.use: To go to Kariakoo Market and buy long and large dresses.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert K. K. is sixty years old and is married to a business lady. They have three children aged between 33 and 28 years old. His business is located at the busy Likoni market in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attractions,  not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches. 

He sells fruits and vegetables to the local people. He has operated this business for the past twelve years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenges he faces are financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 60,000 to buy fruit and vegetables to expand his business. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He also hopes to get permanent premises from which to run his business. He describes himself as determined and patient.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bitres

texts.en:
Bitres is a single woman who lives with her brother's three children. They live at a rental house that has electricity but lacks piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a second-hand clothes-selling business. She sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Bitres faces a major challenge of competition from other second-hand clothes merchants in the market. She dreams of establishing her own retail shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bales of second-hand clothes and to pay transportation costs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes and pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Juvie

texts.en:
Juvie is from the village of Dioyo, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Juvie is single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $187 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Juvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, rice and corn grits for resale.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children. She plans to fund their education through the income that her loan provides.

Jocelyn is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 10 years. Jocelyn earns PhP 3,000 per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to buy a bigger farm to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Akutwala Ekiro Nakawuka Group

texts.en:
Zzeridda's cinema business is now 7 years old. This kind of entertainment is a booming business, especially in many urban areas of western Uganda. Zzeridda mostly shows Nigerian movies, which are the fascination of many people in Uganda at present.

Zzeridda, a 27-year-old happily married mother of one, says her best friend inspired her to join this business. Before that, she was mostly inclined to a modest poultry business. Zzeridda says success in her business has come from hard work and being friendly to her clients. The business generates 120,000 UGX weekly. Zzeridda plans to use this loan to purchase new movie DVDs to show at her cinema.

loans.use: to purchase new movie DVD'S to show at her cinema

loans.name: Helenita

texts.en:
Helenita is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Helenita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Helenita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Helenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Abduzarif

texts.ru: Абдузариф проживает в районе Руми. Женат. У него трое детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Более пяти лет Абдузариф печет  лепёшки и продаёт их. Кредит берет для закупа муки.
texts.en: Abduzarif lives in the region of Rumy. He is married and has three children. He has secondary education. Abduzarif has been making and selling flat breads for more than five years. He is taking the loan to buy flour.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila tiene 57 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Samuel de 53 años y su querido hijo Bryan de 16 años, a quien desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Lucila a base de trabajo y perseverancia logró situar su negocio en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde hoy su ferretería es una de la más conocida y visitada de la ciudad, debido a la gran variedad de productos que tiene en venta. Ella se esfuerza por tener su negocio bien surtido, es por ello que cada fin de mes viaja a la ciudad de Lima a comprar los materiales que se agotaron. Considera que le agrada ayudar a sus clientes a elegir los mejores productos para sus construcciones, lleva 27 años realizando esta actividad y menciona que lo más difícil es tener que cargar los pesados materiales que trae desde la capital, pero aun así ella sigue firme en sus metas. Con el crédito solicitado comprará materiales de construcción como clavos, fierros y calaminas. Con el tiempo desea, ampliar las instalaciones de su ferretería, para poderle brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es el 11avo crédito con MFP y espera el apoyo de ustedes para llevar a cabo su propósito, además se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es una socia jovial y siempre está pendiente sobre los acuerdos del grupo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, viajará a la ciudad de Lima a comprar más materiales de construcción para implementar su ferretería.
texts.en:
Lucila is 57 years old.  She’s an unassuming, hard working woman living in her own house together with her husband, Samuel, 53, and her beloved son, Bryan, 16, who she wants to provide a better quality of life for.  Based on hard work and perseverance, Lucila managed to establish her business in the city of San Francisco.  Today, her hardware store is one of the best known and most visited in the city due to the large variety of goods she stocks.  She strives to keep the business well stocked and this is why she travels to the city of Lima each week to buy the merchandise she’s run out of.  She enjoys helping her customers choose the best products for their construction projects.  She’s been in this line of work for 27 years and mentions that the most difficult part is having to carry the heavy materials she brings from the capital.  But, even so, she continues firm in her goals.

She will use the requested loan to buy building materials and supplies like nails, iron and plywood.  In time, she’d like to expand the hardware store’s facilities to provide a better service to her customers.

This is the 11th loan with MFP and she hopes to have support from all of you to reach her goals.  At the same time, she commits to repay her loan punctually.  She is a jovial member of the communal bank who is always aware of the agreements reached by the group.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more building materials and supplies to stock her hardware store.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to stock her hardware store.

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Jomar, 44, is married and lives with his three children and his wife, who are his main priority. With this loan he plans to buy supplies for his rice crops. He has some empty land that has nothing planted on it, and so he will plant rice there to use the land and derive benefit from it. He wants to plant his crops under good conditions so that he can take maximum advantage of the land. 

Jomar is requesting a loan of P 15,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pay some other farm expenses.

His goal is to obtain the earnings he needs to get ahead and provide for the well-being of his family. He also wants to save to provide for his security in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer, and pay some other farm expenses.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is 59 years old, married and has 4 children. He does poultry farming to earn a living for his family. He has managed to retain his business for 3 years through the financial support from Faulu Kenya. Edward hopes that one day he will build houses for rental to generate more income. He has requested a loan for 45,000 KES to buy chicks and chick mash and to renovate the poultry house.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chick mash and to renovate the poultry house

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE II” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Basilia; tiene 51 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 4 hijos todos ellos estudiantes en diferentes ramas y en el colegio los últimos;  La socia se dedica a embotellar agua, la socia se dedica  embotellar agua mineral, la socia tiene una planta de procesamiento de agua es pequeña y ella trabaja en esto junto con sus familia, la socia está encargada de el proceso final que es el embotellamiento de agua y la verificación final de las maquinas. La socia es socia del banco comunal  y trabajando con este sistema de banca ella empezó a crecer poco a poco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una maquinaria para el embotellamiento de agua.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "COMUZONE II." The bank is located in Huanchac District, in Cusco Province and Department.

Basilia is 51 years old and married. She has 4 children, each of them students; the younger ones are in secondary school and the others are in different majors. Basilia bottles mineral water and has a small water-processing plant that she runs with her family. She is in charge of the last step, which is the bottling of the water and the final check-up of the equipment.

Basilia is a member of the communal bank, and she started to grow little by little working with this bank system. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of a machine to bottle water.

She is grateful for the support offered and accordingly she is committed to fulfilling the payment installments in a disciplined fashion.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a machine to bottle water.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El Señor Fernando tiene 61 años de edad, está casado con la  Señora Maria de 56 años de edad, ellos llevan 35 años de casados y tienen la dicha de tener 3 hijos, todos ya profesionales en distintas áreas tuvo la dicha de verlos convertirse en grandes profesionales gracias a su sacrificio y la de su señora y desea ir trabajando como lo viene haciendo ya que de esa manera brinda empleo a lugareños de la zona.
El Señor Fernando es carpintero hace ya 40 años, fue adquiriendo este oficio gracias a que desde pequeño empezó a trabajar como secretario y después pudo independizarse gracias al pequeño ahorro que estuvo haciendo a lo largo de su trabajo. Además de eso su señora lo ayuda incansablemente en su labor día a día.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas y maderas para la utilización en su taller. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Fernando is 61 years old and married to 56-year-old Maria.  They have been married for 35 years and are lucky enough to have three children, who are all professionals in different fields.  Fernando was lucky enough to see them become professionals thanks to his own sacrifice and that of his wife.  He would like to continue working as he has been doing because, in this way, he provides work to people in his area.

Fernando has been a carpenter for 40 years.  He started working in this trade because when he was very young he worked as a secretary.  He was able to start working independently thanks to a small amount of savings that he managed to make in that job.  Fernando's wife also helps him untiringly in his daily work.

Fernando is requesting a loan to buy tools and wood to use in his workshop.  He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that they are giving him because this loan will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools to use in his workshop

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is married with 6 children, is 48 years old and lives in Danlugan, Pagadian City.

Dolores has a  business buying and selling livestock, and earns approximately PHP 35,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan of 35,000 to purchase a goat and cow for her business.

Dolores has been a member of PMPC for more than 5 years. And in the future, Dolores hopes to have her own Piggery.

loans.use: to purchase a goat and cow for her livestock business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, aged 31, is married and they have two children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past seven years.

He learned about KADET through a registered client, and he has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD which he plans to use to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. 

He hopes to make a profit and use it to purchase sheep for fattening. He dreams of becoming a well-known farmer in the area.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson paid his previous loan well and in good time. He still grows crops in his area of abode.  He managed to harvest a lot of food, which he sold and from which he was able to get better returns.

He is applying for his third loan term with KADET . Samson will use the loan to buy farm manure and seedlings for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to export his farm produce which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Isaul

texts.es:
Isaul de 49 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Isaul se dedica desde 2 años a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral (gallinas y pavos) y ovinos, su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo los puede ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.  También cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembre limón,una vez que cosecha lo comercializa y tiene otro ingreso económico para su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo, una vez que se engorden sus aves los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más dinero para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Isaul es una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante, en especial que sus hijos logren sus metas.
texts.en:
Isaul is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children. The only service they receive is electricity. Isaul resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

For the past two years, Isaul has been raising and selling poultry (chickens and turkeys) and sheep. His animal pen is located in an area behind his house. The animals are fed a diet of balanced feed, grasses, and natural grains. Once the animals have reached optimal growth, they are offered for sale to his customers. The income he generates is used for his household expenses. In addition, Isaul has his own farmland on which he grows lemons. When his crops are harvested, they are sold as an additional source of household income.

Isaul is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can buy balanced feed for his animals and fertilizers to improve his farmland. As soon as his poultry are fattened, they will be sold at different markets in the area. By obtaining a good price for these birds, he will have more money to improve his quality of life. Isaul is a hardworking and responsible person whose only wish is for his family to move forward, especially seeing his children achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his animals and fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 29 years old and live in Paynesville.  She lives together with her partner and has two children, aged 2 and 9.  One of the children attends school and two of them stay at home. 

For the past six years, Martha has been selling plantains in the local market.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantains for her business. Martha says she started this business with money given to her by her sister and she learned this business from her.  She really likes her business because it provides for her needs.  She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: buy plantains

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He supports his brother, their main source of income, in order to satisfy their family's needs and to enrich their way of living. 

Alaa has owned a vegetables shop since 2007 and he is looking forward to grow up his business. Today, he needs to borrow $1200 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new products for his shop. This will certainly boost his productivity and augment his profits. In the future, he plans to deliver vegetable to the suburbs.

loans.use: to purchase new products for his shop.

loans.name: Jake

texts.en: At the young age of 19, Jake has already married and has one child.  He is able to support his family through his corn farm business. Sometimes, there are problems and complexity he comes across, but through his strong determination, he can survive. Jake aims to cultivate one and half hectares of farm land to plant more corn but he lacks the necessary capital. Thus, he wants to take out a loan of P25,000 to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. He believes that this loan will help him growth his business. He is hoping that he will have a plentiful harvest to support his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Sharon Atieno

texts.en: Sharon is a widow and has three children ranging from two to seven years old. She is a polite and hardworking woman. For the last four years, she has been selling second-had clothes to frequent customers. Previously, she was involved in green grocery activity. She has a challenge of financial constraints in her business. She will be using the loan of Kes 10,000 to buy more clothes for selling. Sharon hopes and dreams to expand her business in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Risbu

texts.ru: Рысбу родилась в южной Ошской области, в селе Кулча. В 1985 году, по окончании школы, она поступила в Медицинское училище в г.Кызыл-Кие. 1986 году, когда Рысбу окончила первый курс, ее украли замуж (старинная традиция «кражи невест» просуществовала долгое время, в настоящий момент преследуется по закону вплоть до уголовной ответственности).   Из-за замужества Рысбу пришлось бросить учебу и стать домохозяйкой. 1990 году у Рысбу родился старший сын Токтаалы, а в 1993 - родился младший сын Бегалы. В 2000 году Рысбу со своей семьей переехала в Чуйскую область (северная часть страны) в с.Ровное, где они сняли чабанский дом. Для семьи Рысбу начался трудный период - супруг не работал, после операции Рысбу стала инвалидом. В 2009 году, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, Рысбу начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с покупки одной дойной коровы. На сегодня ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молочных продуктов составляет примерно 4,500 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости, Рысбу с мужем смогли приобрести подержанный автомобиль и супруг Рысбу начал предоставлять услуги такси. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рысбу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Это позволит ей увеличить продажи молока и повысить свою прибыль.  Доходы Рысбу хочет вложить в постройку дома для своей семьи.
texts.en: Risbu was born in the southern Osh region, in the Kulcha village.  In 1985, after finishing school, she was accepted to the Medical college in the city of Kyzyl-Kiya.  In 1986, when Risbu completed her first year of college, she was stolen to marry (an old tradition of "stealing brides" that has existed for a long time and is currently persecuted by law up to a criminal responsibility).  Because of the marriage, Risbu had to stop her education and become a housewife.  Her oldest son, Toktaaly, was born in 1990, and her youngest son, Begaly, was born in 1993.  In 2000, Risbu and her family moved to the Chuysk region (northern part of the country) to the Rovnoye village, where they rented a shepherd's house.  This is when a difficult period for Risbu's family began - her husband did not work, and Risbu became disabled after an operation.  In 2009, Risbu started her own animal husbandry business to provide a source of income for her family after purchasing one dairy cow.  Today, the monthly profit from sales of milk products amounts to about 4,500 som (KGS).  Thanks to hard work and persistence, Risbu and her husband were able to purchase a used car, and Risbu's husband began providing a taxi service.  In order to further develop her business, Risbu requested a loan in the sum of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase a dairy cow.  This will allow her to increase milk sales and her profits.  Risbu plans to invest the profits into building a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Miranda

texts.en:
Miranda is applying for a loan for the first time; she wants to increase the income by buying another dairy cow. She sells milk to the local market of a nearby city.

Miranda is 28 years old and married and has a seven-year-old child. She lives in the southeastern Albania and practices livestock activity. 

“I started five years back, and I haven’t got bored of it yet,” she said with a smile. “Even if I got bored, there is nothing better I could do, so, all in all it’s okay. I have gotten used to the daily routine now” she continued saying with laughter.

loans.use: to add another milk cow

loans.name: Elise's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Elise, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 40 ans est mariée à un certain Guillaume. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Elise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Elise et son mari. Elise n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Elise vend de la bouillie accompagné de beignets à base de farine de blé, des chaussures et du charbon de bois à son domicile depuis huit ans. Elise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Elise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter de la farine de blé, des chaussures et du charbon de bois.

loans.name: Arben

texts.en: Arben is 43 years old married with one child. He is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He earns an income from his transport service business. He started it almost ten years ago and he earns 10,000 PHP a month. To improve his business, he is borrowing 20,000.00 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional accessories and tires. Before long, He is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Carmen Amalia

texts.en:
Carmen is a very hard working and engaging woman. It has been 9 years since she started her small store, running it from her own home. She is married and she has three children, all of whom help her with the business. Her primary goal has always been to financially support her husband and to put their children first. Their children are currently completing their education. With this business Carmen and her family have been able to overcome difficult times, and now she needs a loan in the amount of $925 for the purchase of merchandise to increase her selection and generate greater sales.

You can become part of Carmen and her family\'s efforts. Help them continue on and help them grow. The choice is yours. Your generosity is of great help to them. They are grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, desde hace 9 años que inició con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su propio domicilio. Es casada y tiene 3 hijos, quienes le ayudan con el negocio. Su principal objetivo siempre ha sido poder apoyar a su esposo económicamente y salir adelante con sus hijos, quienes están estudiando. Con este negocio Carmen y su familia han podido superar tiempos difíciles, ahora ella necesita un crédito por la cantidad de $925 dólares para poder comprar mercancía y surtir mejor su tienda de abarrotes para que le genere más ingresos.

Tú puedes ser parte de los logros de Carmen y su familia, ayúdalos a continuar y seguir creciendo, la decisión ésta en tus manos, tu generosidad es de mucho apoyo para ellos. No lo sudes más y decídete, ellos te lo agradecen.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Benjamin Paa Kow

texts.en:
Ben is 38 years old and married with 1 child. He was educated up to G.C.E. Advanced level. From his own meagre resources, he was able to establish an auto parts shop which he still operates. Items on sale include bolts and nuts, refurbished radiators and other assorted used car parts.

He has benefited from KRABAN'S 'TEACH' learning sessions. He wants to use the KIVA loan to stock up other items like used rims, tyres and lubricants for sale.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Pon-Lork

texts.en:
Pon-lork was married in 1996 and has 2 children, 1 son and 1 daughter. Both of her children attend primary school. She herself only completed year 7. She learned to make scarves from her mother when she was 8 years old. Her husband is a construction mason.

She wants to borrow from MAXIMA for the first time with the loan amount of $1,000. She is going to use this loan to purchase thread, prepare thread on the loom for weaving, and set up one more loom. According to the assessment, she has the ability to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing thread, preparing thread on the loom for weaving, and buying one more loom.

loans.name: Munojot

texts.ru:
Munojot, 35 is married and has 3 children. She has been selling on a market for 6 years. The goods that she sells include clothing for children, socks for men and women, and other small items. Munjot’s children are small and Munjot’s mother-in-law takes care of them. Munjot buys and delivers her goods from a wholesaler in Istaravshan. Munjot does not have a permanent trading spot, so she has to sell wherever she can find a place. Her husband sends money from Russia, where he works as a seasonal laborer. Munjot became a MicroInvest borrower a year and a half ago. Then, her business assets were about $450. By now, Munjot more than doubled the value of her business. Munjot hopes to use the new loan to continue expansion of her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муночот 35 лет, она замужем и у нее 3 детей. В течении 6 лет она выходит на базар торговать. Ассортимент ее товаров составляет детская одежда, мужские и женские носки и другая мелочевка. Дети Муночот маленькие и за ними следит дома ее теща. За товаром Муночот ездит на оптовый рынок в г. Истаравшан. У нее нет постоянного места для торговли и она торгует где придется. Ее муж находится в России и присылает деньги. В Микроинвест она начала кредитоваться 1,5 года назад. Тогда объем ее бизнеса составлял примерно $450. Сейчас он увеличился более чем в 2 раза. Новый займ она собирается потратить на увеличение объема продаваемых товаров.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ming

texts.en:
Mrs. Ming, 44, sells fish at the local market and earns $4 per day. The photograph shows her husband, 45, who earns $3 per day as a farmer. The couple has one child who earns $100 per month working at a hotel.

Mrs Ming is requesting this loan to purchase more fish to increase her inventory at the market and thereby increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to increase her inventory and revenue.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela Marlene M. runs a small neighborhood business making and selling home-cooked foods. She specializes in items such as grilled meats, sausage and pork. Additionally, she sells baby clothing, wool hats and other clothing.

She currently lives with her partner, Hugo Villalba, in Fernando de la Mora, Paraguay. Together they have six children. The three younger children live with Estela and Hugo. Their oldest child is now independent, contributes to his parents’ monthly income and helps pay for his siblings school fees.

Estela began her store 17 years ago to help her parents earn enough money to sustain their family. Because she had to begin working at a young age, Estela was unable to continue her schooling. A few years after she began working, she took out a small loan and began selling office supplies and jewelry. Later, she starting making food to sell, which increased her income.

Her dream is that her children will be able to stay in school and obtain decent jobs when they graduate. To make this possible, Estela has applied for a loan to build her own kiosk, which will allow her increase her income by selling more food.

loans.use: For the construction of a kiosk

loans.name: Tagoygul

texts.ru:
Tagoygul S., who is 53, is married and has 6 children. Tagoygul takes care of the house and the animals. Using the loan, she plans to purchase 2 cows that can be fed over time and resold later on. She plans to hold the cattle for 40 to 45 days before she sells it. Because she spends all her time at home, she will use this activity as a source of income that will enable her to become independent and to purchase things necessary for maintenance of her family. Her son helps her in the sales of cattle.

Tagoygul plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova. Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипова Тагойгул, возраст – 53 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 6-х детей. Тагойгул домохозяйка, она занимается домашним хозяйством. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести 2 головы крупного рогатого скота для их откормки и продажи. Так как целыми днями она находится дома, приобретя домашний скот она будет ухаживать за ним и после откормки, через 40-45 дней будет продавать его, что позволит ей получать небольшую прибыль, которая поможет Тагойгул быть независимой, а также приобретать необходимые вещи на деньги заработанные собственным трудом. В продаже скота ей помогает ее сын. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 cows for future resale

loans.name: Agueda De Jesús

texts.es:
Mrs. Agueda Gonzáles is a lady who sells soft drinks, in the department of Leon in Nicaragua. For most of her life, Agueda has struggled in order to be able to bless her two children with schooling, since she must take care of these little ones by providing support for all their needs. She decided to sell soft drinks which she makes herself, as well as carbonated sodas, with the goal of helping out her husband, since he does not earn enough to maintain their household.

She has had her soft drink business for 15 years, selling in the food section inside the central market of Leon. In order to improve her standard of living and that of her business, for the past 4 years she has received loans from Ceprodel, which have had a strong impact on her business since she has been able to acquire larger quantities of ingredients to make the soft drinks and in addition, to acquire larger quantities of carbonated sodas to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Agueda Gonzáles es una dama que se dedica al negocio de la venta de refrescos en el departamento de León en Nicaragua., la mayor parte de su vida la Sra. Agueda se ha esforzado para poder bendecir a sus dos hijos con los estudios ya que debe de cuidar a estos pequeños brindándoles apoyo en sus necesidades. Decide vender refrescos elaborados por ella misma y de igual manera gaseosas con el único fin de apoyar a su esposo por el hecho de que su trabajo no percibe las ganancias suficientes para mantener su hogar.

Hoy en día tiene 15 años de tener el negocio de la venta de refrescos vendiéndolos en el sector de alimentos al interior del mercado central en León y para poder mejorar su condición de vida y el de su negocio, desde hace 4 años viene realizando créditos con Ceprodel que le han impactado fuertemente en su negocio ya que adquiere mayores cantidades de materia prima para elaborarlos y además adquiere mayores cantidades de gaseosas para brindarlas a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make soft drinks and also to buy carbonated sodas

loans.name: Agustin Rubio 1 Group

texts.es:
During the week Maria works selling omelets in a local store. This way she earns income to manage her home. Maria is 40 years old and has 5 children. For this reason she must look for work. On Sundays she works in an area in the market where she sells food. She has done this for four years. With the requested loan she would like to purchase merchandise and enlarge her inexpensive little kitchen. The other members of the group are Ana Lidia P. (works selling shoes), Miguelita de Jesus C. (works selling kitchen utensils), and Julia Viviana P. (works selling tacos).

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

MANERA DE TENER INGRESOS PARA EL HOGAR, DURANTE LA SEMANA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE TORTILLAS EN UNA LOCAL DE SU COMUNIDAD OBTENIENDO UNA PEQUEÑA REMUNERACION POR SU MARIA TIENE 40 AÑOS, TIENE 5 HIJOS POR LO QUE TIENE QUE BUSCAR LA TRABAJO Y LOS DOMINGOS CUENTA CON UN ESPACIO EN EL MERCADO EN DONDE VENDE COMIDA LO HACE DESDE HACE CUATRO AÑOS, CON EL CREDITO DESEA COMPRAR MERCANCIA Y AGRANDAR SU COCINITA ECONOMICA, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON ANA LIDIA PÉREZ SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO, MIGUELITA DE JESUS C. VENDE UTENCILIOS PARA LA COCINA Y JULIA VIVIANA PÉREZ VENDE TACOS.

loans.use: To purchase cooking utensils and products

loans.name: Budumbuli West B (I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zayida N.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock purchases. Zayida is 22 years old and married. She has 2 children aged 1.5 and 3, and one child goes to school. Each week, Zayida makes approximately UGX 280000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save. Zayida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Zayida is joined in her small group by Mary K., Florence K. and Halima M.. Mary K. has a business selling clothes and wants to expand her business. Florence K. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to increase her purchases. Halima M. operates a welding business and wants to purchase welding materials.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Arshad's Group

texts.en: B. is a mother of three. Her children currently are too young to attend school, what will do so in the immediate future. B. and her husband applied for a loan earlier to purchase cotton to support themselves in the grain market. B. and her husband would now like to apply for a loan to purchase a donkey cart, which will allow them to transport more materials and increase their profits. In addition, B.’s family owns a grocery store and also a toiletry dispensal service. With these sources of income, B. and her family are able to earn enough to support her family, but would like to increase her income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: Buy an additional donkey cart

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu sells cigarettes, bread fied fish, bananas and busuits by the roadside in Makeni town.  With the rain season approaching, she will move the business in the homestead where she has no many customers.  Isatu also would like to increase her stock to generate more income for the family.  Her husband is a retired ploice officer and to not have other source of income.  Isatu is requesting a loan of Le.1000,000 for the purpose.  Isatu is 41 years old and with four children.

loans.use: Constract a shelter and increase her stock.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru:
Shahlo M. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 31 years old and not married. She lives with her parents and trades for a living. She sells ice cream at the main market. She wants to purchase another refregirator in order to increase product variety. She wants to purchase drinks for sale. This is why she hopes to receive a loan, which she plans to repay within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Матчиева Шахло жительница города Явана. Ей 31 год . она не замужем. Живет со своими родителями . на жизнь она зарабатывает путем торговли . Торгует мороженным на центральном рынке. Хочет купить еще один холодильник для того , чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара. Хочет закупить напитки и продавать их на разлив. Для этого она планирует получить кредит погасить который сможет погасить в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 47 year-old Tatu R.. She is married and has five children, aged between 14 and 33. In 1996, Tatu established her charcoal business. Working seven days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $170 every month from this business. Tatu requires a loan in order to buy more charcoal in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $43. She thanks you for your support.

These small, black and dirty pieces of dry earth are important, not just to charcoal sellers, but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Domina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is thirty-one-year-old Domina A. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children under the age of five. Domina runs a stationery store in the Tabata district of Dar, which she established in 2006. The foresight and insight of people who have never received any training in business management, never ceases to amaze me. Stationary sales is a business where such wisdom is demonstrated, with most sellers placing their shops, stalls, tables or bodies strategically near to post offices, banks, schools and universities.

Domina is no exception! Her well-situated store earns her US$ 200 in monthly profits. Domina further demonstrates her business acumen through the intended use of her loan. She is requesting $875 to buy a photocopier which she will then allow her customers to use for a fee. I’m confident that Domina will be able to obtain a good return on her investment before the end of her loan term.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client.

The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier for her stationery store

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel Z. L. is in the process of applying to purchase a home through a Mexican government program called Infonavit.  Infonavit provides working families with a low cost mortgage to purchase a small starter home. Some families’ incomes land them just short of qualifying for the program, however. This Kiva loan allows them to make up the difference with a small supplementary loan and thus qualify to purchase their first home. La  señora Maria Isabel Z. López va a tramitar una casa de infonavit por que desea empezar un patrimonio para su hija ya que ella es madre soltera.Prefiere estar pagando  su propia casa en lugar de pagar renta . Maria trabaja en una maquiladora de esta misma ciudad con  el transcurso de los años ella ha recopilado ciertos dinero para tramitar su casa pero aun así no completa la cantidad para la casa. Ella solicita la cantidad de $325 dólares.

loans.use: Comprar casa

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar Z. is 54 years old, married and has three children.  He runs his wholesale drink business in a store that he has rented for more than 20 years in the center of Sabirabad City.

Eldar sells soft drinks and the majority of his clients are wedding organizers.  He has very flexible rates and this attracts many customers to his business.  He has applied for a loan of US$1200 to purchase natural juices which will expand his product line and enhance his business.

loans.use: to purchase natural juices and expand his business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace Y. is 45 years old and married with 3 children. Grace is a fashion designer. She makes lovely Nigerian clothes for her customers. She has some girls that assist her in designing clothes. She needs the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell to her customers and also to use in designing the clothes of her customers. She has a store where she sews clothes. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to use and sell

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Yesenia tiene 23 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres. Para solventar sus gastos se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace 2 años, siendo ella tan joven siempre ha querido forjarse un futuro mejor, es por eso que decidió incursionar en este negocio. Trabaja desde las 5 a.m. hasta aproximadamente las 7 a.m., elaborando el pan para luego distribuirlo por las tiendas. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es la elaboración del pan, ya que ella trabaja con un horno casero, con el cual el ambiente llega a temperaturas un tanto excesivas, aún así Yesenia sabe que la única manera de progresar es trabajando muy duro y es por eso que busca mejorar día a día. Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará mayor cantidad de insumos e ingredientes para elaborar pan, además de algunos accesorios para que su pequeña panadería pueda ser mucho más productiva y le arroje mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 23 years old and single, and she lives at home with her parents. To be able to make ends meet, she has been making a living by baking and selling bread for the past two years. Being that she is so young, she has always wanted to work toward a better future, which is why she decided to start the bakery. She works from approximately 5-7 a.m. baking the bread, which she then distributes to various stores. The most difficult part about her job is making the bread, since she bakes with her home oven and the temperature can get quite excessive. However, Yesenia knows that the only way to make progress is to keep working very hard, and that's why she looks to improve from day to day. This is her first loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting she will purchase a larger quantity of ingredients to make her breads, as well as buy some accessories so her small bakery can be much more productive and she can earn a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of ingredients

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is a 22-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon. Ziad installs aluminum. He works with all kinds of aluminum, like the aluminum used in kitchens, windows, and doors. Ziad has requested a loan of $800 US dollars from Al Majmoua to maintain his machines and purchase merchandise. This is the first time that Ziad has requested a loan.

Ziad is known for his honesty and good work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he wasn’t able to acquire all the tools needed for his work because of their high prices. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Ziad will use the loan to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maura Estela

texts.es:
En el Mercado la Estación de la ciudad de León, la señora Maura Estela P. se dedica a su negocio de elaboración de alimentos preparados por ella misma y ofertados en el mercado.

Es importante destacar que  ella se ha caracterizado por elaborar deliciosos alimentos y por este motive las personas le visitan diariamente para comprarle. Hoy en día la razón por la que solicita el crédito en Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar la materia prima y así preparar los alimentos brindando mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the Estación Market in the city of León, señora Maura Estela P. has her business of making food herself and selling it in the market. It is important to point out that she is characterized by making delicious food, and for this reason, people visit her daily to buy it from her. The reason she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel is to purchase supplies to prepare her food so she can offer better attention to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif F. is a young, energetic guy who wants to improve his family's living conditions. He is 22 years old and lives in Imishli, Azerbaijan. He has a shop where he sells spare parts for foreign and Russian cars. He has been involved in this business for more than three years; he helped out his father before he opened his own shop. He provides spare parts for cars and provides his family with food and other necessities.

There is a great demand for Vasif's spare parts, so he wants to buy more supplies to meet his clients' demands. He is seeking an individual loan to expand his shop's inventory. He has pledged to repay this loan within 15 months. Vasif is excited about this loan and would like to thank everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Marlene,

texts.es:
Durante seis años Marlene estuvo trabando en un negocio de copias impresiones y tipeos al frente de la Universidad de Lima. Debido al excesivo tiempo que le tomaba movilizarse hasta su centro de trabajo y también a la cantidad de horas de trabajo, Marlene finalmente decidió abandonar aquel trabajo y crecer con su pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos

Hoy en día ya lleva alrededor de siete años vendiendo cosméticos por catalogo. Sin embargo, este negocio no es suficiente para poder mantener sola a su hijo de dieciocho años. Para poder darle estudios superiores, desde hace dos años que Marlene trabaja en una casa para el servicio domestico.

Ella es madre soltera y sus cuarenta años, más adelante tiene planes de abrir una tienda-bazar en su casa.
texts.en:
For six years, Marlene had been working at a company that provides copy, printing and typing services in front of the University of Lima. Because of her hours and her long commute to work, Marlene finally decided to leave that job and expand her cosmetics sales business.
