She has now been selling cosmetics by catalog for seven years. However, this job does not give her enough profits to support her 18-year-old son on her own. In order for her to be able to provide him with a higher education, she has been working as a housekeeper. She is a 40-year-old single mother who plans on opening a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tuition for son’s Environmental Engineering studies

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Mrs. Kamala N., a resident of Sainbu-Bhaishipati, lives in a single family home with her husband and two children. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband, Mr. Krishna N., works in a private office. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 5 and daughter is in grade 4.

Mrs. N. is engaged in goat farming. Now she has four goats on her farm. She sells the goats in the local market. This business helps her to contribute something to upgrade the living standards of her family. Now she is requesting a the third loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy a few more goats and foods grains for the goats.

loans.use: To buys goats

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Roberto M. ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual fue para completar su vivienda ya se la  entregaron pero le está haciendo falta algunos detalles, para el lo mas importante es  ponerle las protecciones en las puertas y ventanas a la casa.  
En esté momento está solicitando un préstamo para ponerle las protecciones y así poderla habitar, y  su familia esté más segura cundo el se encuentre trabajando.  Ya que en la fabrica en la que es empleado esta en turno de noche.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto M. has had a loan with FVP with which he completed his home but he is still missing some details, the most important of which is putting security bars on the doors and windows of his home. Today he is asking for a loan to install security bars and be able to live in the home and his family will be safe while he is working. He is employed on the night shift in a manufacturing plant.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install security bars on the doors and windows of his home

loans.name: Nur

texts.es:
Nur es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes, es conviviente tiene 49 años, tiene tres hijos de 27, 25 y 19 años que estudian y trabajan.

Nur estudio computación, trabajo en el ministerio de pesquería, lo dejo por que se caso y se dedico a cuidar a sus hijos, hasta que se separo de su esposo vio en la necesidad  económica y  empezó con el negocio de alquiler de ecran y lo dejo por que le robaron entro en el negocio de  venta las joyas por una amiga que le animo, ella vista colegios, oficinas, empresas desde hace cinco años. 

Nur necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de joyas de plata y de fantasía, collares, pulseras y aretes. 

Desde que esta en Finca, da gracias por la oportunidad de los prestamos, ella inicio su negocio con los prestamos compro un  ecran para proyectar películas, aprendió a organizarse en su negocio, el curso que ha recibido de Finca le ayudo a sacar sus costos y ganancias, puede llevar una mejor contabilidad.        
El sueño de Nur es tener una tienda  propia de joyas.
texts.en:
Nur is a member of the community bank Virgin of the Mercy, lives with her spouse, is 49 years old and has three children of 27, 25 and 19 years of age. They all work and study. Nur studied computers and worked in the department of fishing. She stopped working when she got married and dedicated her time to the care of her children. When she separated from her husband, her financial needs prompted her to start a business of renting video screens. She had to give this up when she got burglarized. Her friend got her interested in the business of selling jewelry. She has been visiting schools, offices, and companies for the last five years. Nur needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase silver and costume jewelry, necklaces, bracelets and earrings. Since she has been with Finca, she is grateful for the loans. She started her business with a loan, purchased a movie screen and learned to organize her business. The course that she received from Finca helped her keep track of her expenses and revenues. She can now account for them better. Her dream is to have her own jewelry store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nur needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase silver and costume jewelry, necklaces, bracelets and earrings.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem K., 50, lives in the province of Pursat, Cambodia, where she owns and runs a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She can plant her crops twice a year, and she was taught this by her grandfather. She is currently a good mother of four children, all four of them are single and help with their mother's farm work when they are not studying. To help meet a little more of the family's needs, her husband makes charcoal for sale.

In the past, Yem K. always hired the neighbor's cow to plow the farmland in order to grow crops. She has been planning to buy a cow but could not due to the family's financial problems. Therefore, she has decided to seek a loan on Kiva to buy a pair of cows to support her farming business.

loans.use: To buy a pair of cows

loans.name: Geoconda Marbelly

texts.es: Doña Geoconda es casada, tiene 33 años, trabaja junto a su esposo como negociantes de productos lacteos (queso y crema), tienen 2 hijos, los cuales estudian la primaria, ella esta solicitando su primer credito para la construccion de un pantry y la ceramica de la cocina, manifiesta que una vez realizada esta obrea solicitara otro credito para la construccion del gabinete que en estos momentos se lo hacen demasiado caro.  En su casa tiene comodidades en lo que se refiere a la sala, dormitorio, baños , pero le hace falta la cocina para contar con una vivienda digna y con condiciones para sus hijos. Es una persona reconocida en la comunidad y con excelentes recomendaciones.  El producto de la venta lo hacen fuera de Juigalpa para venderlo mejor, ya que es de calidad, consideran pagar en tiempo y forma el credito.
texts.en:
Geoconda is married, is 33 years old, and works with her husband as dairy products (cheese and cream) merchants; they have 2 children who are in primary school. She is requesting her first loan to build a pantry and to tile the kitchen; she mentions that once she is finished with this construction job she will request another loan to built cabinets that are currently too expensive. In her house she has a living room, room, and bathrooms that make her house comfortable but she is does not have a kitchen to make her house suitable with the proper living conditions for her children. She is a well-known person in the community and with excellent references. They carry out their sales outside of Juigalpa to sell more given that they sell a quality product; they plan to pay their loan back on time and completely.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a pantry and tile the kitchen.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 40 años, está separada de su pareja, vive con 4 sus hijos; Jhon de 22, Wini de 14, Jorge de 11 y Alvaro de 8 años. Su negocio es la venta de fruta, la cual trae desde la ciudad de Huaral (a 3 horas de Lima) en su propio carro que maneja ella misma. A Flor le gusta sentirse independiente, pues se considera una mujer muy fuerte y que puede lograr lo que se propone; además cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, que si bien no la ayudan con labores físicas siempre están con ella para darle ánimos y pasar tiempo junto a ellos es otra de las ventajas que posee con su trabajo. Pero no todo es tan fácil, ya que el peligro en las carreteras es cada vez más frecuente, felizmente Flor siempre toma precauciones y conduce con mucho cuidado. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la venta de lotes (terrenos), para una empresa de bienes raíces, aprovechando así, su auto para el traslado de sus posibles clientes hasta los terrenos que ofrece. En el futuro, a Flor le gustaría incursionar en otro tipo de negocio, pero aún no se decide en cual, por lo pronto se siente feliz con lo que hace. Ella se encuentra en 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y muy amistosa con sus compañeras de grupo, quienes le tienen mucha estima. Con el dinero solicitado refaccionará algunas averías de su carro para que pueda funcionar en óptimas condiciones, también comprará más fruta para la venta.
texts.en:
Flor is 40 years old and she is separated from her partner. She lives with her 4 kids; John who is 22, Wini who is 14, Jorge who is 11 and Alvaro who is 8 years old. She is in business selling fruit which she brings from Huaral (3 hours from Lima) in her own car that she drives. Flor likes to feel independent and she considers herself to be a strong woman who can achieve what she puts her mind to. She also is supported by her kids who, although not helping with physical labour, are always with her encouraging her and spending time with them is one of the advantages of the job.

However, it is not always easy and the highways are more and more dangerous. Happliy for Flor she is a very careful driver. Moreover, she also sells plots of land for a real estate company and she also uses her car to take clients to see the plots that she's offering. In the future Flor would like to have a different type of business, although she hasn't decided in what yet, but at the moment she is happy with what she is doing. This is her ninth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she has always been very punctual with her payments. She is friendly with many members of her group who look up to her a lot. With this loan she will tune up some parts of her car so that it runs at its best. She will also buy more fruit to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and to tune up her car/Incremento de mercadería y refacción de su carro

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en: Jeanette L. is from the town of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin. She is 39 years old, is separated from her spouse and has five school-aged children. Jeanette owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In April 2009, Jeanette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jeanette is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Seeds and tools

loans.name: Uranbold

texts.en:
Uranbold N. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Chingletei district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son and daughter both currently attend high school.

Along with his wife, Lkhagvaa, Uranbold operates a tea house. His business is very popular – it has many regular customers in the area and is a favorite among the local microbus drivers. Uranbold started his tea house in 2005 with capital of 230,000 MNT. He currently employs one cook and his wife helps out by keeping all the records of the business.

The tea house has been operating successfully for four years. Uranbold attributes his success as a businessman to his experience, soft temperament, and his helpful, hardworking nature. He hopes to use the continued success of the tea house to expand into a cafe, and he also wants to save for his children's education. Uranbold is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to renovate his tea house into a cafe.

loans.use: To renovate his tea house into a cafe

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en: Theresah D. sells fruits and vegetables in small quantities at Abrodzirum near Shama-kedzi. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a teacher. Theresah has junior high school education. She has been in her business since 2003. She is responsible for paying fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fruits, vegetables and other food supplies to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and other food supplies to sell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando C., 53 years old, is the father of two children and is a rice grower in Norala, Sout Cotabato. His eldest is 19 years old. He wants to send his child to college but his income is not enough to afford the tuition fees, books and other school fees.

Now, Fernando needs to borrow money to support his farm. He would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy farming necessities to improve his harvest size. Without this loan, he might have to go to loan sharks who put high interest rates on their loans.

loans.use: To buy farming necessities

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es socia del Banco Comunal Kallpanchik que significa Nuestra Fuerza en quechua.
Teodora es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Teodora vende verduras, tubérculos, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Teodora necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa y arveja.
Los sueños de Teodora son que sus hijos estudien y aumentar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de papa y arveja.

loans.name: Lily

texts.es:
Lily es una mujer emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha, región de Ucayali, tiene 36 años, es madre de tres hijos menores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado, actividad que lo realiza junto con su esposo, cuenta con un motocarro pues les sirve de transporte para vender por diferentes lugares del distrito. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Gotitas de Amor” desde hace ocho meses, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 500 soles, que le permitió invertir en la compra de pescado fresco y seco para vender.
Con este crédito de 1200 soles comprará otro motocarro para alquilarlo. La meta de Lily es construir su casa y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Lily is an enterprising woman who lives in the town of Yarinacocha, located in the Ucayali region. She is 36 years old and the mother of three young children. She and her husband sell fresh fish and depend on a motorized cart to transport their wares, which they sell in various locations around their district. She’s been working with the communal bank, “Gotitas de Amor” (Drops of Love) for the past eight months. Her first loan was for 500 PEN (~$175 US), which allowed her to invest in fresh and dried fish for resale. She will use this loan of 1,200 PEN ($425 US) to invest in another motorized cart which she will rent out. Lily’s goal is to build her home from where she can also run a small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a motorized cart to rent out

loans.name: Unisa

texts.en:
Unisa T. sells motor vehicle spare parts in Makeni city. He wants a loan of SLL 3,000,000 which will enable him to improve his business. With a loan, Unisa will be able to buy additional spare parts for his shop. This will eventually lead to more sales and improved profit, and he will be able to take better care of his family and dependents.

Unisa was born in Alkaliya village, which is about forty-two miles from Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone. He is 36 years old and married to a businesswoman. They have three children – two in secondary schools and one in primary school. Unisa has been a businessman since 1996.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Inés Bladimir

texts.es:
El caballero Inés C. se dedica a vender bisuterías como prensapelos, colas, aretes, pulceras, relojes, entre otros productos ubicándose en el mercado Ivan Montenegro donde atiende a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

La razón por la que ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar el crédito para la compra de las bisuterías y así continuar ofreciéndolas en sus canastos en el mercado para continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar de habitación.
texts.en:
This gentleman named Inés C. sells costume jewelry such as hairclips, hair ties, earrings, bracelets, watches, and other products at the Ivan Montenegro Market. He looks after his business daily and begins operation in the early morning hours.

He has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase more costume jewelry so that he can restock his baskets at the market and continue supporting his household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase costume jewelry

loans.name: Nely Janina

texts.es:
La señora Nely Janina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sagrado Corazón II”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 20 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Su espíritu luchador, que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de aretes, pulseras y collares, confeccionados por ella misma ya que habiendo estudiado cursos de Biyuteria, no dudo en ejercer ese conocimiento e iniciarse poco a poco en el negocio, fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en esta actividad. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, ubicado en su misma casa donde vende todo el día también sale  a ofrecer casa por casa los productos que vende  a sus amistades. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará materiales como: argollas, perlitas de diferentes modelos y colores, hilo nylon y ganchitos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra una vitrina, donde pueda exhibir sus productos, a sus clientes.
  
Nely Janina, se siente muy joven, tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ms. Nely Janina is a member of the Sagrado Corazon II Communal Bank in the Moyobamba district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 20-year-old woman with a live-in partner and one dependent child.

Her desire to get ahead on her own and her fighting spirit, for which she is noted, fueled her to launch her own jewelry business in which she makes and sells earrings, bracelets and necklaces. Because she took a jewelry making course, she naturally decided to put her skills into practice and start this business. Little by little, she became more well-known among her customers, and her business is now prosperous.

She currently runs this same business, which is located in her home. She sells her jewelry all day, and she also goes door-to-door.

With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase supplies like: rings, pearls in assorted colors and styles, nylon thread, and hooks. She will also invest some of the money in purchasing a glass display case so that she can exhibit her products.

Nely Janina feels very youthful, calm and content with her work. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the realization of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jewelry making supplies

loans.name: Lissassi

texts.fr: K. Lissassi est née en 1949 et vit à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 50 ans. C’est une veuve, et mère de cinq enfants. Lissassi vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs besoins. Lissassi n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Lissassi vend de l’akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs), accompagné de poissons fumés à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Lissassi s’approvisionne en maïs à Dantokpa, et en poissons au bord de la mer. Lissassi exerce cette activité depuis environs 10 ans et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Lissassi a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé. En vue de renforcer son fonds de roulement et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits, Lissassi sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Lissassi K. was born in 1949 and has lived for 50 years in the Flégnon area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a widow, and mother of five. She lives alone with her children, and is their sole provider. Lissassi has never been to school. To meet the needs of her children and herself, Lissassi sells akassa (local foodstuff made with corn starch) along with smoked fish, in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. She buys her corn supplies in Dantokpa, and her fish at the seaside. Lissassi has been performing this activity for the past ten years and is now requestiing a loan from ALIDé. The two previous loans obtained from ALIDé have been fully reimbursed. She is requesting a third loan to increase her working capital and also her stock of supplies.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn and fish

loans.name: José Paulino

texts.es: José Paulino S. P. de 56 años de edad, reside en Mejicanos y vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos. El posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos alimenticios y de primera necesidad. Así mismo su esposa elabora tamales los cuales José se encarga de vender de manera ambulante. Debido a que cuenta con 10 años de poseer este negocio es muy conocido en la zona, incluso es muy solicitado por los tamales que vende. José solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos para la tienda ya que a pesar que cuenta con varios años de poseerla, carece de muchos productos los cuales son básicos para lograr vender más y obtener mayor clientela. Es por ello que el deseo de José es lograr surtir la tienda y de esta manera percibir mayores ganancias las cuales beneficien a su familia.
texts.en:
José Paulino S. P., 56, lives in Mejicanos with his wife and two sons. He has a grocery store where he sells food and basic needs items. In addition, his wife makes tamales that José goes out to peddle. He is very well-known in the area because he has had his store for over 10 years; he is also very sought-after for the tamales that he sells. José is requesting funding with which to buy stock items for his store because, even though he has had the store for many years, he still lacks many basic products that, if he stocked them, his sales would improve and his clientele would increase. José's wish, therefore, is to have a well-stocked store so that his earnings will increase thus benefitting his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishables.

loans.name: Carmelita's Group

texts.en: Carmelita B. is from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Carmelita is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Carmelita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2006, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Carmelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Olimpia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Olimpia del Carmen B. F., tiene 69 años de edad es soltera y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, todos le apoyan económicamente, ella se dedica al alquiler de una propiedad desde hace 30 años y dentro de los principales problemas que se le han presentado es la falta de capital para la reparación del techo de la vivienda, ella inicio con el alquiler de esta propiedad, gracias a l apoyo de su hijo mayor.

Ella solicita de este préstamo para la compra de láminas de zinc que den un inicio a las remodelaciones de su negocio, esto le aumentara la plusvalía de la casa alquilándola a un mejor precio y brindándole la oportunidad de mejorar sus niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Olimpia del Carmen B. F. is 69 years old. She is single and has three adult children who support her economically. She has been dedicated to renting property for thirty years and among the main problems that she has faced is the lack of capital to repair the roof of her house. She began renting this property, thanks to the support of her eldest son. She is requesting this loan to buy zinc sheets that will start the remodeling of her business. This will expand the value of the house allowing her to rent it for a better price and providing the opportunity to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc sheets.

loans.name: Ines Aurora

texts.es: La Sra Inés Aurora M. D. C. D. 56 años D. edad, es viuda tiene 1 hijo menor que depenD. D. ella. Tiene casa propia D. material noble. Trabaja como obrera D. campo en una empresa agroindustrial desD. hace 2 años. Adicionalmente percibe otro ingreso como pensionista en la ONP por Viudez. Gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo esta sacando adelante a su hijo, esta logrando adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para mejoramiento D. vivienda ya que fue afectada por el terremoto del 2007. Su sueño es terminar D. construir su vivienda para lograr una mejor calidad D. vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través D. este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Inés Aurora M. D. C. is 56 years old. She is a widow with one child who is still dependent on her. She has her own house, which is constructed from solid materials. For the past two years, she has worked as a rural laborer for an agroindustrial company. She also has income from a pension she receives from the ONP (government pension office) as a widow. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she is helping her son make progress and get what he needs. She is requesting this loan to improve her home, since it was affected by the 2007 earthquake. Her dream is to complete the construction of her home in order to achieve a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support that we are able to proviD. to her through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her home

loans.name: Azran's Group

texts.en:
Azran is 22 years old and extremely vigorous in her work. She wakes up in the early hours and finishes her domestic chores, then she goes to attend to her grocery store that she has been managing for the last five years. 

She has given birth to two children: one son and one daughter, both of whom are students. The circumstances have made her mature at an early age. She understands her responsibilities and started performing them accordingly. Her husband completed his education through 8th standard and then started helping his father in his wheat grinding business. Then he later adapted this work as his own profession. Their incomes help meet the expenses. 

Her grocery store is located in a competitive environment and she needs to increase the products to manage the customer base and to improve sales. For this reason she has requested a loan of Pak Rs. 15,000.

She has five other ladies in her loan group. Muniran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Imtiaz baji, Haleema baji, Noor bhari baji and ZIkran baji each want a loan to buy fertilizer to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 37-year-old married lady who is blessed with three children. She sells milk and also runs a grocery shop. She has been in this business for 10 years and she has become more focused after training by Faulu Kenya Ltd., a Kiva partner.  

She hopes to be a major supplier of milk and vegetables in her area. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milking to increase her output.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en:
Maylinda M. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Maylinda is the mother of five school-aged children. To make a living, Maylinda manufactures and sells wood products like firewood to local businesses and community members. Maylinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 20,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Maylinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Maylinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to gain additional capital for her business. Maylinda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Maylinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional wood products

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 25 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 5 años se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad en su bodega, que se encuentra ubicada en un pequeño espacio dentro de su domicilio. Desde entonces atiende con mucha dedicación a sus clientes, ya que de ellos depende para que su negocio progrese, además sus fieles compradores se encuentran muy satisfechos con la compra que realizan. Es así que este negocio le permite tener las rentas necesarias para sostener a su familia, por lo que esta  pensando adquirir mayor cantidad de productos, con el fin de tener una tienda surtida con variados productos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por tanto será muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería en productos básicos, como: arroz, azúcar, aceite entre otros.
texts.en:
Nelly, 25, is a single mother of two children; she lives in her parents’ house. For over five years she has sold basic grocery items from a store located in a small space in her home. Since then she has tended to her customers with much dedication because she depends on them for her success; besides her regular customers are very satisfied with the purchases they make. This is how her store makes it possible for her to earn profits sufficient to support her family. She is therefore thinking about acquiring a larger quantity of products in order to have a store stocked with a better selection of assorted products This is her 4th loan with MFP so she will be very responsible with her payments. Besides she considers this capital influx to be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy basic stock items, such as: rice, sugar and cooking oil among others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic stock items like: sugar, rice, cooking oil.

loans.name: Gan-Ochir

texts.en:
Gan-Ochir B., 45, operates a truck-driving business. He lives with his wife and son in a ger (the traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent) in Hovd province, Mongolia. They have been living together for twenty-two years.

Gan-Ochir has been operating his business since 2000 and has built a loyal customer base. He has gained much experience in his business over the past ten years. To make money, he transports coal from the coal mine, and his wife sells it to individuals and organizations.

Gan-Ochir has been planning to purchase a larger truck in the future. With his business profits he provides for his family expenses. He is an industrious person and has been working hard to provide a better life for his family.

Gan-Ochir is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase coal and fuel to export coal to China.

loans.use: To purchase coal and fuel to sell

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia A. is from the village of R.J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 40 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Rogelia owns & operates a general store. Another source of income for the business is the salary of her husband. Rogelia has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rogelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rogelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rogelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more products to sell.

location.town: Sindangan-R.J. Macias, Sindangan, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Kirui

texts.en:
Kirui is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He is 30 years old and married with 2 children, ages 2 and 4 years. Neither of the children is attending school.

Kirui has been farming for 6 years and has one permanent employee. His main product is milk which he sells on the local market. He is also a cash crop farmer and sells his tea on the local market. His biggest challenge is lack of enough water since they don't have piped water.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.30,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will assist him to cater for the family's basic needs.

He would like to have at least 3 quality dairy cows and a dairy unit in the next 5 years.

He is grateful to Juhudi for giving him a loan.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nouriatou

texts.fr: Nouriatou est une femme mariée et  mère de 2 enfants, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons et de bois de chauffage. Son stock actuel de marchandises est en baisse, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 30 sacs de charbons de bois et de  10 tas de bois de chauffage. Elle exerce son commerce à la devanture de sa maison.
texts.en:
Nouriatou, a married woman and a mother of two, is active in the coal and firewood trade as an income-generating activity. Since her current merchandise inventory is diminishing, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 30 bags of charcoal and 10 piles of firewood. She carries her trade in the front part of her house.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coal and firewood

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 34 years old and married with a 2-year-old child.  Betty is commonly known for selling new shoes and this is her second year in this business.  The hours of her business are from 7 am to 7 pm every day.

Betty wishes to expand her business by adding new shoes including shoes for women as well as children.  To end this, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With the use of this loan to expand her business, Betty will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will be used for better financial stability of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanesa, trabaja como empleada en un hotel, estudia contabilidad, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres en la Ciudad de El Alto. Trabaja como empleada en el Hotel Sucre de la ciudad de La Paz. El préstamo será usado para el pago de la mensualidad en el Instituto de Contabilidad donde estudia contabilidad y actualmente cursa el segundo año de estudios. Es cliente nuestra desde el año 2008.

Es el Cuarto crédito con IMPRO y el segundo via Kiva.
texts.en:
Vanesa is employed in a hotel. She also studies Accounting. She’s single and lives with her parents in the city of El Alto. She works at Sucre Hotel in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to pay for monthly tuition costs at the Accounting Institute where she is studying Accounting; she’s in her second year of studies. She has been a client of ours since 2008. This is her 4th loan with IMPRO and second via Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay monthly tuition costs to continue Accounting classes.

loans.name: Chhourn

texts.en: Chhourn S., 27, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia -- an area known for quality palm products. S. is a housewife while her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of USD 25 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to buy a new car for her husband's business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a new car

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Miriam Elena

texts.en:
Miriam is a 45-year-old single mother of four who lives with three of her children in Heredia, in the central valley of Costa Rica. Miriam has opened a bazaar inside her house, where her clients can come by to peruse the various products she has for sale. Through her sales, Miriam hopes to complement the pension she receives from the government to offset the impact of diabetes. To date, Miriam has lost two toes from her left foot and a benign tumor has formed in her stomach (it is currently being determined whether an operation is necessary) due to her illness.

Miriam opened her bazaar three months ago with the financial support of her eldest son. As you can see in the picture, Miriam sells all types of items, such as candles, ceramics (hand painted by Miriam) and lights. She plans to use this loan to purchase inventory items to sell at her bazaar such as cleaning products, as well as painting supplies for her ceramics. Miriam enjoys painting ceramics and hopes to invest in this activity in order to offer her clients inspiring decorations for their homes. The main use of this loan will be to fill her bazaar with items for sale.

Miriam wakes up at 5 am every day, prepares breakfast for her children, carries out domestic jobs, and sends her children to school. Her daughter assists with these tasks and goes to night classes. One of her sons works all day and returns at night.

Miriam's goal is to increase sales revenues in an effort to improve the family's standard of living. Since opening her business, she has been able to earn $200 per month in profit, to complement the $200 she receives from the government. The cost of rent and public services eats up $200 per month, so Miriam is hoping to increase her revenues from the bazaar. Miriam has received training from the National Institute of Apprenticeship in accounting and administration, with the goal of supporting the success of her business.

The main obstacle in her life and her business is her diabetic condition. Her physical mobility has been compromised, making it difficult to travel even short distances, and the presence of a tumour has created both physical and psychological stress. She says that the support of her children, both young and old, and the love she feels inspires her and gives her strength to persevere and provide for her family.

loans.use: For the purchase of cleaning products and ceramic painting supplies

loans.name: Arianna Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. B. es una persona muy luchista para salir adelante ella y su hijo, estuvo casada pero no tuvo éxito su relación, y ahora tiene que trabajar doblemente para darle lo mejor a su hijo. Ella labora en una estetica, es estilista entra a las ocho de la mañana y sale a comer para recoger a su hijo de la escuela, ella tenia que tener un ingreso extra es por eso tuvo la iniciativa de vender perfumes por encargo desde hace un año sale a las 7:00 de la tarde es entonces cuando empieza a trabajar su negocio le esta funcionando bien y el dinero lo requiere para inyectarle al negocio. A ella le dan oportunidad de trabajar con su hijo, para no descuidarlo y siempre anda con el tambien en su negocio. Solo quiere ofrecerle lo mejor sin descuidar su atención.
texts.en: Mrs. B. is a very hard working person with a dream to improvement for herself and her son. She was married but the relationship didn't work out so now she needs to work twice as hard to provide the best for her son. She is an esthetician and a stylist. She starts work at 8 in the morning and she picks up her son at the lunch break. She needed to have an extra income so she started a new initiative to start taking orders for perfumes. She has had this business for the past year. When she finishes her other work at 7pm she starts this one and it has provided her with a good source of income. She reinvests some of her profits back into the business. She is permitted to keep her son with her when she works. He is always with her even when she’s running her business. She only wants to give him the best and ensure he never wants for anything.

loans.use: To invest in the business.

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.es:
La Señora Ana M. vive es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en la comunidad de Sagueo a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad se halla localizado en las suaves estribaciones y declives que en contraste a los encuentros de los diferentes ramales conforman gargantas y cañadas muy apretadas con fuertes inclinaciones y diferencias de nivel muy pronunciadas, siendo una ciudad muy hermosa y bella por su gente y su cultura.

La Señora Ana tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad y un bebe de apenas de 2 meses, su primer hijo estudia en una escuela de la ciudad.  Su esposo es de profesión mecánico. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Ana se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería, actividad que la viene realizando hace un año, labora de lunes a sábado sin un horario fijo.

Es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, fue invitada por su hermana a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres que con su trabajo luchan día a día para mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más billetes de lotería.

Su meta es  llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana M. is a member of the community bank named "Working Women". She lives in the community of Saguo located 10 minutes from the city of Azogues. The city is located among the soft hills and valleys in an otherwise mountainous geography with pronounced cliffs and canyons. The city is a very beautiful city especially for its people and its culture. 

Ana is 28 years old, she is married and she has 3 children aged, 7, 3 and a 2 month-old baby. Her eldest son attends school in the city. Her husband is a mechanic by trade. They do not have a house of their own so they rent where they live.

Ana sells lottery tickets, a business she has had for the past year. She works from Monday to Saturday and she doesn't have a fixed schedule. 

This is the second loan she accesses through her community bank. She was invited to join the group by her sister, wanting her to be part of this group of women who work day after day to improve their household finances. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of lottery tickets. 

Her goal is to have a house of her own. 
.

loans.use: To purchase lottery tickets.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria D. P. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Malatas, Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  She runs a general store and  a videoke sing-along business and buys and sells livestock. Her husband, Tito D. P., who is 58 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have six children who are 3 to 29 years old. 

Gleceria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gleceria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19500, which she intends to use to buy stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for future improvements of the business. 

Gleceria D. P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Juan Arturo

texts.es:
Juan de 30 años, tiene una panadería en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su esposa (esta en la foto) y sus dos hijos en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  
 
Para darles una mejor vida a sus dos hijos de 3 y 1 año comenzó a comprar levadura, harina, lácteos y empezar a hacer panes con ayuda de su esposa. Poco a poco y con la motivación de sus hijos y esposa ya tiene años con su panadería. Cada pan lo vende a $ 0.10. También tiene dulces que prepara con ayuda de su esposa llamados enroladitos, rosquitas.

Para seguir con su negocio él quiere comprar harina, bebidas, lácteos. En el futuro quiere implementar más dulces para darle una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan, 30, has a bakery in the front part of his house. He lives with his wife (seen in the photo) and their two children in an urbanized area in the el Fortín section of Guayaquil characterized by its dirt roads. 

In order to provide a better life to their two children who are three and one years of age, he began buying yeast, flour and dairy products and started making bread and pastries with the help of his wife. Little by little and inspired by his children and wife he has stayed in business now for years. He sells every roll and pastry for $0.10. He also sells highly sweetened pastries that he prepares with his wife's help called "enroladitos" and "rosquitas" [roll-ups and wheel-shaped]. 

To maintain his business he wants to purchase flour, drinks and dairy products. In the future he wants to incorporate more sweet pastries into his product line in order to give good variety to his customers.

loans.use: To purchase flour, yeast, drinks

loans.name: Jemalyn

texts.en:
Jemalyn R. is from the village of Barinaut, near Iligan City. She is 20 years old and married. To make a living, Jemalyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, detergents & junk food in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jemalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like junk food. This will be Jemalyn’s 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.	

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like junk food

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia M. is 44 years old and married. She supports her family by operating a livestock business. She lives in Purok 3, Brgy. Datag, Siaton, Negors Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her livestock business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Cynthia is now borrowing PHP 13,000. This will be her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Cynthia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her livestock business

loans.name: Zahidahan's Group

texts.en:
Zahidahan U., 37, is the leader of this group.  She is married and brings up a daughter and two sons. Her husband earns money by repairing household appliances and the children are at school. Zahidahan herself is engaged in farming. She started this activity in 1996, when the collective farms broke up. The family was given a piece of land for farming. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase mineral fertilizers and to hire labor for plowing the land. In the future, she wants to provide a good education for her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
If life is tough, one who wants to win ought to be tougher. Imelda A., 41, thinks so as she strives to give her best in making her business go beyond limits, even without a college background. Imelda is married to Rodelito, a welder, and they live with their children in Baseco, Manila. Two of their children study in high school, while another one is in elementary.

Imelda runs her own sari-sari (variety) store at home. Being twenty years in business, she knows what her community needs and wants to see in her store. With the training she receives from CCT*, she adeptly uses the money on hand to buy the essential merchandise and meet the needs of her customers. Each month she earns an average income of $277. 

To further help her with her business, Imelda decided to borrow 26,000 PHP. With this money she plans to buy food items that she knows her neighbors need daily, such as instant food sold in pouches, soap bars, and powdered milk. She also intends to buy Johnson&Johnson products like talc powder. 

Being tough in meeting life's challenges head on calls for an attitude that focuses on the solution rather than on the problem. Imelda practices this, and admits that no challenge can pull her spirit down. She desires to see her business boom and to maintain the good health of her family. More than anything else, she prays to see her children demonstrating the same kind of toughness she has when it comes to their studies, and finish schooling with flying colors.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Idalina

texts.es:
La Sra. Idalina es casada, tiene 5 hijos (2 varones y 3 mujeres), todos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la confección desde el año 1978, anteriormente retiraba los trabajos de terceros pero gracias a los buenos trabajos que realiza decidió independizarse y así conseguir la mayor clientela.
Hoy día ella confecciona prendas de vestir como por ejemplo: camisas para damas y caballeros, pantalón de vestir y ropas de colegios.
En el negocio sus hijas la ayudan, cuenta que le va muy bien. Su objetivo es crecer como micro-empresaria y dejarles la experiencia a sus hijas para que puedan continuar dicha actividad. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de telas.
texts.en:
Mrs Idalina is married and the mother of five grown-up children (two sons and three daughters). She has been active in tailoring since 1978. In the beginning she worked for third parties, but thanks to her good work she decided to become an independent seamstress and thus get more customers.

Currently, she manufactures clothing such as shirts for men and women, trousers and school uniforms. Her daughters help her in her business and they are all doing very well. Idalina's goal is to grow as a small business owner and transmit her experience to her daughters, so that they can continue her activity. She applies for this loan to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Las Preferidas Group

texts.es: El grupo esta compuesto por 8 personas  de las cuales la mesa directiva se encuentra compuesto de la siguiente manera: la presidenta es la Sra. Juana vive en casa propia  en la localidad de mayu molino zona de Chiñata , vive junto con los hijos  y su esposo, la mencionada señora es  buena líder y se dedica a la venta de papa en la cancha de papas de sacaba  como su principal actividad, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería papa por carga; la secretaria es la señora Rocío vive en casa familiar  de la  zona,  se dedica a la venta de salchipapas en el mismo domicilio, con el dinero del crédito comprara papa para la elaboración de sus salchipapas. Dicho grupo se conocen muy bien por que un 70% del grupo son cercanos por sus puestos de venta en la cancha de papas de Sacaba, es por eso que son muy unidas se ven casi diariamente ya que siempre están en comunicación; el único varón del grupo es portero en la escuela que esta a lado de su casa, el Sr no se encuentra en la foto, El grupo solicita  el crédito para la invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group is composed of 8 people whose governing board is composed thus:  the President, Juana, lives in her own house located in Mayu Molino, Chiñata, with her children and husband.  She is a good leader.  Her main activity is selling potatoes at the Sacaba Potato Cancha (open air market).  She will use the money from the loan to buy potatoes by the load.

The Secretary is Rocío.  She lives in the family home in the zone and sells Salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausage) at home.  With the money from the loan she will buy potatoes to make her salchipapas.

The group members know each other very well because 70% of them have neighboring sales stands at the Sacaba potato market.  Because of this they are very united; they see each other almost daily so are always in communication.  The only male in the group is a doorman at the school next door to his house; he is not in the photo.  The group is asking for the loan to invest in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy potatoes by the load.

loans.name: Natividad De Las Mercedes

texts.es: Natividad D. Las Mercedes B. D. L. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Arce en el departamento D. La Libertad. Natividad es viuda, por lo que ha tenido que trabajar muy duro por salir adelante junto a su hijo el cual ahora es mayor D. edad y se dedica a trabajar. Natividad  posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual es D. mucha ayuda para su hogar y la mayoría D. gastos D. la casa. Natividad solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con la capacidad D. poder comprar granos básicos, verduras, pan, golosinas y otros productos más los cuales son muy solicitados en el negocio. Ella alberga la esperanza que gracias a este préstamo  pueda mejorar sus ganancias y D. esta manera poder contar con una vida mejor en la cual estén suplidas D. todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Natividad D. Las Mercedes B. D. L., age 60, lives in Ciudad Arce in the La Libertad department.  Natividad is a widow, and she has had to work very hard to get ahead together with her son.  He is now an adult, and he works.

Natividad has a store where she sells perishable products.  The store is a big help for her household and most of the household expenses.

Natividad is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy basic grains, vegetables, bread, sweets, and other products that are requested a lot in the business.    

She harbors the hope that, thanks to this loan, she will be able to improve her earnings.  That way she will be able to have a better life in which she has all of her necessities.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and basic grains to sell

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline M. is married with two children in school. Her husband is a businessman, and his salary helps provide for the family’s basic needs. Pauline has operated a poultry business for the past two years, selling chickens from home to her neighbors and local residents. She faces the challenge of dealing with outbreaks of diseases affecting poultry, which would result in losses for her.

Pauline decided to join Yehu because of its efficiency and variety of loan products. With a 20,000 KES loan she will purchase chicken feed. Pauline dreams of expanding her business and supplying poultry at wholesale prices to hotel operators in the future.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is currently in the business of selling bread. She is 35 years old, married, with eight children and all of them go to school. Halima borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to expand  and pay her children's school fees with extra profits  from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria Rosario es empleada del Ministerio de Economía y su esposo trabaja como carpintero; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de una impresora ya que el anterior crédito lo utilizo para la compra de una computadora. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en: María Rosario is employed by the Ministry of Economics and her husband works as a Carpenter.  She needs the loan to buy a printer since she used the previous loan to buy a computer.  She lives in her parents’ house located in La Paz’s Sopocachi zone.  She’s married and has two children.

loans.use: to buy a printer.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama K. is a married woman with five children. Four of the children attend school, while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Salama faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase five sacks of beans for her food stall business. 

She dreams of accessing loans to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of beans for her food stall business.

loans.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan is 36 years old and married with six children: four sons and two daughters. She couldn’t provide them with an education due to financial constraints. Her husband works in a government organization. His income is not enough to meet the financial expenses of the family. That’s why Hanifaan supports him by doing work in people's houses. She is a very hard working lady and performs her routine tasks very well along with her job. 
Her eldest son has a furniture showroom. He is expert in making wooden chairs. Her second son also helps him in his business. Her remaining children stay at home and don’t do anything. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who wants to expand his furniture making business. With the loan, he will buy wood, nails, furniture polish, etc. to prepare more furniture and earn a better income. Hanifaan is hopeful that by investing the loan into her son’s business, he will expand his business and increase his profits. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loans, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Hanifaan.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails and furniture polish

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma, the owner of a sari-sari store for more than two years, sells items such as eggs and vegetables to the people of her community. Requesting a loan  to help improve her business, she will use it to buy more items to sell such as spices, eggs and soy sauce. Emma hopes to have a bigger store and more items to sell in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as spices, eggs and soy sauce.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three school-age children. He has owned a garage in his town since 1990. He is an experienced mechanic whose job is to repair and maintain car engines. Over the years, he was able to extensively enlarge his business and build a good number of clients asking for his services. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new mechanical tools and supplies to reinforce his business operation and further develop his work. In the future, he is looking forward to diversifying his business and opening a new shop where he will start a car spare parts trade business.

loans.use: to purchase new mechanical tools and supplies

loans.name: Gameli

texts.fr: Responsable d’un magasin de mèches et de perruques, Gameli  est un jeune homme de 22ans. Ce prêt qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter de marchandises (mèches et perruques). Il a commencé en 2009 et s’approvisionne au NIGERIA et au GHANA.
texts.en: Manager of a hair extension and wig store, Gameli is a 22 year old young man.  This loan that he is requesting will enable him to buy merchandise (hair extensions and wigs).  He started in 2009 and buys supplies in Nigeria and Ghana.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and wigs

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Letty has a retail shop that sells canned goods, noodles, and breads. She has had this business for three years. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy breads, canned goods, and biscuits.

Letty is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Letty hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads, canned goods, and biscuits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy CDs and underwear.

loans.name: Esbon

texts.en:
Esbon is 67 years old, married to Hannah, and they have  five children.  

He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last twenty-six years. He  was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy two dairy cows.

In future, Esbon hopes to become a leading supplier of milk in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es:
Jose Alfonso tiene 42 años de edad  es casado vive con su esposa y con sus tres hijos de catorce, doce y diez años en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVA UNIONse encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café.

Jose Alfonso se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café, etc. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos e insumos, fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas,  para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño de aquí a cinco años es poderse comprar una casa para poderle dejar a su hijo.

Le gusta escuchar música, salir y compartir momentos amenos junto a su hijo y  amigos.
texts.en:
Jose Alfonso is 42 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children (ages 14, 12, and 11) in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar Province.

The Communal Bank “Nuevos Unidos” is located in the parish of San José del Tambo, which is part of the canton of Chillanes. The members of this Communal Bank are farmers who grow mainly corn, cacao, oranges, bananas, and coffee.

Jose Alfonso grows corn, cacao, oranges, bananas, coffee, and other crops. He buys his supplies and sells his products at the market in San José del Tambo each weekend.

Jose Alfonso is requesting a loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, and agricultural composts for his crops. This loan provides the support to meet his financial needs and improve his farming activities. The challenges he faces include the falling prices of the products he sells to people, such as middlemen. His dream five years from now is to buy a house so that he can leave it to his son.

Jose Alfonso enjoys listening to music and going out and sharing pleasant moments with his son and with friends.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, and compost for his crops.

loans.name: Magaly Lucia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Magaly, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un  bebe  de 1 año. El marido es ebanista.
 
Ella realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el mismo que tiene un taller de ebanistería en su casa, él realiza una gran variedad de productos con la madera como por ejemplo: camas, muebles, puertas, cajoneras, anaqueles entre otras muchas obras, trabajan a base de encargos de personas que llegan hasta su establecimiento. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 16h00 y cuando tiene mucho trabajo para entregar hasta más tarde.
 
Este crédito es para comprar madera, pinturas, selladores entre otros productos que se necesitan para fabricar sus productos. Para ella este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada porque con los créditos puede ayudar a su esposo y contribuir al hogar. 

Su sueño es tener casa propia ya que vive en casa de los suegros.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets in the La Sequita parish, which is part of Montecristi in the prosperous canton of Manabita.  It is full of hard-working people who are dedicated and proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish whose inhabitants are honest people who only know to work and dedicate themselves to their families.

In this area lives Señora Magaly.  She is 22 years old and in a common law marriage from which she has a one year old baby.  Her partner is a carpenter.

She is taking the loan to help her partner, who has a carpentry workshop in their home.  He makes a large variety of products from wood, such as - for example - beds, furniture, doors, drawers and shelves among many other things.  He works on the basis of orders from the people who come to their establishment.  He works everyday from 8 a.m. through to 4 p.m., and when there is a lot of work to deliver, he works late.

This loan is to buy wood, paints, and sealants, among other products that they needs for making their products.  This is her fourth lending cycle with the Communal Bank, and she is grateful because the loans can help her partner and contribute to the household.

Her dream is to have her own home, as she lives in her in-laws' house.

loans.use: to buy wood, paints, sealants, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas es un grupo antiguo que mantiene un excelente comportamiento dentro del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras. El objetivo D. cada D. una D. ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espíritu solidario y mantener la unidad del grupo.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Obdulia, ella se dedica a la venta D. comestibles, tiene muchos clientes pues los platillos que prepara son muy ricos. Comenta que su negocio le produce buenas ganancias y que gracias a esto ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Le gustaría poder seguir creciendo en el ramo y algún día poder tener un local granD. donD. ofrecer los alimentos que prepara. Ella demuestra toda la voluntad para seguir operando con su comité, alienta a sus compañeras a trabajar para el logro D. sus objetivos.
La señora Obdulia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. víveres como ser carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros para la elaboración D. los alimentos. está agradecida con la Fundación por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Unidas' committee is a long-standing group that maintains an excellent record within the 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' program.  The goal of each of the members is to work, encourage a supportive spirit and maintain the unity of the group.

One of the group's members is Obdulia, who sells food.  She has many customers because the dishes she prepares are delicious.  She tells us that her business makes her good profits and, thanks to this, she has managed to get her family ahead in life.  She would like to be able to continue growing in her field and some day she would like to own large premises where she can sell the food that she prepares.  She would very much like to continue working with her committee and she encourages her fellow group members to work to achieve their goals.

Obdulia is requesting this loan to buy food products such as meat, seasonings, vegetables, etc. to make her dishes.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasonings, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
Jamileth Johana tiene 23 años de edad, es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo de un año de edad, es coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Luz Divina y se dedica a la venta de joyeria de plata y oro. 

Sus comienzos en la venta de joyeria los inicio junto con una amiga, pero desde hace dos años Jamileth trabajo de forma independiente y ademas de eso trabaja como dependienta en la cafeteria de una escuela primaria. De lunes a viernes labora en la cafeteria y los fines de semana sale a vender joyeria especialmente de las oficinas de empresas y bancos. No siempre le va bien con las ventas pero no se desanima y sigue adelante porque su hijo es su inspiracion para superarse.

El prestamo que Jamileth solicita lo necesita para comprar variedad en cadenas, aritos, pulseras, anillos, entre otra joyeria de plata y oro. Con el apoyo del prestamo ella podra seguir teniendo una segunda entrada de dinero para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su meta es instalar una tienda de variedades para trabajar lo propio y asi obtener mas ganancias y con eso podra darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. 

Jamileth tiene cuatro ciclos de estar en FAMA y ha cumplido con el compromiso de sus pagos de forma puntual y espera que este ciclo no sea la excepcion.
texts.en:
Jamileth Johana is 23 years old, married with a small son who is 1 year old. She is the coordinator of the Grupo Solidario Luz Divina and sells silver and gold jewelry.

She started selling jewelry with a friend but for the last 2 years has worked alone. Jamileth also works as a cafeteria assistant in a primary school. From Monday to Friday she works in the cafeteria and at the weekends she sells her jewelry at banks and business offices in particular. She doesn't always do well with her sales but she doesn't get discouraged. She moves on with her son as her inspiration to excel.

Jamileth needs the loan requested to buy a variety of chains, earrings, bracelets, rings and other silver and gold jewelry. With the help of the loan she will be able to continue having a second income to help her husband with the household expenses. Her goal is to set up and work at her own variety store and thus make more profit to give her son a better quality of life.

Jamileth has 4 loan cycles with FAMA and has made her agreed repayments punctually. She hopes that this 5th cycle is no exception.

loans.use: to buy silver and gold.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 45-year-old single woman from Lebanon living on her own. She has been working as a beautician since 1996. She works on a freelance basis, receiving clients at her home. 

Today, she is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an IPL machine used for hair removal. 

In the future, she is planning to open a formal beauty salon in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an IPL machine used for hair removal.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 25-year-old fisherman living in Talibon, Bohol. He has been a fisherman for 2 years. He is asking for a loan to purchase gasoline, fishing nets and hooks. This will help Christopher continue earning from his business.

Christopher works hard to support his family of a wife and one child.
