Christopher hopes to be successful with his business. He also plans to save for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, fishing nets and hooks.

loans.name: Gutierrez

texts.es:
F. vive en la cuidad de Cochabamba, es casado tiene 3 hijos, trabaja en una marmoleria hace mas de 22 años, el sueldo que recibe es muy bajo, que apenas alcanza parar sustentar a su familia, su esposa genera para la familia otras ingresos por la venta de leche de 4 vacas que posee, esta leche la entrega y vente en el barrio.
F. tenia en mente poder construir una cocina para su casa hace años atras, pero no podia ahorrar y tampoco encontraba financiamiento para su construcción. Atraves de CIDRE y gracias a los recursos que canaliza KIVA, se le a podido otorgar ahora un prestamo para la contruccion de la cocina para su vivienda. el esta muy animado a contruirla con sus propias manos, y agradecido a la vez a KIVA por este apoyo financiero.
texts.en:
F. lives in the city of Cochabamba.  He’s married and has three children.  He’s worked at a marble quarry for over 22 years but the salary he earns is very low, it’s barely enough to support his family.  His wife earns additional family income selling milk from the four cows she owns; she sells the milk around the neighborhood.

F. has been planning to build a kitchen at home for many years now but has been unable to save up enough to do so and could not find financing for the construction.  Now, through CIDRE and thanks to resources that KIVA channels, he has been granted a loan to build the kitchen for his house.  He is very anxious to get started building it with his own hands and is grateful to KIVA for this financial support.

loans.use: to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 39 and has been in farming in her home area of Kitale for 6 years. Her farm produces maize and beans for the local market. She is married with one child aged 1. She runs a hotel business in the local market to supplement her farming income.

Caroline has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the proceeds from her business will be used to repay the loan and secure the future of her children by giving them a good education. Her focus is to have a farm with six hybrid grades of dairy cows. She adds that the dairy produce will also help improve her hotel business.

Caroline says poor infrastructure in the area is a major challenge in farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rickson

texts.en:
Rickson, 38, is a married man with eight children, seven of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past fourteen years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. In addition he also owns real estate houses, which provide another source of income. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan of KES 20,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a 29-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family, a husband and six children who are 10, 8, 5, 4, 3 and 2 years old. 

Shamim’s day are focused on managing the household work and helping her husband in his dairy business. She helps him by getting the milk from his buffaloes and taking care of them. 

Her husband’s economic mainstay is his dairy business. He sells his buffaloes' milk to different areas of the community and generates revenue from it. He has a good customer base. He sells 1kg of milk for approximately PKR 50, and he sells almost 8kg to 12kg milk every day. He has been in this business for over 10 years.  

Shamim is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to buy another buffalo to increase the milk productivity and sales. 

She is hopeful that her husband’s business will be expanded further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es:
Sandra, vive con su familia su esposo, se dedica a la venta de comida, la realiza todos los días desde su vivienda, este negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener una ocupación que le ayudara a proveer y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Ella está solicitado un préstamo para comprar mercadería para el negocio, carnes, aceite, condimentos, gaseosas, arroz esperando que la inversión le ayude para tener mayor capacidad de producción de alimentos para los clientes. su principal aspiración y sueño es que a través del negocio y con ayuda de su esposo poder comprarse su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Sandra lives with her husband's family. She works selling food. She works every day from her house. The business arose from the need to have a job to provide and help her husband with the household expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for business, meat, oil, condiments, soft drinks, rice, hoping the investment will help her have a greater capacity to produce food for customers. Her main aspiration and dream is that through the business and with the help of her husband she can buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy meat, oil. seasonings, soft drinks, rice.

loans.name: Rosalba De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Rosalba de Jesus ha sido una mujer luchadora que ha tenido que trabajar fuertemente con su esposo para sacar sus 6 hijos adelante. Víctima de la violencia, la señora Rosalba de Jesús es una desplazada mas que tuvo que abandonar su municipio para hospedarse en el municipio de Bello, al norte de la ciudad de Medellín. Desde allí ha podido sacar su familia adelante gracias a que con su esposo consiguieron un puesto de comidas en su barrio donde trabajan todos los días en largas jornadas. Con el ánimo de incrementar sus ventas y ofrecer productos diferentes a sus clientes, la señora Rosalba busca comprar un carro de comidas rápidas para añadirles la oferta a sus clientes.
texts.en: Rosalba de Jesús has been a tenacious woman who has had to work hard with her husband to raise their six children.  A victim of violence, Rosalba de Jesús is a displaced person; she had to abandon her town to reside in the town of Bello north of the city of Medellín.  From there she’s been able to move her family ahead thanks to the fact that she and her husband were able to secure a food stand in the neighborhood where they work long, daily work days.  With the aim of increasing sales and offering different items to their customers, Rosalba wants to buy a fast food cart to add to her customer offerings.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 50 years old, a business lady. She is married to Boniface who is employed. They are blessed with four children. She has been selling cereals for the past six years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD. after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Sarah will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a store for her grains.

loans.use: to buy dry maize and beans for her business.

loans.name: Maa Kalika Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Kalika SHG Self Help Group is composed of 14 women from a small village in Odisha, India. All the members of this group are involved in activities such as vegetable cultivation, milk selling, paddy and maize cultivation, etc. They are very hardworking women with a willingness to learn new business trends.They all help and support each other. Whatever they are earning from their businesses is used for their monthly household expenses. 

One of the group members, Sanjubala, is the president of this group. The lady standing with her hand raised is Sanjubala. Sanjubala is 38 years old and lives with her husband, parents-in-law and one child who is 10 years old. She does vegetable cultivation. She produces vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, cauliflower, brinjals, ladyfingers, onions, etc. and sells them at the market. Her husband is a farmer. Her husband helps Sanjubala in vegetable selling at the market. Sanjubala is planning to buy standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides so she can produce more vegetables and can increase her income. Sanjubala, along with her group members, is asking for a loan of 350,000 INR to invest in their business activities. Sanjubala will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation. She wants to give a better education to her child. She says, on behalf of the group members, "Thank you, Kiva, for providing this opportunity for us!"

loans.use: to purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Les Sœurs Unies Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LES SŒURS UNIES est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Ablawa Léa Claire (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 54 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire.  Ablawa Léa Claire est mariée a un certain Sylvain. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Ablawa Léa Claire vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Ablawa Léa Claire vend des tissus et des bijoux depuis dix huit ans à son domicile. Ablawa Léa Claire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Ablawa Léa Claire ensemble avec les membres du groupe LES SŒURS UNIES sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont étés bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des bijoux.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
FARZANA is a 38-years old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, along with her family. She is the mother of a kid; her husband is a cattle trader and does most of his trading from within his home area. He breeds cattle in his yard as well and sells the bull calves to the butchers. He has to feed the calf till one or two years until they have grown up and healthy, which is very lengthy and expensive procedure. 
Few days ago, two of his healthy buffaloes have suddenly died due to fetal disease; he has been producing milk and breeding from that buffaloes. Now his production of milk and breeding procedure have effected badly.
He wants to buy a buffalo to keep constant his income and business but he has already invested his all savings into miscellaneous expenses of dairy farm. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a buffalo to continue business smoothly. 
Our field partner met with FARZANA and let her know about all the terms & condition of Kiva and its field partner’s BRAC Pakistan. She is agreed upon ours repayment schedule and signed happily all the necessary documents, including client waiver. 
Eventually FARZANA applied a Kiva loan so she can help her husband in purchasing a healthy buffalo. With the profit amount he will buy fodder for cattle and cure against diseases.
FARZANA is very pleased after receiving this loan and thankful to the BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a healthy buffalo for her husband's cattle trading and for breeding.

loans.name: Korkor

texts.en: Korkor is 56 years and a mother of 7 children. She deals in bulk sales of spices mostly hot pepper in the Central Business District. She also engages in retailing her merchandise in other major markets outside her location. She intends to stock up for the current season which runs through June,2007. Presently, she is undergoing the TEACH sessions of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION. She is seeking the loan from KIVA to procure her supplies.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth is 45 years old and a father. He had only a basic education. He runs a general store in the Central Business District of the city. He deals in items like automatic rice cookers, deep freezers and other electrical appliances.

Having benefited from the 'TEACH' learning sessions of KRABAN, Seth anticipates turning round his business with the KIVA loan and increasing the size of his market substantially.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sem S. is a 51-year-old widow living in Kampong Cham, Cambodia with her 3 children.  One of her sons is a blacksmith, and the other 2 help her farm her land.  Currently, Sem S. can only earn about $1.50/day farming, and she would like this loan so that she can purchase more land.

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Nkem

texts.en: Nkem N. is 55 years old and is the mother of 8 children. She is from Okpanemu town in Delta State. She learnt the business of selling provisions and soft drinks from her mother. Nkem needs a loan of $625 to invest in her business.

loans.use: To invest in drinks and provisions for resale

loans.name: Mukkaram

texts.ru:
Mukkaram, 31, is married and raising 2 children. For a few years, she has been selling fabrics. Mukkaram started with cheaper fabrics and then gradually added more expensive ones to her assortment. Now, she rents a sales spot at the central market of Isfara. Mukkaram buys her products at a wholesale market in Karosu, Kirgizstan. Her business demands significant investment of money. In addition to her personal resources, Mukkaram has been relying on MicroInvest loans for a year and a half. Now, she plans to receive a new loan to finance purchase of the Fall fabrics collection.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муккарам 31 год, она замужем и воспитывает 2 детей. Муккарам уже несколько лет занимается продажей тканей. Она начинала свой бизнес с продажи простых тканей и постепенно перешла на продажу более дорогих тканей. Сейчас она арендует торговое место на центральном рынке города Исфара. За товаром она ездит на оптовый рынок города Каросуу, Кыргызстан. Ее бизнес требует больших денежных вложений. Кроме своих собственых денег Мукаррам получает займы в Микроинвест, с которым сотрудничает уже 1,5 года. Сейчас она планирует получить новый займ для закупки осеннего ассортимента тканей.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Luzgarda

texts.es:
Luzgarda 28 years old and her dear mother Flora, decided to rent and set up a small craft store where they sell clay and gypsum objects. The strategic location of their charming store is very attractive to turists. Luzgarda and her mother's dream is to expand and further increase the selection of their merchandise, with the goal of bringing a better and more complete services to their clientele. To make their dream a reality they look to you for your support in applying for a loan that will be invested in the expansion and increase in their stock of valuable items, and in this manner slowly improve their family's economic status and above all support her two younger brothers in their professional training. Let's help this family so that they may continue to foster the strong will of excellence in their hearts.

Luzgarda de 28 años de edad y su querida madre Flora, decidieron alquilar un local y abrir una pequeña tiendita de artesanías en el que ofrecen variedad de productos en arcilla y yeso, por el lugar estratégico en que está ubicado su acogedora tiendita es muy concurrida y visitada por los turistas.El deseo de Luzgarda y su madre es ampliar y aumentar aún más la variedad de su mercadería, con el afán de brindar un mejor y completo servicio a sus visitantes; para concretar sus deseos en esta oportunidad recurre a tu apoyo desinteresado y solicita un préstamo que invertirá en ampliar y aumentar el stock de su valiosa mercadería y así poco a poco buscar mejorar su situación económica familiar y sobre todo apoyar a sus dos hermanos menores en su formación profesional.Ayudemos a esta familia a que sigan atesorando en sus corazones muchas ganas de superación.

Translated from Spansih by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Increase in capital to increase their valuable pieces for sale in their small souvenir shop.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Client Details: Margarita promotes perfumes and cosmetics and sells her products through magazines. She works with various perfume lines from AVON, ZERMA, and YAMBAL. Her clients pay her in monthly installments from two to six months. She lives in the area of Irpavi II, which is in the city of La Paz. She does not have a fixed store since her sales are executed through orders.

This is the fifth time she seeks a loan from IMPRO and the second one through Kiva. The previous loan through Kiva has been completely paid off. Her credit history qualifies her as a number 1 client because she has honored her financial obligations. The new loan she requests will be used to buy merchandise (perfumes, cosmetics, talcs, etc.). Her job and credit history with IMPRO approves her for this loan. Her experience in her business will provide the means to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator

Historia del Cliente: La señora Margarita es promotora de perfumes y cosméticos ofrece sus productos mediante revistas, trabaja con las líneas de de perfumes de AVON, ZERMAT, y YAMBAL. Y sus clientes le cancelan en de dos a seis pagos mensuales. Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, no cuenta con un puesto fijo ya que las ventas que realiza son a pedido.

Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y la segunda vez que solicita ayuda de Kiva por que solicitan un nuevo crédito. El crédito anterior con Kiva ha sido cancelado en su totalidad. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (perfumes, cosméticos, talcos, etc.) Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell to her customers

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana M. is married with one daughter named Liza. She lives in Kherson and owns a small vending kiosk in the local Dneprovskyi market. Svetlana sells children’s denim clothes, jackets and slippers. Her kiosk is well known in the market for having a nice variety of assorted children’s clothing at affordable prices. Svetlana has been in this trade for about 12 years. Her business has seen a 300% profit increase since she started her small venture. Her turnover capital has doubled in that time as well.

Svetlana has a unique ability to analyze a merchandise market and find her niche. This is something that helped her start her business and open 5 vending facilities in Kherson. Svetlana has received and repaid 10 loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. Today she is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase the assortment of her inventory and her sales and profits as a result.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is a happy lady who learned to be independent thanks to the income she perceived for each of the activities she has worked in. In contemplating a good investment for her savings, she decided to accommodate a small store in her house to sell groceries and sodas. The profits of this store help satisfy her personal needs and those of her beloved children. Her partner, because of his work, can only live with her family monthly. Beatriz has learned how to understand and handle this situation, however, the family needs are growing, and she wants to satisfy them. This is why she sees in you an important possibility of support. Her objective is to increase the quality of service by offering a larger variety of products in her small selling space.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz, es una alegre dama que aprendió a ser independiente gracias a los ingresos que percibía por cada una de las catividades que desempeñaba. Contemplando una buena inversión de sus ahorros decidió instalar en su casa una pequeña tiendita de venta de abarrotes y bebidas que le ayuda a satisfacer sus necesidades personales y la de sus queridos hijos.Su pareja por razones laborales solo puede convivir con su familia mensualmente situación que Beatriz a sabido comprender y manejar, sin embargo las necesidades insatisfechas van en aumento y desea satisfacerlas y para ello ha visto en usted una importante posibilidad de apoyo con el objetivo de incrementar la calidad de su servicio ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos en su pequeño espacio.

loans.use: To increase the capital needed to acquire a larger quantity of first need articles with the purpose of bettering her services promptly.

loans.name: Mon Destin Group

texts.en:
Mon Destin, or My Destiny, was created by 4 people, 3 men and 1 woman. Their names are Akama K., Segbenya E., Gomado K., and Setsoafia K., and they are aged 40, 37, 33, and 29, respectively. The first has 5 children, the second has 3, and the last 2 members of the group each have 2 children. They have operated a general store for the past 4 years and have significantly increased their operations in 2007. Their store is located in Avetonou, a small village located about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. They hope to use this loan to buy 20 bags of rice, 25 bags of powdered sugar, 10 cartons of sugar cubes, 15 cartons of milk, 10 cartons of soap, and 25 cartons of canned goods to respond to the needs of their customers. These purchases will allow them to reap the benefits of their growth and to better the lives of their families. This group has already successfully received 2 loans and paid them back promptly.

L’établissement mon destin est créé par un groupe de quatre personnes dont trois hommes et une femme qui sont Akama K., Segbenya E., Gomado K. et Setsoafia K.. Tous ils sont âgés de 40 ans, 37 ans, 33 ans et 29 ans respectivement. Le premier a 5 enfants, le second 3 et les deux derniers 2 enfants chacun. Ils opèrent dans le secteur d’alimentation générale depuis plus de 4 ans et ont considérablement augmenter leur chiffres d’affaires au cours de l’année 2007. Leur commerce est situé au grand marché de Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Ils souhaitent avec les fonds dont ils bénéficieront augmenter la capacité de leur boutique en achetant 20 sacs de riz, 25 sacs de sucres en poudre, 10 cartons de sucre en morceau, 15 cartons de laits, 20 cartons de savons et 25 cartons de boîtes de conserves afin de répondre aux besoins de leur clientèle. Ceci leur permettra de dégager beaucoup plus de bénéfices et améliorer les conditions de vie de leur famille respective. Ce groupe a déjà bénéficier de 2 crédits et sont bien remboursés.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of rice, 25 bags of powdered sugar, 10 cartons of sugar cubes, 15 cartons of milk, 10 cartons of soap, and 25 cartons of canned goods

loans.name: Sara's Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Sara is 50 years old and is married with 5 children, ages 7 to 18 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other children. Sara owns a small animal stock, a business she started in 1998. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more animals to increase her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Elizabeth, Zabira, Pudensia, and Monica, who have businesses dealing in fruits sales.

loans.use: To buy more animals to increase her stock.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice O. is 35 years old and married with two children. She hails from Oka in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She trades in clothes and has been in the business since 1998. This is a business that she started on her own.

Eunice has been a LAPO client for the past seven years. She needs a loan of $775 to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea H., 56, and her husband, Mr. Sriv Leng, 59, who live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1970 and have nine children, four sons and five daughters. Six of their children live with them, three of whom are garment factory workers and the other three are in school. Three children are married and live outside the family home.

Chea and her husband have been raising pigs and growing vegetables since they were married. Besides the farming business, Mr. Leng has been a mason for over ten years. Now Chea is requesting a loan of US$250 to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.use: Chea and her husband would like to purchase piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mabontu Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim B. is happy with the SMT program and especially with Kiva. With his previous loans, Ibrahim's capital increased and now he is able to purchase most of his stock from the Republic of Guinea, where he can buy goods for cheaper and make a better profit. The 35-year-old sells cosmetics and has been doing business for five years; he has said that his business has expanded as a result of the loans from SMT.

Ibrahim is the leader of "Mabontu," a group of entrepreneurs working together for more than two years. Also in the group are: Mabinty T., who owns a small kiosk, and Tugiatu K., who sells utensils and dishes in Magburaka town, Sierre Leone. Together they are applying for a group loan to expand their individual businesses.

loans.use: To purchase stock of cosmetics and dishes.

loans.name: Dau Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dau Thi H., 48 years old, joined TYM in 2001. Before joining, her family had met a lot of difficulties paying for food and her children education as their only source of income was farming. When TYM came to her village, her family decided to participate. With the first loan of 2 million VND, she bought breeding pigs. Realize how profitable this business can be with the right method and right amount of effort, she keep borrowing more in the coming loan cycle and has achieved immense success. Currently, she is also breeding chickens and ducks alongside her pigs. 3 of her children have found a stable job, earning 3.5 million VND per month while the other 2 are still in school. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 12 million VND to keep investing in her breeding business. Her monthly income is 5 million VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đậu Thị Hoàng 48 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2001. Trước khi trưa tham gia Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn, vất vả, số con đông nguồn thu nhập của gia đình chủ yếu là làm ruộng. Khi Quỹ triển khai trên địa bàn, chị đã bàn bạc cùng với chồng tham gia để vay vốn phát triển kinh tế. Vòng vốn đầu gia đình chị xin vay 2.000.000đ mua lợn giống sau một vòng vốn vay cũng là lúc gia đình chị xuất được 2 lứa lợn. Nhận thấy việc đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi là phù hợp với điều kiện gia đình, nên các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đều vay vốn ở mức cao đầu tư vào chăn nuôi với mô hình lớn hơn. Hiện nay ngoài việc chăn nuôi lợn gia đình chị còn đầu tư vào chăn gà thịt. Thực tế gia đình chị đang nuôi 7 con lợn thịt và 200 con gà thịt. 3 con chị hiện đã lớn và đã đi làm cho thu nhập đều đặn 3.500.000đ/ tháng, 2 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 12.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Bunthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunthorn C. and her husband, Mr. Vin Phun, who live along national Road 1 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1992 and have three children; one son and two daughters. One of their children is a garment factory worker and the other two children study in a local school.

Mrs. Bunthorn has been growing vegetables for three years. She grows them in her village to sell to an NGO. Her husband does fishing and construction work. Fishing season is coming soon so Bunthorn needs one boat and some other fishing materials for her husband's business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase one boat, fishing nets, and some for purchasing seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for growing vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase one boat and fishing nets, and for growing vegetables

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira K. is a 34-year-old woman, the mother of one child. She is married and her husband is employed. His salary is low and they have to work at home, doing a lot of things to earn more. They are busy with poultry as a seasonal job. Beside that, Samira has a sewing machine and she does tailoring.

Unfortunately, Samira's sewing machine is broken and she has to fix it. She has no money to do that, so she has requested a loan through WWI in the amount of 600 KM. She hopes to earn enough to help support her family.

loans.use: To repair her sewing machine

loans.name: Osasogie

texts.en: A. Osasogie is 3-years-old, married and has five children. Her children are all in school. She sells drinks and provisions such as toothpaste, detergent, bathing soap and noodles. She is requesting a loan amount to increase her inventory of products for resale. She thanks all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more household provisions and drinks for resale

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Itohan E. is 27 years old and married with 6 children. She and her family live in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. Her husband is a teacher. She needs the loan amount of N20,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She is indeed grateful to all who make this loan possible

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ochilboy

texts.en:
Ochilboy is a farmer. Thanks to his hard work and dedication, his farm can earn enough to support his family. Ochilboy lives together with his parents and wife. Ochilboy is currently growing wheat, but after the upcoming harvest he hopes to be prepared to grow new products. In order to do this, he needs a larger quantity of fertilizers so that his crops can develop adequately. He hopes to grow high quality crops so that he can sell them for a better price in the markets. For this reason, Ochilboy is asking for a loan to increase his production and improve his products, the sales from which will fund the planting of a new cycle of crops. Ochilboy hopes that you can consolidate his production plans and sincerely thanks you.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fuels and lubricants, wheat seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Estebana De La Concepcion

texts.es:
La Señora de nombre Estebana de la Concepción López V. tiene la edad de 40 años, su estado civil es casado, Doña Estebana tiene 2 hijos sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 18 años cursa el 5 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 15 años cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su esposo labora como agricultor, sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio activo por lo que ya que tiene que seguir proporcionándoles estudios a sus hijos para que sean profesionales para el día de mañana sus sueños son de invertir mas su inventario para que llegue a ser una gran distribuidora ya que le gustaría tener una amplia variedad de productos sus deseos son que Dios le genere mas vida para llegara  conocer sus nietos por lo que ahorita sus hijos están estudiando y ellos logren finalizar sus carreras y mas tarde puedan formar su propia familia y así podrán tomar decisiones para el día de mañana.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 8 años, Doña Estebana inicia este negocio con el objetivo de apoyar en los gastos de su familia por lo que este negocio nace de forma ambulante ya que ella empezó ofreciendo sus productos en las calles y algunas veces recurría algunos centros de estudios ya que la mayoría de sus clientes eran niños y así inicio su idea de mantener su negocio de forma estable y este tendría lugar en su casa de habitación por lo que no fue fácil al principio y necesitaba el apoyo de sus familia ya que inicio con pocos productos como: paletas, bombones, caramelos, bolsitas  y refrescos naturales y sus clientes ivan en busca de mas productos por lo que decide realizar un financiamiento para incrementar su pulpería y este le sirvió de ayuda y es así como ha ido mejorando en su negocio por lo que ahora solicita otro financiamiento ya que ahora necesita suplir su negocio de artículos escolares ya que sus clientes ya están solicitando todo tipo de útiles necesarios para el colegio.
texts.en:
Estebana de la Concepción López V. is 40 years old and married. Estebana has two sons: the elder is 18 and in his fifth year of high school and the younger is 15 and in his fourth year of high school. Her husband works as a farmer. She wants to keep her business going as she needs to continue sending her sons to school so that they can have careers. She dreams of investing in her inventory so that she can become a major distributor as she would like to have a wide variety of products. She hopes that God will keep her alive long enough for her to know her grandchildren because now her sons are studying. She hopes her children will have careers and only after that start their own families, and in this way make decisions about their future. She owns a grocery store, which she runs from her home. She has had this business for eight years. Estebana started the business to help pay the household expenses. She began as a street vendor, offering her products in the streets and sometimes near schools as most of her customers were children. She had the idea to stabilize her business and that she could locate it in her home. In the beginning is was not easy and she needed her family's help as she started with a limited variety of goods such as lollipops, chocolates, sweets, soft drinks and fresh fruit shakes. Her clients were always looking for more products and so she decided to borrow in order to expand her grocery store and this helped her. In this manner she has been improving her business and she is now asking for this loan to stock her store with school supplies as her customers are now asking for products for school.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Ngô Thị Hằng Group

texts.vi:
Chị H., 27 tuổi là một phụ nữ trẻ khéo léo, đảm đang, tháo vát. Hiện nay chị đang sống cùng chồng, bố mẹ chồng và 2 con nhỏ. Chị là một thợ may, ngoài thời gian làm nghề chị còn cùng chồng cấy lúa,trồng H. màu, chăn nuôi gà, lợn. Chu kỳ trước, gia đình chị đã vay vốn để chồng chị đi buôn trứng gà. Việc kinh doanh khá tốt nên gia đình chị không chỉ hoàn trả vốn vay rất tốt mà còn thu về khoản tiền lãi khá lớn để tiếp tục phát triển chăn nuôi. Thu nhập gia đình chị khoảng 150.000-200.000 vnđ/ ngày. Chu kỳ này chị tiếp tục vay 4.256.000 vnđ/ 12tháng/ chu kỳ 2 để mua thêm lợn giống và thức ăn chăn nuôi. Các thành viên còn của nhóm chị là :
  Cô Nguyễn Thị
texts.en:
Mrs. Hang, aged 27, is very energetic and skillful. She is currently living with her husband, parents-in-law and her two young children. Besides being a tailor, she is a farmer and is currently raising poultry at home. In the previous round, she asked for a loan to buy and sell chickens’ eggs, from which she has been able to earn enough to pay back the loan and save for the future. Her family’s income is about 150.000-200.000 VND per day. In this round, she would like to borrow 4.256.000 VND to buy two pigs and food for the poultry. Other members in her group include: Mrs. Nguyen Thi Uoc, aged 53, would like to borrow 4.256.000 VND to buy pigs and invest in her small shop. Mrs. Nguyen Thi M., aged 33, would like to borrow 4.256.000 VND to buy pigs. Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., aged 28, would like to borrow 4.704.000 VND to buy pigs and ingredients to make vermicelli. Mrs. Nguyen Thi Chin, aged 26, would like to borrow 4.256.000 VND to buy and sell fruits and make wood-things to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by KH. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nhóm chị Hằng vay vốn để mua giống chăn nuôi và bổ sung vốn để phát triển buôn bán nhỏ, làm nghề.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
Marisela ha estado trabajando en su profesión desde que acabó sus estudios de Diseño de moda en 1994.
Ella confecciona ropa con máquinas industriales profesionales, pero no hace producción al por mayor, solamente trabaja bajo pedido de clientes.
Marisela logra contribuir en una menor parte de los gastos de la casa y de la crianza de sus dos hijas de dieciséis y veinticinco años gracias a sus ganancias, lo demás gastos los cubre su esposo.
Aunque tiene ocho años recibiendo los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, Marisela quiere mantener el nivel de su negocio en el cual está ahora, porque por ahora no cuenta con más tiempo que el que requiere para cumplir con  todos los pedidos.
texts.en:
Marisela has been working in her profession since completing her Fashion Design studies in 1994. She makes clothing using professional industrial machines, but does not create wholesale, rather only by special order. Marisela manages to contribute in a small way to the household expenses and to the upbringin of her two daughters, aged 16 and 25, thanks to her income; the remaining expenses are paid by her husband. Although she has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO for eight years, Marisela wants to maintain her level of business where it is now, because for now she does not have enough time to satisfy her customers' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She invested in material for her clothes-making business

loans.name: Sanju

texts.en: Mrs. Sanju R. lives in Chetrapati, Kathmandu with her husband and one son, who is in primary school. Both Mrs. R. and her husband make a living running a clothing store, which opened five years ago and sells many different types of garments. The store is their family's sole source of income. Mrs. R. is applying for a loan to expand her business by buying different types of garments to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell from her shop

loans.name: Talainuu

texts.en: Talainuu T., 34, is married with three children. She has year(s) of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the village people and the general public four days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala.  SPBD loans are Talainuu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will be used on the business only.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers, chemicals and a wheel barrow

loans.name: Gabe Abelina

texts.es:
Gabe es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Gabe es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, Gabe vende ropa como lencería, de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza todos los días, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Gabe necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa interior.
Los sueños de Gabe son tener un local estable para su negocio y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gabe is a member of the Sarita Community Bank. 43-year old Gabe lives with her partner and has two children. Every day she walks along the streets of the Nery García Market selling lingerie and other clothing which she got in Lima. Gabe needs a loan of 1000 soles which she will use to buy underwear to sell. Her dreams are to run her business from a permanent location and to have her children complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell

loans.name: Abduvohid

texts.ru: Абдувохид 1981 года рождения , женат детей пока нет. Закончив школу , поступать в университет не смог. Имеет бизнес откорм скота. Сам работает слесарем в автобазе.работа тяжелая но кормить ново создавшую семью необходимо.  Дядя помогает  выводить скот на рынок. По совету и дяди он начал этот бизнес. Первый кредит получил в 2006 году на приобретение одной коровы. Сейчас имеет несколько голов скота благодаря кредит от КИВА и Микроинвест, к тому же он благодарен за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abduvohid was born in 1981. He is married, but has no children yet. He graduated from high school, but was not able to go to college. He has a business raising cattle, but also works as a metalworker at a vehicle depot. It is heavy work, but feeding his new family is a must. His uncle helps transport the cattle to market. Abduvohid started this business on his uncle's advice. He took out his first loan in 2006 to purchase one head of cattle. Now he has several head of cattle thanks to Kiva and MicroInvest loans, and he is grateful to them for the support.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro has created a good life for himself and his family by selling Italian jewelry to customers throughout New York City. He first began to sell jewelry with his brother and later began selling on his own. He travels throughout the city to doctors' offices, hospitals, private offices, and other establishments where he has built up a loyal client base. His clients often call him to see if he has anything new in. 

When he first began his business, he borrowed money from friends to build up his inventory. He once tried to get a loan from a bank but was turned away. Alejandro’s first loan from ACCION USA was to establish his credit; he was able to repay it on time and has now taken a second loan. With his loan he is purchasing more inventory--rings, chains, bracelets, pendants and watches, and some precious stones as well.  

While Alejandro feels that money and happiness are not connected, he has created a stable business that has allowed him to accomplish both his dream of small business ownership and providing for his family. Alejandro's son currently attends university and with his small business he supports him as much as possible.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Alejandro from  United States

loans.use: Purchase inventory such as rings, bracelets, chains, pendants , watches and precious stones

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des produits cosmétiques, elle fait ce commerce depuis  près de 6 ans déjà ce qui lui a permis d’avoir une parfaite maîtrise de son activité. Elle exerce ce commerce au marché local de hedzranawoé et dans ce marché elle a des concurrentes, pour mieux vendre et faire face à la concurrence elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 1 cartons de crème ; 5 cartons de perruques, 20 mèches de différents modèles, des parfums et divers.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, avec son revenu elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This lady earns a living selling cosmetics. She has been in this business for almost 6 years already, which means she knows a lot about this line of work. She sells her wares in the local market of Hedzranawoé, and in this market, she has competitors. In order to make more sales and deal with the competition, she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 1 carton of crèmes, 5 boxes of wigs, 20 hair extensions of various sorts, perfumes and other items.

She is married and the mother of 3 children. With her income she contributes to supporting the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow yams

loans.name: Kodir

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 Рахимов Кодир-53 летний мужчина,имеет полноценную семью,3 их детей, жена домохозяйка. Занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота более 20лет на дому.Его жена  помогает ему по хозяйству и по откармливанию скота. Этой семье нравиться присматривать за скотом и получать прибыль за это. Откорм скота это хлеб семьи и Кодир продолжает своё дело по сей день. Следующий займ он хочет закупить еще несколько бычков и откормить их ещё несколько мес-в.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Kodir R. is a 53 year old man, he has a good family, three children, his wife is a housewife. He feeds and grows large cattle at home for more than twenty years. His wife helps him around the house and to feed the cattle. This family likes to look after the cattle and get profit from it. Feeding of the cattle is a daily bread of this family and Kodir continues his business till this day. His next loan he wants to use to buy several calves and feed them for several months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Sar Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan which consists of twenty people is located in Pou Roung village in TaK. province. Mrs. Mom S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a recyclables collector. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more recyclable products to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Chiv Kha, is a motor taxi driver. Mrs. Mom S. is 38 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school.

Fifteen members in this group loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT borrowers are not required to pA. any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repA. portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: purchasing more recyclable products

loans.name: Theophilus

texts.en: Theophilus A. sells firewood at Daboase near Shama Junction. He has no formal education. He is married and has three children. His wife is a waakye seller: she buys rice and beans and cooks them together. Theophilus has been selling firewood since 2009. He is responsible for payment of school fees and utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more firewood to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more firewood

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Marilyn Navarro, 49 years old rice grower in Noral South Cotabato in Mindanao. She has three children, 28 years old the eldest who are now working. Currently, she tills a 1 and 1/2 hectare farm which she hopes could give her family enough income to help buy food. c;lothing, and other basic needs.

She is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying the farming necessities in order to have an abundant harvest.

She said she joined in CEVI credit program since 2008. She likes the policies that is why she stayed in CEVI.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Velenda

texts.en:
Mrs. Velenda E. is from Purok Punaw Brgy, Canmoros, town of Binalbagaan, Negros Occidental. She is 32 years old and married with three school-aged children who are seven, six and two years old. She has been an active member of the project since 2004. She started with a general store and as business improved, she saw other opportunities where she could help her husband earn more for the support of their family. Now she makes pork barbecue and other snack foods which she cooks and sells in front of her general store to attract buyers from the neighborhood.

Now on her seventh cycle, Mrs. E. applied to borrow PHP 19,500 to use as additional capital for her general store.

Mrs. E. and her husband are striving to earn extra income and to save for their children's education. They believe that giving their children a proper education can give them a better future and a better opportunity for them to become a good citizen.

NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To act as additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is forty one years old. She is a single parent with three children who are in school. She is a serious minded business woman who works hard to support her children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. She believes it is now an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her stock of goods available for sale and make more income to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase assorted grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2007, he decided to work as a builder after five years of experience in his own business. Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase more tools and materials because he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more tools and materials

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz Group

texts.es:
Epifanía A.  de 45 años es socia de Pro Mujer desde hace 15 años aproximadamente, ella se dedica a comercializar calzados, una actividad que aprendió de sus padres desde muy niña, ella dice que con este negocio ha podido hacer estudiar a sus  3 hijos y los préstamos que ha obtenido de Pro Mujer le ha permitido incrementar  su capital de trabajo, adquiere su mercadería de Oruro ya que es más económico y los vende en la feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Ahora necesita el préstamo para comprar mayor mercadería.
Sus compañeras también tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de comida,  mantas y tienda de barrio. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
Epifanía A., 45, has been associated with Pro Mujer for 15 years approximately. She is a shoe merchant, an occupation learned from her parents when she was a little girl. She states that this business has allowed her to afford schooling for her three children and the loans she has gotten from Pro Mujer have allowed her to increase her working capital She gets her merchandise in Oruro since it is less expensive there and she sells it at the 16th of July market in the city of El Alto. She needs financing to buy more merchandise. Her fellow group members have different lines of work like: prepared meal sales, blanket making, neighborhood general stores. The all need financing to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand acreage and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is sixty-two years old, married, and has four children, some of whom are still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Francis is a proprietor of a private school. He started the school about three years ago and it is still in its beginning stages. He says he has hired a few staff members who work with him. Francis dreams of building the school to bigger and higher levels. He wants the loan to buy furnishings and equipment to improve the school.

loans.use: To buy furniture and equipment

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El banco D. Emprendimiento "NUEVO HORIZONTE " es un Banco que se encuentra en su segundo ciclo,  en el cual demostraron ser  personas responsables y trabajadoras, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias: 

Como Presidenta esta la Sra. Aleja quien es la lider y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. dulces en  calle Nataniel Aguirre y Aroma . Esta separada  y tiene 4 hijos.

Como Tesorera esta la  Sra. Ivone  esta casada y tiene 2 hijos su negocio es  venta D. anticucho   en la puerta D. su domicilio  es una persona muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas.

La secretaria es la Sra. Liliana  quien es casada y  tiene 4 hijos y  tiene el negocio D. venta còsmeticos es una persona  activa.						
						
Estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The microfinance communal bank "NUEVO HORIZONTE " is in its second loan cycle. During its first loan cycle, this group has shown itself to be maD. of hardworking and responsible people. This group is maD. up of the following members: The President is Mrs. Aleja who is the leader and founder of the group. Her business is the sale of candy on Nataniel Aguirre y Aroma street. She is separated and has four children. The Treasurer is Mrs. Ivone, who is married and has two children. Her business is the sale of anticucho (a Peruvian meat dish cooked and served on skewers) from the door of her home. She has proven herself to be very responsible and punctual with her payments. The Secretary is Mrs. Liliana who is married, has four children, and runs a cosmetics sales business. She is an active and hardworking person. All are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for having confidence in them and for granting them this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard G. lives in Tsovagyugh village, near Sevan, with her husband and son. For about ten years she worked in a hotel as a dishwasher, but since 2000 Alvard has run her own business in her own place. She sells a variety of products in her shop. At the same time she is engaged in raising livestock; she has cows, sheep and pigs. Her family helps Alvard in her business and with the livestock farming as well. Alvard seeks 1.100.000 AMD to buy candy and snacks for her shop.

loans.use: To buy candy and snacks for her shop

loans.name: Rito

texts.es: El señor Rito S. , es casado, desde temprana edad se ha dedicado a la actividad pecuaria y agricola siendo su principal fuente de ingreso, habita en el municipio de Nueva Guinea en la colonia Kurinwas junto a su familia la integran su conyuge y 4 hijos mayores los que apoyan el los quehaseres del hogar yde la finca, necesita financiamiento de su 4to credito para invertirlo en la retencion de terneros, por que no alcanzan el tamaño y peso para la comercializacion, con este credito dejara  que sus animales crezcan y asi obtener resultados que ayuden a solventar necesidades economicas del nucleo familiar,  se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy progresivo y trabajador, honesto y en su comunidad lo consideran como un gran lider.
texts.en:
Señor Rito S. is married; livestock and agriculture have provided his main income since he was young. He lives in the town of Nueva Guinea in the Kurinwas neighborhood with his family composed of his spouse and 4 grown children who help him with household and farm chores. He needs his fourth loan to keep his calves because they have not yet gained the size and weight necessary to be profitable. With this loan he can allow his animals to grow more and thus achieve the results that will help take care of the economic necessities of the nuclear family. He describes himself as a very progressive, hard-working, honest man, and he is looked to as a leader in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise calves

loans.name: Isaura Suyen

texts.es: El principal comercio de la joven Isaura, es la venta de ropa y cosméticos, tiene 28 años de edad, madre de dos hijos que junto a su esposo trabajan para poder cubrir los gastos, su esposo trabaja en la empresa Pepsi como contador. Este negocio de Isaura lo inicio con fondo que  su esposo dio y ganancias de ventas que le daban a vender es por eso nace la iniciativa de vender variedad de productos. Lo que mas desea Isaura es poder tener su propia casa ya que aun vive con su mama, es por eso se esfuerza mucho en las ventas ya que su esposo con el dinero que gana esta pagando una casa financiada por los proyecto del gobierno que espera pronto poder gozar de esta bendición de tener su casa. Afodenic avenido a mejorar el ámbito del comercio ya que ha logrado invertir en su negocio lo cual con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos, ropa, zapatos ya que tiene poca mercadería la cual vende al contado y al crédito a sus clietes.
texts.en:
Isaura's primary business is the sales of clothing and cosmetics. She is 28 years old and the mother of 2 children. Together, Isaura and her husband work to be able to cover the expenses. Her husband works at Pepsi as an accountant. Isaura began her business with her husband's funds that he gave her and with the profits that the sales gave them, the idea was born to sell a variety of products. What Isaura wishes for most is to be able to have her own house since she still lives with her mother. For this reason, she puts forth a lot of effort in her sales. Her husband, with the money that he is earning, is paying for a house financed by a government project. She soon hopes to be able to enjoy the blessing of having her own house.

Afodenic is well-suited to improve the business environment since it is investing in her business. With this loan she will invest in the purchase of cosmetics, clothing, and shoes, since she has little merchandise to sell by cash and by credit to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to improve her sales

loans.name: Haja Ramatu

texts.en:
Madam Haja Ramatu is a fishmonger and she is married to a gold miner. She owns a stall at the market in the centre of town where she sells her fish retail.

Haja Ramatu has six children, three of whom are in school. Through her husband she was able to secure some capital and established herself in the fish trade. She has been selling fish for fifteen years now.

Haja Ramatu is in need of a loan to purchase an additional stock of fish to sell wholesale. She hope to use the proceeds of the loan to support her children’s education and to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell wholesale

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El Señor Edwin Solís C. tiene 25 años, está casado con la Señora Miguelina Marquina tiene  27 años, tienen una hija de 4 años, ellos viven en la comunidad de palca grande a 90 km de la ciudad de Sacaba, son personas humildes de escasos recursos , no tienen capital para ampliar el negocio de venta de abarrotes, en la tienda tienen los productos de primera necesidad; arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, sal y gas  licuado, por otro se dedican a la producción de tubérculos (papa), la comunidad se encuentra muy alejado de la ciudad, el transporte a la zona es muy escaso los camiones solo salen una vez a la semana.

El Edwin no tiene capital para agrandar la tienda de abarrotes, por lo  tanto necesita un capital  para agrandar la tienda, en la zona es la única tiendo donde provee estos productos de primera necesidad, por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir en busca de préstamo a los bancos a la ciudad, CIDRE se encuentra más cerca y trabaja con la comunidad rurales se encuentra cerca donde ellos pueden acudir a un préstamo para mejorar el negocio que tienen.

La esposa de Edwin, doña Miguelina nos comenta que su mayor sueño es sacar a su hija una enfermera en salud y para que su hija estudie y salga profesional quiere tener suficiente capacidad económica y tener ahorros en un banco para hacer estudiar y luego trabajaría  en la misma comunidad según ella machas mujeres  sufren de  mucho enfermedades  así su hija puede ayudar a la gente humilde de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Edwin Solís C., 25, is married to Miguelina Marquina, 27, and they have a 4-year-old daughter. They live in Palca Grande, 90 kilometers from the city of Sacaba. They are humble, low-income people that lack funds to enlarge their grocery store. They sell basic needs items: rice, sugar, pasta, cooking oil, salt and liquefied gas. Additionally, they farm tubers (potatoes). The community is quite removed from the city; public transportation in the area is sporadic, buses are available once a week only. Edwin lacks funds to increase his grocery inventory so he needs funding to do so. His store is the only one in the area that provides these basic need items. It is very difficult for them to go to traditional banks in the city to solicit loans. CIDRE is closer and works with rural communities so they are able to call upon it to request loans to improve their business. Edwin’s wife, Miguelina, tells us that her greatest dream is that her daughter become a nurse. In order for this to happen, she must have funds enough and savings to pay for her studies. Her hope is that she would later come back to work in the community because many women suffer illnesses and her daughter could then help the humble people of her community.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old and married with six children ranging in age from five to 22.  Three of her children currently attend school. She has run a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, for over 10 years now and sells tomatoes, vegetables and milk for her primary source of income. She also earns income from selling surplus maize and beans to the local market when they are available. She says that one challenge currently facing her is the lack of good storage facilities for her produce, like maize and beans.

Mary has a successful history with Juhudi Kilimo, having recently paid off her first loan of Kes. 40,000. She has now requested a loan of Kes. 60,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow and to expand her stock of poultry. She says that this loan will improve her life and provide extra milk for consumption by her family. In the future, she would like to acquire a high-yield dairy cow and run a posho mill business. (A posho mill is a machine that grinds maize into flour.)

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and expand her stock of poultry

loans.name: Émeline Clarisse

texts.fr: A. Émeline Clarisse est née le 10 Août 1975 et vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Yénawa à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Émeline Clarisse est mariée à BANKOLE Victor et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Yénawa. Émeline Clarisse vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Émeline Clarisse n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Émeline Clarisse vend de la glace, des jus de bissap et de citron et d'autres boissons sucrées à son domicile. Émeline Clarisse s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Émeline Clarisse est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui avait déjà bénéficié de trois prêts, qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Émeline Clarisse ambitionne rehausser le niveau de son activité et augmenter son stock de produits. C'est pour cette raison que Émeline Clarisse sollicite un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
Émeline Clarisse A. was born on August 10, 1975. She has been living for about a dozen years in the Yénawa district in Cotonout, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Victor Bankole and is the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. The family lives together in Yénawa. Émeline Clarisse helps her husband support the family. She never went to school. To provide for the family, she sells ice, hibiscus and lemon juice and other soft drinks out of her home. She buys her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Émeline Clarisse is an old client of ALIDé, and had obtained three loans in the past, all of which she has duly repaid. In response to the growing customer demand, she would like to expand her business and enlarge her stock of products. This is why she is seeking a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing hibuscus flower, sugar, little plastic bags, lemons etc, for the preparation of soft drinks

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack is 34 years old and married. He is the father of two children, aged 10 and 8. He has been a fishmonger in Nairobi for the last six years. He employs two people and describes his business environment as conducive. 

He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of fish for sale. Jack describes himself as honest and hardworking and hopes to diversify his business in the future. He also plans to educate his children well. 

Since joining Faulu Kenya Ltd., a Kiva partner, Jack says that he has adopted a saving culture and learned business skills.

loans.use: To add stock of fish for sale

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna P. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Vang Pang, have been married since 1992. They have four sons. All of them are in school. The family lives along National Road number Two, about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh City. 

P. sells fish in the village that her husband catches. Besides fishing, the couple also grows peanuts and lotus. P. is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase fishing materials for her husband’s fishing business and she will use a part of her loan to rent more plots of the land to grow lotus.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials for her husband’s fishing business and to rent more plots of the land to grow lotus.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Futuro Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Mujeres del futuro, se conformó en fecha Octubre de 2.009, en la ciudad de Kambyreta y están desarrollando el 3er ciclo.  
El comité inicio su conformación mediante la comunicación de otras mujeres que ya estaban participando en la misma zona. 
Hasta la fecha se muestran muy conformes y con ganas de seguir avanzando con el trabajo  que vienen realizando.
La venta de ropas es una actividad muy común entre las mujeres de la zona de Encarnación y la señora Lidia es una de ellas.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas desde que comenzó a integrar el comité de mujeres, y se encuentra muy contenta realizando esta actividad ya anteriormente solo realizaba  los trabajos de su casa.
Lidia compra sus mercaderías y dos día de la semana sale a diferentes compañías de la zona de Encarnación para ofrecer sus ropas llegando casa por casa.
Su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que debe caminar y llevar sus mercaderías al mismo tiempo, pero ella nos comenta que está muy contenta y satisfecha ya que puede ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, buzos, camisas, camperas, pantalones y otros.
texts.en:
This group called, “Mujeres del futuro” (Women of the Future) was formed in October 2009, in the city of Kambyreta, and is now in its third cycle. The group began through conversations with other women, also working in the same zone. They are very satisfied and have demonstrated a strong desire to continue to move ahead with their work. Clothing sales is a very common activity among the women in the Encarnación zone, and Lidia is one of them. She has been selling clothing since she began forming the group and she is very happy. Prior to this, she was a homemaker. Lidia buys her merchandise and travels to different parts of the zone to offer her merchandise door to door. Her work requires lots of sacrifice, because she must walk and carry her items, but she tells us that she is happy to be able to help her family with the household expenses. She is asking for this loan in order to buy additional inventory, such as sweats, shirts, pants, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Karanja

texts.en:
Karanja is a married man with four children. He has been selling firewood for five years.

As a member of the Githiga Upright self-help group of Faulu Kenya, Karanja has been guaranteed a loan of 20,000 KES to add to his stock of firewood. He believes that his income will increase with additional stock.

Karanja says that his life and family situation have changed positively since joining Faulu. He hopes to enlarge his business in the future.

loans.use: To add to his stock of firewood

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is married to M. W. and lives in a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines.

Nusrat is a very talented lady. She makes embroidered dresses on order. She does this work to share financial burdens with her husband. She receives orders from her neighbors and charges 300 PKRs for each embroidered dress she makes, which allows her to pay for the family's utility expenses. Her husband is involved in the garment business. He purchases garments from different cities, such as Multan, Lahore, and Faisalabad (which is famous for its textiles), and he then sells the garments to different areas of and clothing shops in their community. He has been in this line of business for over six years.

Nusrat applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband's business. With the loan proceeds, her husband would like to buy additional garments, which would allow him to increase sales and profits. She hopes that her husband will be able to expand and improve his business by selling a wider variety of garments to more customers.

loans.use: To expand and improve the business by purchasing additional garments

loans.name: Mercidia

texts.es: Mercida tiene 59 años, es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos ya mayores de edad. La señora tiene 25 años de dedicarse de tener de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo se siente muy tranquila con este negocio.  Hace más 8 años con este negocio, Su negocio nace debido a la necesidad de empleo por lo que con el paso del tiempo es que ha mejorado, ahora cuenta con una gran variedad de clientes. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, calzado, sabanas y toallas.
texts.en:
Mercidia, 59, is a single mother of six children who are all adults. She has sold general merchandise for 25 years. This, then, isn’t her first time requesting financing and she feels quite secure in her business. She has had this particular enterprise for over 8 years. It grew from her need to have employment and with time it’s improved. Now she can count on a large variety of regular customers. The funds will be used to buy pants, shirts, skirts, shoes, sheets and towels.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, skirts, shoes, sheets and towels.

loans.name: Reneline

texts.en:
This is Reneline G., 32, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Rodel, a pipe fitter, and is the mother of an active youngster. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her child all the way through college. This is the dream of most Filipino parents like Reneline. As she herself has been a college undergraduate she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents are able to leave to their children.
Reneline runs a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, frozen cured meats and hams, detergent soap and other products through popular direct-selling brands such as Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, Pampanga’s Best (for the cured meats) and other direct-selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Reneline's regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 5,800 PHP in sales every month.
To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Reneline dreams of being able to give her child a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy orders for her customers

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Albertina tiene 49 años de edad y es madre soltera, ella tiene 2 hijos  trabaja como empleada en el Instituto Nacional de Cultura, la socia también en su tiempo libre vende cosméticos por catálogos a sus compañeras, ella también se dedica a la compra y venta de terrenos fuera de la ciudad. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos por catalogo que están en oferta para venderlos a un poco más cuando se regulariza el precio de los cosméticos y otros.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Albertina, 49, is a single mother of two children. She is employed by the National Cultural Institute. On her free time, however, she also sells catalogue cosmetics to her coworkers. In addition, she buys and sells lots outside the city. She is asking for funds to buy catalogue items that currently are on sale in order to resell them later for a bit more when prices of the cosmetics and other items stabilize. She is a member of the “PADRE URRACA” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this forum to give thanks for the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in catalogue items that are on sale.

loans.name: Indiana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Indiana es una mujer trabajadora, de 42 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos, hoy en día trabaja como domestica.  Para ayudar  a sus hijos. Ya que es madre soltera, dos de sus hijos trabajan en ventas en el mercado a su misma patrona.
Siendo sus hijos un gran apoyo el cual han logrado hacer su pequeña casa. Trabajando para un futuro mejor.
Lo que desean es la construcción de un cuarto ya que en uno duermen todos, lo que será de privacidad y de comodidad para la familia.
Compraran materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines, para comenzar  a construir. Todo está siendo posible a través del financiamiento siendo una puerta a la prosperidad.
texts.en:
Indiana is a working woman, 42 years old, mother of 3 children. Today, she works at home to support her children. She is a single mother. Two of her children work in sales at the market under the same boss.

She knows that her children are a good support having helped her complete her small home. They are working for a better future.

What they want is to construct a new room since they now sleep all together. This would provide privacy and comfort for the family.

They will purchase materials for construction such as rock, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and tiles, to begin construction. Everything is possible thanks to this financing, opening a door to prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
Emilio es uno D. L. miembros del grupo La nueva esperanza 2, elL. son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas D. ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, educacion, etc; en la ciudad D. San Pedro D. Macoris, una ciudad famosa por sus jugadores D. pelota y por la industria azucarera, su economía actual depenD.
