D. la Zona franca, la industria del cemento y otras actividades menores como el turismo. Está asociado D. Esperanza inicio con su primer prestamo y actualmente llega 3 años y esta recibiendo su septimo prestamo, en cada uno ha realizado sus pagos satisfactoriamente y ha realizado buenas inversiones, se ha dedicado al comercio D. ventas miscelaneas, zapatos, cosmeticos, ropas, etc.

Emilio está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra D. ropas, productos cosmeticos, zapatos. El va a utilizar sus ganancias para ahorrar para asi poder construir su casa. Su actividad favorita es escuchar musica, y su reto es mantenerse fiel con L. prestamos para asi poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Su sueño es mejorar su condicion social y poder comprar un vehiculo granD., como una camioneta o camion.
texts.en:
Emilio is one of the members of the group La Nueva Esperanza 2 (New Hope 2). They are micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to selling clothing, natural goods, shoes, education, etc. They work in the city of San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for its athletes and sugar industry. At present, its economy depends on the duty-free industry zones, the cement industry, and other minor activities like tourism. This member is receiving his seventh loans three years after receiving his first. In each loan, he has maD. his repayments on time and has maD. good investments. He sells miscellaneous items, shoes, cosmetics, clothing, etc.

Emilio is planning to invest his new loan to buy clothing, cosmetics, and shoes. He will use his earnings to save so that he can build a house. He enjoys listening to music, and his goal is to remain faithful with the loans so that he can continue investing in his business. His dream is to improve his social condition and to buy a large vehicle, like a truck or a pick-up truck.

loans.use: To buy different products including cosmetics and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe M. is from the village of Panay, Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Maria Fe is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Fe owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maria Fe has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maria Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Fe is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Maria Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more consignment of drugs

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida N. is a married woman who lives in Cordova, Brgy. Cogon, Lapu-lapu City, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating a Sari- Sari (general store) business.  Her husband Angelito N., who is 39 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living.  They have 3 children who are between 6 to 10 years old years old and are all currently going to school. 

Bienvinida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Bienvinida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 25,000, increasing the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to pay for more stock to sell so that she can continue to save for future purposes.  Bienvinida N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Marie Gay Rose

texts.en:
Marie Gay Rose R. is from the village of Magsaysay. She is 42 years old. Marie Gay Rose is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marie Gay Rose owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marie Gay Rose has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marie Gay Rose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marie Gay Rose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Marie Gay Rose is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by the borrower from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 46 years old and married with four children who are between the ages of 1 and 15. Three of the children are currently attending school. He is a farmer from the town of Murang'a in central Kenya where he has been farming for 30 years. He employs one farmhand. His farm produces coffee and milk, which he sells to the local market and through Kenya Co-operative Creameries, respectively. He is also employed.

He has requested this loan of 53,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will go towards the education of his children. In five years' time, he hopes that he will be able to produce more than 50 litres of milk daily.

He is happy for the development projects that Juhudi is giving to the small-scale farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Morm

texts.en:
Morm C., 55, is married and resides with her six children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. C. is a housewife while her husband is a driver and a tailor, earning an income of USD 8 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 72 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to repair her husband’s car to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva’s partner. C.'s husband appears in the photograph because C. is not available.

loans.use: To repair her husband's car

loans.name: Fadi

texts.ar:
فادي في عمر 30 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في بيع كسر السيارات اي الخردوات له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب عمله وعائلته
هي كل اهتمامه يريد تعليم اولاده وتحسين وضعهم المادي والاجتماعي من خلال تطوير عمله يرى صعوبة في رأس المال لكن عائلته
تدعمه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تطوير المصلحة من خلال شراء بضاعة جديدة بهدف البيع بالجملة
texts.en: Fadi, 30, is married with two children. He has been working in the auto accessories business for 10 years. Fadi likes his work and gives his utmost care to his family. He wants to educate his children and improve their social and financial status through promoting his business. He lacks the adequate capital for doing that but his family helps him. He wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to develop his business through buying new goods to be sold on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: Buy new car accessories

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sonia, ella tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 11, 9 y 8 de edad  los mismos que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo está haciendo la rural para Lic. en enfermería. Ella es egresada en Ing. Comercial en la Universidad Laica Eloy Alfaro de Manta.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo  como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes,  envases de plástico y artículos de fiestas infantiles,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, por el momento trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos ya que  su esposo está haciendo la rural, nos cuenta que tiene  su negocio ya por 15 años y que le ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embases plásticos y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta porque ha hecho muchas amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic.  Most of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raise animals because it is an area with great vegetation.

This is the place where we meet Sonia.  She is 37, married, and she and her husband have three children.  The children are 11, 9, and 8, and they go to school.  Her husband is doing his required service in a rural area for his nursing license.  She is a commercial engineer graduate from Laica Eloy Alfaro de Manta.

She has a store selling consumer goods like rice, sugar, oil, detergents, plastic containers, and items for children’s parties.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  Sometimes she works even later.  She now works with help from her children because her husband is doing his required service.  She tells us that she has had the business for 15 years, and it has gone well for her.

She will use this loan to better supply her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, plastic containers, and other products.  She has been in her Communal Bank for five years.  She likes it because she has made many friends in the group.  Her goals are to get ahead in her business and to have her business grow more every day.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and plastic containers, etc.

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
Mr. Gerry L. is 38 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. He is blessed with one child. Gerry is a farmer and own a little parcel of land. Gerry cultivates the land for gardening & it has also become his own primary activity. It began as a back-yard gardening project and eventually led to selling a few of his garden vegetables during market day. 

He's thankful to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for providing them with financial assistance in the past. He is now applying for PHP 10,000 to buy farm pesticides and fertilizers for his garden. 

He has many plans for the future. One of his dreams is that someday, he will be the one supplying vegetables in the market.


About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy farm pesticides and fertilizers for his garden

loans.name: Presina

texts.en:
Presina P. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 45 years old. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Presina owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Presina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Presina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Presina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn T. is from the village of Bimonton, Mallig, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Jovelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as sugar, coffee, detergent, condiments and biscuits. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a resident of Mian Pind which is a small residential area located in Faisalabad. Faisalabad is Pakistan’s third largest city and well known for its textile industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 12 years. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who operates a vegetable-selling business on his donkey cart. He sells different seasonal vegetables to his clients and makes reasonable profits. Using the loan investment, he will buy a new cart because his current cart has become rough and needs replacement and buy fresh seasonal vegetables as well. The new cart will help him transport more vegetables to make more profits. 

Naseem has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her sons are enrolled in a local school and getting their education while her daughter is only three years old and has not started getting an education yet. She is hopeful that her husband will be able to gain positive financial results from the loan investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy a new cart & fresh seasonal vegetables for vegetable-sales business.

loans.name: Mwanashabani

texts.en:
Mwanashabani is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanashabani faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and meeting her customers 'needs in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she is requesting she wants purchase bundles of cloth materials for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth materials for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old and married to Artemio. They are blessed with five children, three of whom are already working and the rest are still studying. To make a living, Emma owns and operates a canteen store.  She makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for one year and earns approximately $118 a month.

In January 2006, Emma joined Paglaum MPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.

Emma is now requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks and other delicacies for her business. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks and other delicacies business.

loans.name: Ma. Erlene

texts.en:
Ma. Erlene is 43 years old and is a married woman with five children. The oldest child is 14 years old.

Ma. Erlene is a farmer who primarily grows rice to sell. She earns about $175 per month doing this farming. She requested a loan to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes for her business to grow and enable her to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Fitina

texts.fr: La cliente Fitina est entrepreneur, âgée de 38 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants et tous ses enfants étudient. Son mari est un menuisier charpentier.Elle est vendeuse de souliers usés au marché municipal CADECO. Depuis  Bukavu-Sud Kivu,avant qu'elle s'installe à Goma, elle exercait cette activité. Certes,il ya 19 ans révolus qu'elle fait ce commerce. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 3 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima avec ses produits de graduation. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 1 ballon de souliers usés et le reste d’argent sera affecté dans les petits projets de la famille. En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire sa maison. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.La cliente reste très sereine devant sa résidence.
texts.en:
Our customer Fitina is a 38 years old entrepreneur. She is married and a mother of nine children who all go to school. Her husband is a carpenter. She retails second-hand shoes at the Cadeco municipal market.

She has been in the business since she lived in the Bukavu region. In fact, it's been over 19 years that she's been in this business.In addition, she just went through three loan cycles with Hekima's graduated financial products.

This new loan should allow her to build up her stock with one bundle of second-hand shoes; the remainder of the money will be allocated to the family's small projects. In addition to this, she aims to keep her children in school and to build her house. The customer thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded from traditional banking. The customer is sitting very serenely in front of her habitation.

loans.use: to buy one bundle of second-hand shoes.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Aisha has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for three years and she works seven days out of every week. Aisha sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail. Aisha has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of bananas. The main business challenge(s) for Aisha include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to farmers for bananas and to build rental houses. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix, age 31, is married and has two children. He has been farming for the past four years. Felix is a humble client. He heard about KADET through other clients registered in his area of dwelling. This will be his first loan with KADET, and he intends to spend it on preparing the land for farming and purchasing maize seeds.

He intends to plough back the profit generated into the farm and dreams of having a big farm. He can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to prepare the land for farming and purchase maize seeds

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca tiene su negocio que es la venta de productos varios. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de molino. Ella tiene que empezar su labor desde muy temprano desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde pues llegan a moler maíz, cacao, carne, cuajada, queso, trigo  entre otros. El financiamiento es para la compra de motores y además proporcionarle mantenimiento a algunos motores que necesita. Ella sueña con agrandar su negocio cada día más.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca has a business selling various products. She also has more than 17 years of experience providing milling services. Juana begins her work very early at 5am and continues through 6pm. She grinds corn and cacao, and also sells curds, cheese, wheat and other products.

This loan will be used to buy motors and to pay for maintenance of a few motors that she already owns. Her dream is to expand her business each day.

loans.use: to purchase motors for her grain mills and to pay for maintenance of the existing motors.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 57 years old, married to Rahab and they have eight school-going children.  

He has practiced farming for the last 11 years. He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur de pièces détachées. Elle a 02 enfants.   
Adjo travaille comme revendeuse de friperie depuis 2003. Elle vend à domicile après achat à HEDZRANAWOE.
Adjo a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des friperies.
texts.en: Adjo is a 29-year-old woman. She is married to a seller of spare parts and has two children. She has been working as a retailer of second-hand clothing since 2003. After making her purchases in HEDZRANAWOE, she makes her sales out of her home. Adjo has requested her first loan cycle at WAGES for buying used clothing.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa  tiene la edad de 43 años, estudio hasta el tercero de secundaria, esta casada con el señor Amado que trabaja de musico, ellos tiene 3 hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela. Doña Nicolasa y su familia viven en una region productora de azucar.

Ella nos comenta que desde hace 3 años decidio iniciar con su negocio de venta de cosmeticos porque queria apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y tambien porque quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos y en un futuro ofrecerles una profesion.

Doña Nicolasa realiza sus ventas por catalago con sus amigos y vecinos de su comunidad, camina casa por casa para mostrarles sus catalagos, levanta pedidos, se surte de pro ductos y despues  entrega a sus clientes y ella recibe el pago por sus productos. Ella nos dice que aunque es un trabajo donde se debe caminar mucho le gusta ya que tiene la oportunidad de conocer mas personas y ampliar su negocio.

Ella necesita este credito para la compra de catalogos, maquillajes, lapiz labial, perfumes, desodorantes, delineador, maquillaje en liquido, esmalte, para su posterior venta.

Doña Nicolasa espera que con esta inversion su negocio pospere pues desea darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Nicolasa is 43 years old and studied through the third year of high school.  She is married to Sr. Amado, who works as a musician.  They have three children who are attending school.  Doña Nicolasa and her family live in a region that produces sugar.

She says that three years ago she decided to start a business selling cosmetics because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses.  Nicolasa also wants to help her children move forward and offer them a profession in the future.  

Doña Nicolasa makes catalog sales to her friends and neighbors in the community.  She walks from house to house in order to present her catalogs and to take orders.  After obtaining the products, Nicolasa delivers them to her customers and then collects payment.   She says that her job requires a lot of walking, but she likes having the opportunity to meet with more people and to expand her business.  

Nicolasa needs a loan to buy catalogs, make-up, lip pencils, perfumes, deodorants, eye liner, liquid foundation, and nail polishes for eventual resale.  

Doña Nicolasa hopes this investment will prosper her business because she wants to provide her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy catalogs, make-up, lip pencils, perfumes, deodorants, eye liner, liquid foundation, and nail polishes.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CHICON” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Poblado de Chicon, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.
El socio Edgar; El socio tiene 29 años, El socio  es conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos, El socio se dedica al transporte turístico, el socio tiene su propia unidad vehicular y está registrado en el área de prestación de servicio turístico; el socio presta servicio desde la ciudad del Cusco hasta el bello poblado de Urubamba, el socio trabaja muchos años en este rubro y también ofrece tours a los otros centros arqueológicos de la zona y alrededores, como traslados al aeropuerto, hotel o de las discotecas a sus respectivos lugares, el socio es una persona muy amigable y siempre está dispuesto al cambio por lo que  por ahora es un buen trabajo el de servicio a los turistas y prestar tours, el desea a futuro poder implementar su vivienda y dar hospedaje familiar, también le gustaría poner una agencia turística. El socio desea el crédito para poder invertir en el mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular para que siga operando sin molestias. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular, el socio cambiara también un par de llantas y combustible.
El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "CHICON" which is located in the village of Chicón, province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Edgar, 29, has a common-law wife and two children.  He has a tourist transportation business and uses his own vehicle which is registered for tourist service.  He offers service from the city of Cusco to the lovely town of Urubamba and has been working in this activity for many years.  He also offers tours to other local archaeological sites and in surrounding areas, as well as airport, hotel and discoteque transfers.  He is very friendly and always willing to adapt.  For now he has a good job with his tourist transport and tours service.  In the future he wants to turn his home into a guest house and also set up a travel agency.  He plans to use the loan for vehicle maintenance, new tires and fuel.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance, new tires and fuel.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
This is Marina, 30, a resident of Manila in the Philippines. She is married to Agapito, a welder, and mother to their two children. Both are still studying in elementary school. She and her husband manages their own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells frozen chicken and pork. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marina hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Break Through Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her mid 30s, is married with one child who goes to school. She has had a business of selling fish for eight years now. She works from 7 a.m to 10 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for buying more stock of fish to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to buy land.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Break Through" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  fish to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. 

Vicenta has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Vicenta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Vicenta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Myagmarsuren is 31 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife stays at home with their newborn child. Myagmarsuren started his garment retailing business in 2010 by renting a counter in the market. Even though he is fairly new to the business, he has many regular customers. 

Now that winter is approaching, Myagmarsuren wants to sell warm clothes. He is a sharp and diligent man who says "I never thought that my business would be this successful, My products selling like crazy." He is requesting 1,000,000 Mongolia Tughriks (MNT) to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine has 4 children aged 10 to 18. She has been a maize farmer for 5 years. She would like a loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to grow her crop. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers to increase production. With the profits from farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to grow her crop.

loans.name: Eucalda

texts.es: Eucalda, de 36 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo, Arturo y sus 3 hijos; Gisela, Erika y Fanny a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Carampa. Desde que era muy pequeña aprendió lo que era necesario para la correcta siembra y producción de las tierras; de esta manera cuando se unió a su esposo no dudo, junto con él, en  seguir trabajando la tierra y empezaron con la siembra de maíz. Tiempo después vieron que las ganancias de las ventas del maíz, les permitían sustentar muy bien a su familia, además de darles educación a sus hijas que era lo que más interesaba. Ha pasado el tiempo y continua  sembrando maíz, además paralelamente  también se dedica a la crianza de  ganado porcino, que engorda, para luego comercializar en las ferias de la zona por donde vive, y la actividad  le da buenas ganancias, que junto a las de la siembra le permite ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a su familia .Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar alverja, ya que sabe que el precio de esta legumbre está muy alto en el mercado. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “carampa” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Eucalda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero en la compra de semilla de alverja y varios sacos de fertilizantes para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Eucalda, 36, lives in her own house with her husband, Arturo, and their three children, Gisela, Erika and Fanny. She takes care of them in her own house, located in Carampa. 
At an early age Eucalda learned how to sow and reap correctly. That is why when she joined her husband, she had no doubt that they would keep on working with agriculture and they started planting maize. They realized that the income from maize allowed them to cater very well for their family and to provide their children with education, which was their priority.
Time has passed by and Eucalda still plants maize. She combines this with raising pigs. She raises them and then sells them at local fairs around her community, which enables her to offer her family a good quality of life.
Eucalda has a very entrepreneurial spirit and plans to grow green peas in the near future because she knows the market price for this produce is very high. She belongs to solidarity group “Carampa” and this is her fourth loan with the institution, where she feels happy because she receives support from all of you who allow her to stay in business. She also promises to repay on time because her group is made up of responsible and supportive people.
If Eucalda gets support, she will invest her money in the purchase of green pea seeds and several sacks of fertilizers for her next planting season.

loans.use: to purchase green pea seeds and sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Jocelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Nelsis

texts.es: Nelsis con su anterior credikiva, compró sillas playeras para alquilarlas y también le alcanzó para adquirir productos de lencería y mecatos. Ella está muy satisfecha y envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Muchas gracias por haberme apoyado a mí y a mi familia, para seguir creciendo en mi negocio y en mi persona. “ En la actualidad está aplicando para acceder a un nuevo credikiva, el cual invertirá en hacer adecuaciones a su vivienda en lo relacionado con los  dormitorios baños cocina, habitaciones a las que aplicará pañete y pintura en general.
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan Nelsis bought beach chairs to rent and had enough money to buy lingerie products and candies.  She is very satisfied and is sending the following message to Kiva backers: "Thank you very much for having supported my family and me, to continue growing in my business and personally."

Currently she is applying for a new Kiva loan, which she will invest in making home improvements to the bedrooms, bathrooms, and kitchen, rooms to which she will apply plaster and paint in general.

loans.use: to make home improvements to her bedrooms, bathrooms, and kitchen, with plaster and paint.

loans.name: Emin

texts.en:
Emin is 31 years old market vendor.  He is single and lives with his parents. He sells detergents products for last 6 years.  Emin is very polite and friendly person and that’s why his sales is increasing every months.  His father helps him to sell products.  His shop is in the central bazaar, the most popular vending place, always full of customers. 

The income business brings 230 AZN per month. Emin would like to increase his income via purchasing more merchandise and increase his sales. For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN. This will be his 3rd loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: purchase  more merchandise

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar es una persona luchadora que siempre ha querido ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres, es por esto que se encuentra en la búsqueda de poder generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y de esta manera lograr que sus ingresos no solo dependan de su empleo. Gracias a que anteriormente ha conocido la actividad de la ganadería, Julio Cesar desea invertir en unas especies que le permitan tener una seguridad económica ya que su empleo es muy inestable. El sueño de Julio Cesar es poder ahorrar dinero para estudiar una carrera universitaria y así mejorarles la calidad de vida a sus padres.
texts.en: Julio Cesar is a tenacious person who has always wanted to provide the best possible quality of life for his parents.  For this reason, he's been seeking a way to generate more income for the household, and in this way ensure that his income is not only dependent upon what he earns as an employee.  Since he previously had learned about animal husbandry, Julio Cesar wants to invest in some animals so that he can have economic stability, since his job is very unstable.  Julio Cesar's dream is to be able to save enough money to earn a university degree, and in this way improve the quality of life for his parents.

loans.use: to buy livestock to raise

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogamiques à Lafiabougou un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Le prêt antérieur a été correctement remboursé.
MAIMOUNA debout 2ème à gauche sur la photo fait le commerce de pagnes wax dans ce groupe de femmes JIGUISSEME. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une douzaine de pièces. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville et très souvent à Bamako.
Elle les revend de façon ambulante dans les différents quartiers de la  ville  de Sikasso, et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.250FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the "Jiguisseme" group are married women, on average 32 years old with 3 children. They live in monogamous households in Lafiabougou, one of the working-class areas in the city of Sikasso.
They are on their second loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele. The previous loan was repaid properly.
Maimouna, standing second from the left in the photo, sells pagnes wax (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth) in the Jiguisseme women's group.
With her loan, she intends to buy one dozen pieces. She gets her supplies at the grand market in Sikasso and very often in Bamako.
She re-sells them at home and door-to-door in various areas in the city of Sikasso, in cash, to a clientele composed of men and women.
She foresees earning an average monthly profit of 23,250 FCFA, of which one portion is used to repay the loan and its interest, with the rest going to her savings.

loans.use: To buy pagnes (brightly printed West African clothing) of the wax type.

loans.name: Haniatoulahi M.'s Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Haniatoulahi M. , la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 25 ans est mariée à un commerçant nommé Gratien. Le couple a un  enfant, qui n’est pas encore scolarisé et à leur charge. Haniatoulahi M. vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Depuis deux ans environ, Haniatoulahi M. vend des bijoux et des chaussures dans sa région, ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Haniatoulahi M.  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Haniatoulahi M. sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le pemier crédit a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des bijoux et des chaussures.

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Joylyn works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Joylyn has been supporting her business with the help of six prior loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid them and now is applying for a 13,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts for maintenance on the motorcycle she uses in her business. She is working hard continually to maintain and develop her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for maintenance on the motorcycle she uses in her business.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is 49 years old married and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family. Henry owns and operate a motor transportation service in his community while waiting for harvesting of banana fruit. He has been doing this for many years as his main source of income farming and transportation business. In 2012, Henry joined Gata Daku MPC and recently he borrowed a loan of 16,500 PHP to use for organic fertilizer and labor. He plans to save a portion of his generated income to acquire another unit of motor for his business expansion. He wants to improve the general living conditions of his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Valée

texts.en:
Born on April 16, 1984 in Lomé, Ms. Valée K. is single but takes care of one child. She is a trained hairdresser, and in addition to working as a hairstylist, she sells cosmetic products (hair extensions, shampoo, conditioner, etc.) in her hair salon. Her excellent work has earned her a good reputation in her neighborhood. As she has a very good business sense, she has easily repaid her first two loans.

So to attract even more customers, Ms. Valée K. plans on expanding and better equipping her hair salon by buying better-performing, modern equipment and a supply of cosmetic products. To do so, she is requesting a loan of $850, which will allow her to develop her business. This will earn her an increased income and allow her to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 16 Avril 1984 à Lomé, Mlle K. Valée est célibataire, mais a un enfant à sa charge. Coiffeuse de formation, elle exerce en plus de ce métier, la commerce des produits de beauté (mèches, shampooing, produit démêlant…) dans son salon de coiffure. Son travail bien fait, fait sa réputation dans le quartier. Très entreprenante, elle a remboursé ses deux premiers crédits sans difficulté.

Ainsi, pour séduire et attirer davantage sa clientèle, Mlle K. Valée prévoit agrandir et mieux équiper son salon de coiffure par l’acquisition de matériels modernes et plus performants et s’approvisionner en produit de beauté. Elle sollicite, pour ce faire, un crédit de $850 qui lui permettra d’augmenter ses activités. Ce qui lui procurera des revenus pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To equip her hair salon and buy good quality, modern equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase beads in bulk

loans.name: Janet A.

texts.en: Janet is a highly business oriented 22 year old. She says, “I have always wanted to own my own shopping boutique so that I can be able to show off my design skills.” She hopes that this loan will be able to turn her dream into a reality.

loans.use: To begin a shopping boutique

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Mrs. Veronica A. is a businesswoman who sells provisions and drinks. She is 51 years old, and is married with 4 children. She wishes to buy drinks and provisions with the loan that will be given to her, and she has been in this business since 1986.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & drinks for sale.

loans.name: Rola

texts.en:
Rola, 27 years old, married and mother of 2 children, is a seamstress who lives in the area of Al Rwaissat in Beirut. Before knowing about Al Majmoua, she was employed in a small atelier and was being paid very little by the owner. She heard about our Institution from word of mouth and applied for a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Her loan was approved, she bought the machine, quit her job and opened a business on her own.

This is the 3rd time Rola is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. This time, she needs a loan of US$ 600 to buy a new sewing machine. Rola is part of a group loan with other women from the same neighborhood. They named their group "Iya," that means "She". A group is usually constituted of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions. The group lending is based on incremental increase of the loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community; it is a very powerful tool towards the economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Unfortunately, a year ago Reyna lost her husband, with whom she shared many anecdotes and very happy moments. Moments she remembers often these days to be able to overcome the sadness that haunts her. Nonetheless, Reyna is not letting this situation defeat her and keeps fighting to move on and go forward. When her husband was still alive, Reyna started selling products by catalogue, starting with naturist products, then shoes. Little by little she started building her client portfolio.

Life always goes on. This is why Reyna is convinced that working hard will allow her overcome her sadness. This is why she's requesting a US $425 credit which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, Reyna will be able to purchase merchandise to have better products to offer her clients. With your help Reyna will be able to keep going and overcome her sadness.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Desgraciadamente hace un año, Reyna, perdió a su esposo, con quien compartió muchas anécdotas, y convivió con él momentos muy felices que hoy recuerda con mucha frecuencia para poder salir delante de la tristeza que la embarga. Sin embargo Reyna no se deja vencer por lo que está pasando y sigue luchando para salir adelante. Cuándo su esposo todavía vivía, Reyna comenzó a vender productos por catálogos, comenzando con productos naturistas, después con zapatos y poco a poco empezó a hacer su cartera de clientes.

Pero la vida sigue y es pos esto que Reyna está convencida que con trabajo logrará salir de esta tristeza, y es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $425 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Reyna podrá comprar mercancía para surtir y tener mejores productos que ofrecer. Con tu ayuda Reyna podrá salir delante de esta tristeza.

loans.use: Stock merchandise to offer her clients

loans.name: Komariyah

texts.en: Komariyah is 34 years old. Before joining MBK, her husband, A., is the only one who works in the family. But since joining MBK, she has helped her husband by starting her own business; producing handicraft, such as purses, in her house. She usually earns US $22 per month. She needs a loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Fraxila

texts.es:
Fraxila has been selling vegetables at the market for 22 years to help her husband, who sells sugar cane liquor (also known as rum).

Thanks to this business she has been able to own her home and pay for her youngest son's education.

Fraxila would now like to set up a "locutorio", which is a small phone kiosk or booth, where people can can make phone calls for a fee. She would also like to help her daughter with her notions store.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 22 años, Fraxila trabaja vendiendo verduras en el mercado. De esta manera, ayuda a su esposo, quien vende agua ardiente (licor de caña).

Gracias a este negocio, ha podido tener su casa propia y pagar los estudios de su hijo menor en un instituto.

Fraxila desea poder poner un locutorio, además de ayudar a su hija con su mercería.

loans.use: To set up a telephone kiosk or booh (locutorio)

loans.name: Senobia

texts.es:
Senobia owns a small store. The town she lives in is far from the city, so her store has been a very big help in the community, as her neighbors need basic food products daily. For two years she has been able to satisfy her customers' needs, but as their needs change and grow, she's worried she won't be able to keep up with the demand. As a result, she has invested in a yuca crop which she hopes will bring in enough capital to grow her business. As she watches over her yuca crop, she also works at her store. Let's help her make her wish a reality.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Senobia, posee una pequeña bodega dentro de su comunidad que ha sido de gran ayuda para sus vecinos quienes se encuentran alejados de la ciudad y requieren de alimentos de primera necesidad diariamente.Ella a lo largo de 2 años ha podido abastecer a sus vecinos pero cada vez es más preocupante este hecho debido a que las necesidades de sus queridos clientes van en aumento; razón por la cual ha invertido un gran capital de dinero en el cultivo de yuca que espera le pueda dejar buenas ganancias para incrementar y fortalecer su negocio; mientras aguarda la cosecha trabaja en su bodega.Posibilitemos su petición para que pronto este deseo pueda convertirse en realidad.

loans.use:
To buy more quantity and variety of basic foods for her small store.
.

loans.name: Budumuli East F A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Immaculate A.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and selling bitengi clothes and is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Immaculate is 36 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman for work. She has 3 children ranging from ages 3 to 14 and her children go to school. Each week, Immaculate makes approximately UGX 90000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use. Immaculate has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 150000 in order to buy stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Immaculate is joined in her small group by Hanifah M. and Ruth N.. Hanifah M. has a business running a restaurant and wants to add equipment and start another restaurant. Ruth N. is currently operating a business selling used clothes and wants a loan to purchase more clothes.

loans.use: To expand tailoring business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce S. is a trader who owns a provision store. She is married and has three children. Business is going very well and she plans to increase sales to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

She is asking for $825.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Winifred Nakalema ’S Group

texts.en:
N. Winifred is 36 years old, married, and has eight children, ranging from 18 years to 4-year-old twins. she appears first from the left in the photo. She lives in the Nalukolongo, a suburb of Kampala. Her business is selling produce and charcoal at the market, which she has been doing for ten years.

Produce is expensive at times, but she buys sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes in the village directly from the farmers before selling them in the open market. Charcoal she also buys in the village, 25 sacks at a time. Each sack costs 21,000/= (Ugandan shillings, about $12 US), including truck transport to her market stall. She makes a profit of about 4,000/= (about $2.50) per sack of charcoal.

With a new loan, she wants to get more charcoal to sell. A loan will also help pay school fees for her children. Ultimately, her goal is to build rental houses. She has successfully serviced more than 7 loans.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 56-year-old Florence N..  She is married, and has four children aged between 22 and 28. She has two dependents, who live with her because they are orphans.  In 1997, Florence, assisted by her sister, established her poultry business.  Raising kuku (chickens) is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Florence has already received and successfully repaid four loans from SELFINA, and now requests a loan to purchase additional chicks and feed. In the future, Florence plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad baji is the wife of M., and she lives in the city known as Chichawatni in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, and she has been living there for the last 16 years. She is the mother of six children: three daughters and three sons. Her husband sells wheat, and he has been in this profession for the last 4 years. Shamshad baji is a housewife, and she prefers to do house-related work. She is applying for a loan in order to buy more wheat for her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by the following members: (1) Nasreen baji, who seeks a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle); (2) Naziran baji, who requests a loan to buy cotton and to resell such cotton; (3) Razia baji, who would like a loan to buy fruits to sell; and (4) Bushran baji, who asks for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., to repair/purchase rickshaws, to purchase cotton and fruits, etc.)

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca N. is 25 years old. She is married with three children aged eleven, nine and one. She has been selling vegetables since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Rebeca is applying for a loan to increase her vegetable inventory.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Mtumwa's Mnyonge Hanuni Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa, 24 years old and married with one child aged two, has been a clothng and shoe seller since March of this year. She works everyday day at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $67 from her sales.

Mtumwa is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes and shoes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who won a salon and a food vending business respectively.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan K., 56, is married and lives with three of her five children in the Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$2 each day and are supported by two children working in the casino building. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Chan K. included. She is asking for a loan of US$800 to make two investments. First, she will spend US$300 to purchase a water pump, and second, she will spend the rest of the money to purchase another plot of farmland to expand her plantation. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and land.

loans.name: Rocio Marleny

texts.es:
Rocio es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Rocio es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Rocio vende pollos para criar y hoja de coca que compra de la empresa nacional de coca, para lo cual cuenta con un registro, los pollitos los compra de las granjas, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes ferias de la región y de las ferias compra quesos, carnes que vende a las tiendas y casas.
Rocio necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pollitos bebes.
Los sueños de Rocio son tener casa propia, brindar una buena educación a su hijo y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rocio is a member of the Legioncito Community Bank. She is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has a son. She sells chicks for people to raise, as well as coca leaves which she buys from the national coca leaf producer where she has an account. The baby chicks are bought from farms and then sold at various local markets from which she also buys cheeses and meat to sell in stores and from door-to-door. Rocio needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy baby chicks. Her dreams are to own her own house, to educate her son well, and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baby chicks

loans.name: Patricia Pilar

texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the Lirio (“Iris”) Village Bank. She is 40 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their 7-year-old child. Patricia studied nursing, but she doesn’t practice. Patricia runs a store in her parents’ house on a busy street in Ayacucho, where she sells dry goods, fruits, vegetables, phone cards, and gifts. She works every day of the week, and her mother helps her run the store. Patricia also works as an administrator for a transport company in her free time.  Patricia needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy toys, fruitcake, and milk for the Christmas season.  Patricia’s dreams are to buy a plot of land to build a house on, to buy a car, and to expand her business. 

 Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Patricia es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio. 
Patricia es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 1 hijos de 7 de años, de profesión enfermera, Patricia tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres ubicado en una calle concurrida, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, tarjetas telefónicas, regalos, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su mama. Además Patricia en sus momentos libres trabaja como administradora de una empresa de transporte. 
Patricia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de juguetes, panetones, leche, para la navidad. 
Los sueños de Patricia son comprar un terreno para construir su casa, comprar un carro y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy toys, fruitcake, and milk for Christmas

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Felicia esta casada con el Sr. Mario y tienen una bebita de10 meses.
Ellos trabajan juntos en un puesto que tienen en el micro centro  donde venden y repara celulares de todas las marcas.-
Ellos se iniciaron en le ramo con el capital que consiguieron con la liquidación de un trabajo que tenían. 
Hoy día ya tiene una buena cantidad de mercaderías para poder salir adelante. 
Tienen su casa en le barrio remansito y ambos demostraron ser buenas personas y muy responsable en el  pago de sus cuotas en otros créditos que llevaron anterior mente.
texts.en:
Felicia is married to Mario and they have a little 10-month-old baby. They work together at a stand they have in the shopping center where they sell and repair all brands of cell phones. They began in the industry with capital they obtained from the liquidation of a business they had previously. At present time, they have a good amount of merchandise in order to move forward and get ahead. They make their home in the Remansito neighborhood and they both have shown themselves to be good people and have been very responsible in repaying other loans that they previously carried.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various makes and models of cell phones.

loans.name: Shodi

texts.ru: Козиев Шоди живет со своей семьей в самом отдаленном кишлаке города Яван. Занимается земледелием , а так же животноводством , то есть купле продажей мелко и крупно рогатого скота. Кредит планирует использовать для того, чтобы закупить сено и другие виды комбикорма для своих животных. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Шоди 47 лет и опыт  в данном бизнесе составляет 18 лет. У него большая семья , где растут четверо очень работящих детей детей.
texts.en:
Shodi Q. lives with his family in the most distant village outlying Yavan City. He farms and raises livestock, raising cattle which he then sells. He plans to take out a loan to purchase hay and other feed for his cattle. He can repay the credit within 12 months. He is 47 years old and has been raising cattle for 18 years. He has a big family, raising four very industrious children.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle feed

loans.name: Mrs. Nhoeum Kong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people living in Prey Khmer village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan group. The members will use the loan for various purposes. 

Mrs. Nhoeum K. is the 46-year-old village bank president. She is a grocer. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy a more groceries for her business so she can earn more income. Mrs. Nhoeum K. is a widow with two children. One child is employed in a garment factory. The other is a construction worker. 

Ten members in this group have end-of-term (EoT) loans; the rest have monthly payment loans. The members with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a more groceries

loans.name: Yagliba

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’agoè telessou un quartier au nord de  Lomé, elle a pour activité la vente de boisson locale qui est très apprécié au Togo et est faite à base de farine de sorgho, sa production a diminué. Elle voudrait rehausser sa production c’est pourquoi elle s’est adressée à wages pour demander un crédit afin de pouvoir s’acheter un sac de sorgho. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Agoè Telessou neighborhood, in the north of Lomé. Her business consists in selling a local beverage, very much appreciated in Togo, and made out of sorghum flour. Her production has decreased, and she would like to bolster it. So she turned to Kiva's partner WAGES to seek a loan in order to buy a sack of sorghum. She's married and the mother of 5 children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one sack of sorghum

loans.name: Rukany

texts.en:
Rukany is currently in the business of selling green vegetables and is requesting a loan to buy a motor-bike for the transportation of vegetables to the market. Rukany is 42 years old and is widowed. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy a motor-bike for the transportation of vegetables to market

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en: Rasela T., 58, is married with 6 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the village and the general public 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about US $157).  SPBD loans are Rasela’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  All her loan will be spent on the business.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Roberto S. está agradecido por el gran apoyo que le brindaron en el crédito anterior su negocio a crecido bastante y tiene mas ingresos.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para la comprar de mercancía de verdura y carnes frías, ya que sus clientes se lo están pidiendo. y así su negocio tendrá más ingresos para darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto S. is grateful for the great assistance he received through his previous loan--his business has grown quite a bit and he has more income. He is once again seeking a loan to purchase merchandise such as vegetables and fried meats, which his customers are ordering. His business will earn more and he will be able to provide all the best for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
" I started my business using my own savings of Php 2,000. I was a saleslady before in a mall and I was not happy about my job and decided to quit. I'm happy with my business now. I am the boss of my own business and hope to make it prosper in the coming months. The income that I get from fish selling really helps a lot in buying all our needs," says Merlinda F., 38-year-old mother of six children.

She would like to add to the amount of fish she sells. She wants to access a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional fish to sell. The loan will really help her increase the income for her family.

CEVI provides credit to support small business growth. In addition to that, they also offer training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=73608&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Angélica es conviviente tiene 50 años el último de sus cinco hijos esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Angélica empezó vendiendo de todo probando cual le rendía mas, hasta que se quedo vendiendo golosinas se ganaba mas. Tiene dos años vendiendo.
Desde que Angélica esta en Finca aprendió a ser puntual en todo, le justa estar en el Bancomunal por que tiene amigas salen a  comer  y a conversar de cómo mejorar  sus negocios. 
Angélica necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para arreglar su carreta  y la compra de golosinas, galletas, chocolate. 
 El sueño de Angélica es crecer mas en el negocio para juntar capital para abrir una carpintería en su casa para que sus hijos trabajen.
texts.en:
Angélica's first loan is located here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=73608&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Angélica is married by common law, is 50, and the youngest of her 5 children goes to public school. Angélica started selling a little bit of everything to see what would be most profitable for her, and she settled on selling candy because she earned the most this way. She has sold them for 2 years. Since Angélica has worked with Finca, she has learned to be punctual with everything. She likes being a part of her communal bank because she has friends there and they go out to eat and talk about how to improve their businesses. Angélica needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to fix her cart and to purchase candy, cookies, and chocolate. Angélica's dream is to grow her business more to obtain enough capital to open a carpentry shop in her home so her children can work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her cart

loans.name: Las Perlas Group

texts.es:
Irene H. es una señora de 24 años, casada con 2 hijos. Ella vive en una localidad llamada El Recreo, a 2 horas del Puerto de Veracruz la cual es un poblado que se dedica principalmente a la siembra de Arroz, Pepino, Sandia, Melon y Tomate.

Doña Irene se dedica principalmente a la venta de ropa para dama, adicionalmente a esto vende utencilios de plastico para la cocina. Estas ventas las hace en su localidad con sus vecinos y familiares. Ella solicita el credito ya que compra la ropa en otra ciudad y necesita el prestamo para comprar la mercancia y el traslado a la ciudad donde la compra. 

La meta de la señora es poder construir en un futuro un local frente a su casa para tener ahi su mercancia. Y asi poder ayudar a su esposo y poder brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Doña Irene es la representante de un Grupo llamado Las Perlas, el cual esta conformado por 4 mujeres. Las cuales se dedican entre otras actividades a la venta de refresco, venta de calzado por catalogo y corte de pelo. 

Por ello solicitan un credito de $20,000 para poder invertir en sus actividades economicas.
texts.en:
Irene H. is a 24 year old, married, woman who has two children. She lives in an area called El Recreo that is two hours from Puerto de Veracruz. The people in her town primarily make a living by growing: rice, cucumber, watermelon, melon, and tomatoes. Doña Irene mostly sells woman’s clothing for a living, but she also sells plastic silverware. She makes most of her sales in her neighborhood to her friends and family. She buys her merchandise in another town and is asking for a loan to buy and transport her merchandise. Her goal is to eventually build a store in front of her house. In this way she could help her husband and provide her children with a better future. Doña Irene is the representative of the group called “Las Perlas” that is made up of four women. They sells soft drinks, shoes (by catalog), and cut hair. This is why they are asking for a loan of 1,500 to be able to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara Ropa de Dama

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 30 years old. She is married and mother with two children who are currently in school. She lives with her husband and the children in a community in the western region of Ghana. She is trader who sells salt fish in bulk in the community market. She gets her stock of goods from Kumasi. It is her desire to save for her children's education. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock so she can use the profit to assist the husband in taking care of the children's educational needs. She believes that the loan will prevent her from frequent travel to Kumasi. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy salt fish in bulk.

loans.name: Ona

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Абдурахмонова Она-Уроженка Джабаррасуловского района, молодая женщина 26 ти лет, со средним образованием, имеет 3их детей и хорошего мужа. Её муж Суюнов Абдулазиз вместе со своей женой торгует на базаре сельхоз. продуктами на местном рынке. У него большой ассортимент продуктов,  которых они закупают у дехкан по низкой цене и продают за приемлимую цену. Наш кредит помогает им тем что за наличные деньги они закупают товар подешевле, а своих средств им не хватает, поэтому они работают с нашей организацией. Им это нравится и в дальнейшем они намереваются   продолжать с нами работать.
texts.en:
Ona A. was born in the Jabbar Rasulov district. She is a young, 26-year-old woman, who has secondary education, 3 children and a good husband. Her husband, Abdulaziz Suyunov, and his wife sell agricultural products at a local market. He has a wide selection of products that they purchase from farmers at a low price and resell at an acceptable price. Our credit helps them because they use the cash to buy the products cheaper and do not have enough of their own means. This is why they are working with our organization. They like this and plan to continue working with us in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of onions

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga M. lives in the village of Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 51 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a farm where she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately $125 a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Dominga joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her life and ability to engage in business. Dominga is requesting a loan of $125 to buy seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She will use thuis loan, her first, to increase her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households in Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental
