loans.name: Adonai Plus Group

texts.fr:
Chantal Mambweni est dirigeante du groupe « Adonaї Plus », composé de 28 membres solidairement unis pour recevoir des crédits de l’IMF HOPE RDC en vue de développer leurs activités. 
Chantal a comme activité principale,  la vente des fruits et d’habits dans un marché périphérique situé à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Elle a acquit depuis 1990, une expérience solide dans ce domaine et travaille durement avec une bonne gestion afin de réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour un magasin d’habillements. Son souci est aussi d’atteindre l’autosuffisance financière dans son affaire qui lui procure mensuellement un bénéfice de $180. C’est pourquoi elle met à profit tous ses talents et ses relations pour atteindre ces objectifs. Chantal est cliente fidèle de l’IMF HOPE RDC qui a obtenu trois fois les crédits et les a remboursés correctement. Elle compte avec le prochain prêt, renforcer le stock de ses marchandises en achetant des habits à revendre en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Agée de 35 ans, Chantal est célibataire avec un enfant qui va à l’école.
texts.en:
Chantal Mambweni is the director of the group “Adonaї Plus” made up of 28 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Chantal’s main business is selling fruit and clothes in a market to the west of Kinshasa. Since 1990 she has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realise her dream of one day opening a clothes shop. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that earns her $180 per month. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. Chantal is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having three times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of products with her next loan by buying clothes and reselling them at a profit. 35 years old, Chantal is single and has one child who goes to school.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale at a profit

loans.name: Mrs.chanra Chuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanra C. is a Khmer cake maker. She is 24 years old and the mother of two children who are just 1 and 3 years old. Her husband, Mr. Soth Kork, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In his plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile, which has a bad effect on his crops. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Chanra C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for the field to make the soil more productive.

Mrs. Chanra C. is the village bank president. This village bank loan is for ten people living in Serei Duoch village in Takeo province. The members will use the loan for different purposes.

Nine members in this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans and one member has a monthly payment loan. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger tiene 44 años, vive a lado a su esposa y sus 5 hijos que están estudiando, el mayor en la universidad y los demás en el nivel secundario y primario del colegio. Él se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches en la parte de afuera de su casa, los platillos que prepara son salchipapas (papas y salchichas fritas), salchipolllos (pedazos de pollo, salchicha y papas fritas), anticuchos (brochetas) y choncholines (vísceras de res fritas), todos ellos, platos típicos de su región. Para esto cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien es la encargada de atender a los clientes. En esta labor lleva un periodo de 3 años, sin embargo no es la única actividad a la que se dedica, pues también es profesor desde hace 18 años. Lo que le gusta a Roger de sus actividades es que lo mantienen activo, no trabaja cansado y le son muy rentables, ya que el ingreso diario que tiene con la venta de comida es para sus gastos familiares y con su sueldo mensual de docente cubre la educación de sus hijos.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes trabajan bien y se dan confianza unos a otros para seguir adelante. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mesas y sillas para su negocio, porque las que tiene actualmente no abastecen a sus clientes que diariamente acuden a su pequeño puesto. Y con otra parte del dinero seguirá ahorrando para comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
Roger is 44 years old, he lives with his wife and their 5 children who are in school. The oldest child is in college and the others are in secondary and primary school. Roger sells food outside his home at night. He prepares salchipapas (french fries and sausages), salchipollos (chicken, sausage, and french fries), anticuchos (kebabs), and choncholines (fried cow intestine), all typical dishes of the region. He depends on the help of his wife, who attends to their customers. He has done this work for 3 years, however, it is not his only work activity. Roger has been a professor for 18 years. What Roger likes best about his work is that it keeps him busy but doesn't tire him and it is very profitable. The daily income he earns selling food covers household expenses and his monthly salary as a professor pays for education for his children. This is his second loan with MFP and what Roger likes about his community bank is that between all the members they work well together and give each other the confidence to keep advancing. With the money he is requesting, he will buy tables and chairs for his business. He currently doesn't have anywhere to seat the customers that come to his small food stand every day. With another portion of the money he will continue saving in order to buy land.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of furniture for business.

loans.name: Celia Del Pilar

texts.es:
Celia es una socia trabajadora y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 45 años, se dedica a la venta de jugos, ella vende todos los días desde muy temprano, su kiosco se encuentra instalado en la vereda de su casa, ella es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Soñadoras Il” desde hace cuatro años, donde siempre se ha caracterizado por su dinamismo y puntualidad, El primer crédito que recibió fue de 500 soles, que fue utilizado para comprar productos de belleza para vender.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 3000 soles para comprar vasos, jarras para su negocio de venta de jugos.  La otra parte la utilizará para comprar joyas, negocio en el que piensa incursionar.
La meta de Celia es tener un local para su juguería mas grande e implementarlo para la atención de más clientes.
texts.en:
Celia is a hardworking and optimistic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 45 years old and she sells juices. She sells juices beginning early every day. Her kiosk is located on the sidewalk to her house. She is the mother of two older children. She has been a member of the “Mujeres Soñadoras II” communal bank for the past four years, where she is noted for her dynamism and punctuality. The first loan that she received was for 500 PEN, which was used to purchase beauty products to sell.

She currently needs a loan of 3000 PEN to purchase cups and pitchers for her juice selling business. She will use the other part of the loan to purchase jewelry, a business which she plans to enter.

Celia’s goal is to have a bigger place for her juice bar and set it up to be able to attend to more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cups and pitchers, and to purchase silver jewelry to sell

loans.name: Sharavjamst

texts.en: O. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son, 19, attends university; her oldest daughter, 17, attends a local secondary school; and her youngest daughter, 4, attends a local kindergarten. Her husband works as a miner during the summer months and helps O. with her business during the winter months. O. operates an electronic appliances business in a shipping container in the local market. She began her business in 2006 with working capital of 6,000,000 tugrugs (about $4,200) and over the years, her business has grown. It now has a working capital of 10,000,000 tugrugs ( about $7,000). She also operates a second business at night making ger covers. With her business success, she has managed to buy a car for her family and hopes to continue paying her children’s tuition fees in order to give them a brighter future. O. is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug loan in order to import electronic appliances and ger materials from China. XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To import electronic appliances and ger materials from China

loans.name: Engels Daniel

texts.es: Engels Daniel tiene la edad de 31 años, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo y está muy contento pues lo que más le gustaría tener era su propia familia. Su actividad económica es la de brindar el servicio de cyber, hace mas de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que la necesidad de generar una fuente de ingresos y con mucho mas motivos ahora que tiene a su hijo. A pesar de las dificultades que Engels enfrento como fue la energía eléctrica porque cuando tenía apagones la mayoría de sus equipos se dañaron pues algunas veces no tenia reguladores de energía.  El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de papelería, discos, memoria, borradores, grapas, tijeras entre otros productos. Su deseo es establecer otro cyber que le genere mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Engels Daniel is 31 years old and has one dependent child. He is extremely happy because what he wanted most was to have his own family. He earns his living by providing Internet services and has been in this line of business for more than four years. His son provides him more motivation and serves as a reminder of his need to earn an income. Engels has experienced some challenges, such as power outages. Most of his equipment has suffered some damage because sometimes he does not have surge protectors readily available.

The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy paper, disks, memory, erasers, staples, scissors, and other products. Engels hopes to open another cybercafé so that he can earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy supplies

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda R. is a 71-year-old mother of eight and a grandmother of eight. She and her husband, Alejo, live in the village of Su-ay, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. Linda has a general store adjacent to her house that she keeps well-stocked with the help of her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, of which she has been a member since 1996. When she first started her business, she had no prior experience, but she has become a shrewd store owner over the years. With the help of her children, the general store has expanded in its product offerings, which now includes the selling of coconut wine in front of her store; she also sells coconut wine wholesale to people from other localities. Her business activities provide her an average income of 12,000 PHP per month. 

Linda's previous loan of 18,000 PHP was used as additional working capital for her general store, and, after repaying that loan, she is renewing the loan by borrowing the same amount of 18,000 PHP, so that she can continue sustaining the business volume of her general store and coconut wine business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieve realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Cesar Andrés

texts.es:
Cesar Andrés V. B. es un joven de 21 años de edad quien vive en una comunidad llamada El Saíno de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios, lo que ayuda a mitigar el efecto de inmigración.

Cesar trabaja en una planta exportadora de piña, pero los fines de semana y días libres se dedica a su plantación la cual la tiene en un terreno alquilado. Su deseo de superación lo ha llevado a trabajar horas extras para así tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto para el como para su pequeña  hija.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita es un micro crédito de ¢530,000 (quinientos treinta mil colones), para comprar hijos de piña, fertilizantes y diferentes insumos para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensado y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 

César es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Luz del Futuro Saino, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Cesar Andrés V. B. is a young man 21 years old who lives in a community called El Saíno de Pital located in the province of Alajuela. The community's primary productive activity is cattle farming and agriculture with an emphasis on the cultivation of pineapple, which is sold mostly in international markets. For this reason, the development of the community has been growing the last few years generating a large demand for the products and services which is helping mitigate the effect of immigration. Cesar works in a pineapple exportation plant, but on his weekends and free days he works on his plantation which is on rented land. His wish is to overcome the need to work extra hours to have a better quality of life both for him and for his young daughter. The micro credit loan he is asking for right now is for ¢530,000 (five hundred thirty thousand colones), to buy baby pineapple plants, fertilizers and different consumables to give the best maintenance and assistance possible to his crops. In the end he will be able to be rewarded and will have a much better production. César is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Luz del Futuro Saino, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. It will be his first loan and he requests it with the hope of continuing to grow both on a personal and economic level. Also, he emphasizes his thanks for this type of organization and all the credit facilitators that allow him to dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumabels to maintain and plant pineapple

loans.name: Sinddy Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Sinddy Patricia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Audaces”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 25 años y no tiene hijos.

Sinddy patricia, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron muy buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. Poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos, así que decidió implementar su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, ya es conocida por sus clientes fijos que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Encarna, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando más lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Sinddy Patricia belongs to the community bank "Mujers Audaces" (Bold Women) in the district of Moyobamba, province of Moyabamba, in the department of San Martín. She is single, twenty five years old, and does not have any kids.

Sinddy Patricia is a woman who has overcome many difficulties in her path through life. Her desire to succeed led to very good results and today, with the business that she runs, she feels very happy with what she has achieved. Little by little she was generating her own income, and because of this she decided to start her own business selling sodas in a very pleasant context in her own home. She is already well know by her regular clients who are neighbors, family, and friends.

With this loan of $525, she will buy more drinks such as: crates of sodas in different flavors, sizes, and brands as wells as mineral water with and without gas.

She is very greatful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her when she most needed it, is responsible with her repayments, and intends to continue in this way.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crates of sodas

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora D. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 38 years old. Flora is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Flora owns and operates a business venture raising livestock in the agricultural sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Flora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Flora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Maria Vidal

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Vidal I. tiene 65 años de edad, vive en el barrio las Brisas de la ciudad de Nacaome, Maria se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en la cual vende papel higienico, jabones, churros, venenos para zancudos, cloro, desinfectante de pisos etc.
en estos momentos la sra. Maria necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio que es su unica fuente de ingresos. Maria es una mujer de edad y esta es la unica actividad que puede realizar para ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
Maria Vidal I., 65, lives in the Las Brisas neighborhood of Nacome. She sells popular consumption items in a small grocery store. She stocks toilet paper, soap, mosquito poison, chlorine bleach, floor disinfectant, etc. Maria needs funding to stock her store, which is her only source of income. Maria is a senior citizen and this is the only kind work that she is able to do to support herself.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soaps, beans, rice, sugar, tortillas, toilet paper and mosquito poison.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, de 38 años, es una laboriosa mujer que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en su casa propia.

Se inició en la venta de productos de belleza gracias al consejo de una amiga, la cual ya estaba inmersa en este negocio y en el cual lograba buenos ingresos. Es por ello que Olga animada a correr con la misma suerte, incursionó en esta actividad comprando algunos productos para probar suerte, felizmente su buen poder de convencimiento la favoreció para lograr buenas ventas y desde entonces se dedica completamente a este negocio, dedicándole prácticamente todo el día para visitar y ofrecer sus productos. Esta actividad le ha servido de mucho para el sustento de su familia y ella espera consolidar su negocio.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente muy segura de cumplir con todos los pagos puntualmente. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos para tenerlos en stock, especialmente bloqueadores solares que es lo que más se vende en esta época de verano.
texts.en:
Olga is 38 years old and a hard working woman who sells beauty products. She lives with her husband and three children in their own home. She started selling beauty products thanks to the advice of a friend who was already earning a good income in the business. Olga was motivated to try her luck, so she bought a few items to give it a try. Happily, her good salesmanship helped her make good sales, so now she does this full time, spending practically the whole day visiting customers and offering products. This has helped her support herself and her family. Now she would like to consolidate her business. This will be her first loan through MFP and she feels very certain that she will be able to make all of her payments on time. She will use the money to buy larger quantities of cosmetics, in order to keep them in stock. She especially wants to have sun block available, as this is what she sells most of during the summer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Sainbayar

texts.en:
Sainbayar is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvs province, Mongolia. His oldest child, Zulaa, is 7 years old and is a secondary school student. His youngest child attends kindergarten. He and his family live together in a small house.

Sainbayar operates a grocery store in his town. He started his business in 2003, at first selling from a small food kiosk. After steadily growing his business he was able to expand to his current store. In 2005, He also began operating a taxi service in his town. His wife, Nyamgerel, is very supportive of her husband and works as a salesperson in their store when he is busy driving the taxi.

Sainbayar has used his business success to build a new house for his family near their grocery store. He is a very hardworking person who has great communication skills. He says, “I have many ideas to expand my business further and I hope it will allow me to add on to my house and purchase a new car."

Sainbayar is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a variety of food products such as candies and fruit for his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of food products for his grocery store

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is married with two children. Both of her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she stays with four people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Rehema takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include rent, medication, school fees and feeding the family. Rehema owns a shop selling second hand clothing. Besides this clothing business, she also sells soft drinks like sodas and passion fruits.  She works seven days a week. Rehema receives at least 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people at retail. Rehema has been in this business for four years and her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She has been with MCDT for a few years servicing her 12th loan.  She wants to use this loan to increase her stock by buying more bales of second hand clothes, crates of soda and passion fruits. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and start going directly to Mombasa for second hand clothes. She joined MCDT because she wanted to work with women.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, soda and passion fruit

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella B., a resident of the village of Talakag, Bukidnon, is 43 years old, separated from her spouse, and has one infant. To make a living, Estrella owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Estrella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPF that was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, she is now requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. Estrella plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy tiene todo el espíritu de salir adelante, pues siempre le ha gustado su negocio. Su actividad económica es la venta de comida y un kiosco. Por lo que siempre ha trabajado por proporcionarles a sus 2 hijos lo necesario. El dio inicio a esta actividad hace 3 años, el ha logrado crecer gradualmente, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes son amigos de Freddy además esto le ha generado mucha experiencia en el negocio. Es por eso que sueña con poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su local.
texts.en:
Freddy has all the spirit he needs to get ahead because he loves his store. He sells food and snacks in his stand. He has always worked to give his 2 children what they need. He started this business 3 years ago and it has managed to grow gradually because most of his clients are his friends. He has developed a lot of experience with his business. For all of these reasons he dreams of being able to improve his home. This loan will be to purchase supplies for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is married with eight children and six of her children go to school. She takes care of her old mother.  Catherine resides and owns a one-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Catherine owns a store selling charcoal.  She buys bags of charcoal from the villages of Luwero district and uses public transport to and from the villages. Catherine sells to all categories of people at retail and wholesale. She wants to use this loan of 600,000/= to buy more bags of charcoal. Catherine has been in this business for 10 years and also with MCDT for 10 years. She doesn’t have any side business apart from this charcoal business. She doesn’t pay rent for her business because she works from her home.  She aspires to increase her business and start selling at wholesale only. She joined MCDT because it was near her home.  Catherine’s monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda P. is a 52-year-old married woman who lives in Prk Luna, Brgy Mabini, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by keeping a vegetable plantation and selling the products.

Glenda’s 57-year-old husband, Danilo, is a farmer, and they have 4 children who are adults while the others are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Glenda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 40,000 from her business activities.

Glenda is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 15,000 was used to fund operations of her vegetable plantation, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 15th cycle loan, in the amount of Php 20,000, which she intends to use on her vegetable plantation and in selling the products. Glenda is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Working capital for her vegetable plantation

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Sandra Maria tiene 29 años, su actividad económica es la venta de recargas telefónicas y alquiler de triciclos. Hace más de 5 años que tiene esta actividad, pues dio inicio con el propósito de apoyar a su compañero y mantener a sus 2 hijos por lo que también tiene que ayudar a sufragar los gastos del hogar, no es la primera vez que Sandra realiza financiamientos pues siempre está pensando en el buen mantenimiento del negocio y es mediante estos créditos que su negocio se ha mantenido. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de recargas y realizarles mejoras a algunos triciclos que lo necesitan. El sueño de ella es tener un cyber pues hasta los momentos no ha podido cumplirlos por la falta de recursos.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria is 29 years old. She sells mobile phone electronic loads and rents out tricycles. Sandra started her business more than five years ago with the intention of helping her partner with supporting their two children and paying for the household expenses.

This is not the first time Sandra has received a loan since she has used them to maintain her business. She is requesting a loan to buy electronic loads and make fixes to a few tricycles that are in need of repair. Her dream is to have a cybercafé, but at the moment she is not able to achieve this goal due to a lack of resources.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electronic loads & pay for tricycle repairs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a manicure and pedicure business. She lives in Barangay Tapon, Dalaguete, Cebu City.

Jocelyn has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her manicure and pedicure business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000.

Jocelyn is now borrowing PHP 28,000 so that her can have additional working capital for her business. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.

Jocelyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. In the accompanying photo Jocelyn (in red) poses with one of her customers. 


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Cornelio M. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 46 years old. Cornelio is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cornelio owns and operates a furniture-making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling cabinets and bedroom and dining room furniture to local businesses and community members. Cornelio has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cornelio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cornelio is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand his product offerings. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Cornelio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand his product offerings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build a room in her house

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena J., age 40, and her husband Arsenio have two children in high school and work hard to cover daily expenses and schooling costs.  For the past ten years, Elena has owned and run her own sari-sari store (general store) and vegetable stand.

Elena has requested a PHP 10,000 loan to purchase additional inventory for her store, including soft drinks and snacks.  The loan helps her buy in bulk so she can save money on transportation. She hopes additional inventory will help her attract more customers and eventually expand her business. 

Elena has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for several loan cycles and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.*  She hopes that earnings from her business will continue to provide for her children's schooling.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: additional inventory for her little store

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
L. socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE ETERNO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito D. Huanchac perteneciente a L. provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

L. socia Carmen; tiene 23 años D. edad y es soltera, elL. trabaja principalmente en telecomunicaciones, elL. es impulsadora D. una muy conocida marca D. celulares en L. región, L. socia paralelamente a esto trabaja animando fiestas infantiles, elL. estudio repostería y le fascina elaborar todo en chocolate, elL. alquiL. a todos los eventos, sus fuentes D. chocolate,  también realiza figuras en globos y decorado D. ambientes según el tipo D. fiesta o reunión que se tenga, L. socia necesita un capital para invertir en su negocio e implementar su vajilL. y material D. trabajo. L. socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su pequeño negocio.

L. socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Carmen, 23, is single. Her main job is in telecommunications. She works as a Sales Agent for a very well known brand of cellular phones in the region. She also works as an entertainer at children’s parties. She studied pastry making and she loves to make everything out of chocolate. She rents her chocolate fountain to all kinds of events and she also makes balloon figures and does party decorations according to the type of party or get-together it is. She needs capital to invest in her business and acquire a set of dinnerware and other work related materials. She is asking for the loan to invest in her small business. She is a member of the “PADRE ETERNO” (Eternal Father) communal bank located in Huanchac, Cusco province, Cusco department. She makes us of this forum to express her gratituD. for the loan and to commit to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her small business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr:
Femme célibataire de 42ans, mère de 3 enfant dont varie entre 12 et 4ans.
En 1996, elle se lance dans la restauration pour se prendre en charge.

Par jour elle vend 50000f   et ses bénéfices sont de 8000f, elle faits des plats promotionnels pour attirer ces clients qui sont les passants, les étudiants et habitants de son quartier.
Avec le prêt actuel, elle va renforcer son commerce en faisant beaucoup de réserve tel que 1sacde riz, 1bidon de 25litres d’huile, 1filet d’oignon, 1carton de tomates, du poisson fumé, du poisson salé, 10litres d’huile de palme, de l’haricot blanc et les arachides.

Dans le souci d’élargir son activité, elle voudra ouvrir un restaurant plus moderne et faire plus de bénéfices afin d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et celui de ses enfants en soutenant leurs scolarités.
texts.en:
This 42-year-old single woman is the mother of three children whose ages range between 4 and 12 years old. She started working in the restaurant business in 1996 as a means of financial support. Her daily sales reach 50,000 francs with profits of 8,000 francs. She prepares promotional dishes to attract her customers who consist of people walking by, students and local residents. With this loan, she plans to bolster her activity by increasing her stocks with one sack of rice, one 25-liter can of oil, one bag of onions, one carton of tomatoes, smoked fish, salted fish, ten liters of palm oil, white beans and peanuts. She wants to expand her business with a modernized restaurant and boost her profits to improve her family’s living conditions and pay for her children’s tuition.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, a can of oil, salted fish, onions, smoked fish, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of agricultural nutrients and chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy essential equipment for a beauty salon

loans.name: Temuujin

texts.en:
Temuujin, 30, lives with his wife, four-year-old daughter, and his elder sister in her two bedroom studio apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His parents looks after his daughter.

For two years Temuujin and his wife have run a popcorn-making business, selling their products through some supermarkets and grocery stores. Having gained valuable experience, in the future he plans to expand his business by improving the production line and equipment. Temuujin is now requesting a loan to purchase a car to deliver his products.

loans.use: To buy car for delivery of his products

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco M. es casado, tiene 47 años de edad, con 7 hijos. Se dedica a la venta ambulante de pescado, dicha actividad viene realizando hace 8 años, pero debido a la veda necesita realizar otra actividad, razón por el cual opta por la fabricación y venta de ladrillos porque en esa actividad tiene mucha experiencia y cuenta con un terreno que es apta para realizar su emprendimiento.

 El Sr. M. comenta que tiene un hijo que le puede ayudar y también recibe apoyo de su hermano que tiene un horno para la quema de  25.000 ladrillos. 

 Cabe destacar que son familias muy humildes, pero cuenta con diversas actividades, ya sea en la cría de conejos, gallinas y otros animales, los cuales le sirven para consumo u ingresos agregados.

 Él tiene como sueño mejorar su casa y apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan culminar sus estudios y algún día que sean buenos profesionales.


Solicita el préstamo para la compra de arena y leña para la constrcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Francisco M., age 47, is married and has seven children.  He has been selling fish in an itinerant manner for eight years.  However, due to the end of the season, he needs to carry out another business activity.  That is why he has chosen making and selling bricks.  He has a lot of experience in this business, and he has a piece of land that is suitable for his endeavor.

He has one son who can help him, and he also gets help from his brother who has an oven that burns 25,000 bricks.  It is worth mentioning that they are very humble families.  They have different activities like raising rabbits, chickens, and other animals that serve as food or added income.

His dream is to improve his house and to support his children so that they can finish their education and become good professionals one day. 

He is requesting the loan to buy sand and wood for construction on his house.

loans.use: To buy six loads of sand and wood

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Savoeun K., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Sen, 48, have been married since 1990 and have 8 children - 5 sons and 3 daughters. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Savoeun is a farmer; he grows ginger and other vegetables on his farmland in the village where he lives. His wife sells vegetables. He is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
M. Edson is an individual client from Kihihi. He is 42 years old and married, and he has three children ages 14, 10 and 2 years old. 

He has been selling second-hand clothes for men and women for 10 years. He says that he has no plans to change businesses, but he plans to expand the one he has. 

Edson needs a loan of 2,000,000/= (Kenyan shillings) for 1 year. He works near the Kihihi Town Council and he is able to make 450,000/= (Kenyan shillings) in profits each month in addition to the income from his wife’s salary. 

Before he started his business, he got money from the sale of trees and timber. Since he is a patient person and a hard worker, he hopes to start a wholesale clothing business to earn more money. He needs a loan to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rashidah

texts.en:
Rashidah N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Rashidah has a dairy business, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Rashidah has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more milk. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Rashidah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to sell charcoal. Rashidah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: To purchase more milk for resale
